lamb Butter lamp Butter rebellion Buttered cat paradox Buttered toast phenomenon Butter salt Dairy salt List of spreads Wagasi It is a soft cow s milk cheese Areesh A type of white soft lactic cheese made from laban rayeb 2 Baramily A type of white cheese aged in barrels the name translates to barrel cheese in English Domiati A soft white cheese usually made from cow buffalo milk It is salted heated coagulated using rennet then ladled into wooden molds where the whey is drained away for three days The cheese may be eaten fresh stored in salted whey for up to eight months then matured in brine 3 Domiati cheese accounts for about three quarters of the cheese made consumed in Egypt 4 The cheese takes its name from the city of Damietta and is thought to have been made as early as 332 BC 5 Halumi Similar to Cypriot halloumi yet a different cheese It may be eaten fresh brined spiced The name comes from the Coptic word for cheese halum Istanboly A type of white cheese made from cow buffalo milk similar to feta cheese Mish A sharp salty product made by fermenting cheese for several months in salted whey It is an important part of the diet of farmers 6 Mish is often made at home from areesh cheese 7 Products similar to mish are made commercially from different types of Egyptian cheese such as domiati or rumi with different ages Rumi A hard bacterially ripened variety of cheese 8 It belongs to the same family as Pecorino Romano and Manchego 9 It is salty with a crumbly texture is sold at different stages of aging 6 Ayibe A cottage cheese that is mild crumbly It has little flavor on its own is often served as a side dish to soften the effect of very spicy food Caravane cheese The brand name of a camel milk cheese produced in Mauritania by Tiviski a company founded by Nancy Abeiderrhamane in 1987 The milk used to make the cheese is collected from the local animals of a thousand nomadic herdsmen is very difficult to produce but yields a product that is low in lactose Chhana Fresh unripened curd cheese made from water buffalo milk A crumbly moist form of farmers cheese or paneer it is used to make desserts such as rasgulla Chura kampo Tibetan dried cheese is a Tibetan cheese and important within the cuisine of Tibet Chura kampo is made from the curds that are left over from boiling buttermilk Chura loenpa a Tibetan cheese that is significant within the cuisine of Tibet It is a soft cheese similar to cottage cheese made from the curds that are left over from boiling buttermilk Nguri A buffalo s milk cheese of Fujian province China It is in a ball-shape approximately the size of a table tennis ball has a soft leathery texture Rubing A firm fresh goat milk cheese made in the Yunnan Province of China by people of the Bai and Sani recognized as a branch of the Yi in China minorities 10 Pictured is fried rubing cheese Rushan Pictured is Rushan cheese being grilled Bandel An Asian cheese that originated in a Portuguese colony Bandel located in eastern India Today the production is d in the towns of Tarakeswar and Bishnupur Bankura near Kolkata West Bengal India 11 12 Paneer A fresh cheese common in South Asian cuisine In eastern parts of Indian Subcontinent it is generally called Chhana It is an unaged acid-set non-melting farmer cheese or curd cheese made by curdling heated milk with lemon juice vinegar any other food acids Chhana A fresh unripened curd cheese made from cow or water buffalo milk A crumbly moist form of farmers cheese paneer it is used to make desserts such as rasgulla Produced mostly in eastern Indian states of Odisha and West Bengal it is the chief ingredient of most of the sweets produced here It is used in various Hindu religious rituals The earliest reference of cheese in India dates back to 1400 BCE 13 14 Dahi Chhana Very similar to chhana in texture it has a deep reddish-brown color is more flavorful distinctly tasteful It is rich in whey protein It was generally homemade in Cuttack region of Orissa households but now ts production has become very rare It is produced from traditional buttermilk a big quantity of milk is required to produce even a small amounts of Dahi Chhana It has a long shelf life can be kept in earthen sikkas for months Khoya This cheese is widely used in Indian and Pakistani cuisine It is made of either dried whole milk milk thickened by heating in an open iron pan It is similar to ricotta cheese but lower in moisture 15 Kalari Also known as Kiladi Maish Krej Kashmiri Kalimpong cheese Originates from Kalimpong a hill station in the Indian state of West Bengal When unripe Kalimpong cheese is a little like the Welsh Caerphilly slightly acidic a little crumbly with a relatively smooth edible rind not particularly strong-smelling Dangke Enrekang Regency South Sulawesi Dangke is a traditional food made from buffalo milk fermented traditionally processed Dangke also known for having a protein content of beta-carotene which is quite high Sakura cheese A soft cheese created in Hokkaid Japan It is creamy white flavored with mountain cherry leaves Sakura means cherry blossom in Japanese Imsil Imsil Cheese Village is located near the town of Imsil within the county of Imsil It offers vacation programs for children tourists with programs lasting for one day more in which guests learn how to make cheese The cheese produced there is called Imsil cheese following the county name Byaslag 16 Prepared with cow or yak milk this cheese has a lumpish curd is somewhat sour in flavor 16 Flower of Rajya A firm yak s-milk cheese made in Nepal by Tibetan nomads in collaboration with the Trace Foundation Milk is heated ripened in big copper vats curdled drained molded into 10-12 pound wheels The cheese is dry-cured in Tibetan red salt aged then wrapped in scarves packed in bamboo baskets Chhurpi A yak s-milk cheese influenced by Tibetan cuisine Depending on how it is prepared Chhurpi can be either hard chewy soft Kesong puti A soft white cheese similar to cottage cheese made from unskimmed carabao s milk salt and rennet 17 It has a soft close texture slight salty taste Chechil A brined string cheese that originated in Armenia it has a consistency approximating that of suluguni or mozarella and is produced in the form of dense strings rolled up in a figure eight of thick braid-shaped ropes Bachensteiner Bergk se A group of cheeses produced in the Alps Brimsen An Austrian term for Bryndza Gelundener K se Luneberg cheese A cow s-milk cheese made in mountain valleys in Vorarlberg in western Austria 18 Montafoner Sauerk se The Montafoner Sauerk se dialect Sura Kees in the Walgau and Rhine Valley Sura K s is a cheese made of soured-milk and has its origins in the Vorarlberger Montafon Sour milk cheese is a lean cheese so its fat content is very low The protein content however does not suffer from fat loss due to the cream sabot It is known in Vorarlberg since the 12th century is similar to the Tyrolean grey cheese 19 Mondseer Made from pasteurized milk Mondseer is a semi-solid cheese similar to Muenster cheese or Limburger The surface is brushed by hand with salt water red smear maturation takes four to six weeks The fat content is 45 It has a mild to slightly spicy aroma a sweet sour taste Its natural rind is yellow-orange in color Staazer Steirerk se Tyrolean grey Tiroler Grauk se A strongly flavored rennet -free cows-milk cheese made in the Zillertal Austria It owes its name to the grey mould that usually grows on its rind It is extremely low in fat around 0 5 yet it has a powerful penetrating smell Brussels cheese Made from cow s milk it has a smooth texture a sharp citrus flavor along with a strong salty bite Chimay cheeses Brands varieties of cheeses produced by Chimay Brewery some soaked in Chimay Ale Herve cheese An aged cheese made from unpasteurized cow s milk It is traditionally aged in humid caves Le Wavreumont 20 Produced from cow s milk this cheese is semi-soft its coloration varies from yellow to ivory depending upon the season in which its produced 20 It is made by Fromagerie des Ardennes which is in Ferrieres Belgium 20 Limburger cheese Originated during the 19th century in the historical Duchy of Limburg which is now divided among modern-day Belgium Germany and Netherlands The cheese is especially known for its pungent odor One of the most traditional forms of eating limburger is the limburger sandwich Maredsous cheese A loaf-shaped cheese made from cow s milk The cheese is lightly pressed then washed in brine to create the firm orange crust pungent aroma Passendale cheese Passendale Belgium Named after Passendale the village where it originated it is one of the best-known cheeses in Belgium It resembles a loaf of bread has a round shape a hard but edible brown rind with spots of white Inside the flesh is golden dotted with small holes very creamy It has a firm damp consistency slightly sweet bouquet mild flavor The regular Passendale cheese exists in two variations called Passendale Classic Passendale Prelude 21 Remoudou Land of Herve Belgium It derives its name from the use of milk removed 15 minutes after the usual milking Hence the wallon verb rimoud meaning to re-milk 22 This cheese weighs 200 to 500g When it is washed with salt it gets a strong taste when it is washed with milk it keeps a mild taste It is often sold in pieces Rodoric Liege Belgium An aged cheese made from unpasteurized goat milk that is traditionally aged in humid caves When young the interior is sweet with age the flavor becomes spicy Livno cheese Livno Bosnia Herzegovina The cheese is ready after an average of 60 to 66 days in a controlled environment The flavor is full in older cheeses the taste is slightly piquant The largest producer is Mljekara Livno Lura Dairy d o o Livno with yearly production exceeding 500 metric tons Travni ki Vla i cheese Travnik Bosnia Herzegovina This cheese is produced on Vla i mountain in central Bosnia above the city of Travnik It was originally made from sheep milk but there are varieties made from cow milk This cheese is white in color can either have small irregular holes scattered in it be solid without holes Its taste is dry salty The milk has a special taste that comes from the variety of different herbs that sheep are eating while grazing on the mountain Cherni Vit Cherni Vit Teteven Municipality Lovech Province Made from sheep milk Cherni Vit cheese owes the green color of its crust its characteristic taste to the formation of mold This occurs naturally due to the specific conditions in the region the technology of production Produced for centuries Cherni Vit cheese was nearly extinct in the 2000s until it was rediscovered popularized by Slow Food representatives Kashkaval A type of yellow cheese made of sheep milk cow milk goat milk In Albania Republic of Moldova Bulgaria Republic of Macedonia Serbia and Romania the term is often used to refer to all yellow cheeses or even any cheese other than sirene Sirene A type of brine cheese made in South-Eastern Europe especially popular in Serbia Bulgaria Romania Albania the Republic of Macedonia and Greece It is made of goat milk sheep milk cow s milk a combination of milks 23 It is slightly crumbly with a fat content of about 30 35 It is commonly produced in blocks has a slightly grainy texture Pa ki sir Croatian island of Pag A hard distinctively flavored sheep milk cheese It is generally regarded as the most famous of Croatian artisan cheeses is found in many export markets outside Croatia also known as Godsips cheese kripavac 24 25 Squeaking cheese from Lika Tounjski Smoked cheese from Tounj near Ogulin Dimsi Smoked cheese from Zagreb based on Bjelovarac cheese Akkawi Commonly made using cow milk but can be made with goat or sheep s milk it has a smooth texture a mild salty taste It is now produced on a large scale in the Middle East notably in Israel Palestine Lebanon Syria and Cyprus Anari cheese A fresh mild whey cheese produced in Cyprus Although much less known than other Cypriot cheeses e g halloumi it has started to gain popularity following recent publicity exposure The whey used is usually a by-product in the production process of other harder cheeses commonly that of halloumi or kefalotyri cheese 26 Halloumi A Cypriot semi-hard unripened brined cheese made from a mixture of goat and sheep milk sometimes also cow milk 27 28 29 30 It has a high melting point so can easily be fried or grilled It is noted for its ability to retain its shape under direct heat as a grillable cheese Kefalotyri A hard salty yellow cheese made from sheep or goat s milk in Greece and Cyprus Depending on the mixture of milk used in the process the color can vary between yellow white Abertam cheese A traditional Czech farmhouse hard cheese made from sheep milk It has the shape of an irregular ball with thin yellow to orange natural rind It is used as a table cheese for melting Olomoucke syre ky Lo tice Czech Republic A ripened soft cheese that is easily recognizable per its strong scent yellowish color It is named after the city of Olomouc and contains only 0 6 of fat Danbo A semi-soft aged cow s milk cheese a common household cheese in Denmark The cheese is typically aged between 12 52 weeks in rectangular blocks of 6 9 kg coated with a bacterial culture The culture is washed off at the end of the aging cycle the cheese is packaged for retail sales Danish Blue Danablu is a strong blue-veined cheese This semi-soft creamery cheese is typically drum block shaped has a white to yellowish slightly moist edible rind Made from full fat cow s milk homogenised cream it has a fat content of 25 30 is aged for eight to twelve weeks Esrom Esrom or Danish Port Salut cheese is a Trappist-style pale yellow semi-soft cow s milk cheese with a pungent aroma a full sweet flavour It is a porous cheese with many small holes throughout is slightly elastic buttery in texture Fynbo A semi-hard Danish cheese named after the island of Fyn It has a flavor of buckwheat is processed with a combination of mesophilic thermophilic bacterial cultures Havarti Also known as cream Havarti a semi-soft cow s milk cheese made like most cheeses by introducing rennet to milk to cause curdling The curds are pressed into cheese molds which are drained then the cheese is aged It is a washed curd cheese which contributes to the subtle flavor It is interior-ripened rindless smooth slightly bright-surfaced It has very small irregular openings eyes distributed in the mass Havarti has a buttery aroma can be somewhat sharp in the stronger varieties much like Swiss cheese The taste is buttery from somewhat sweet to very sweet it is slightly acidic Maribo Lolland A semi-hard cheese made from cow s milk It has a firm dry interior a creamy texture many small irregular holes It has a pale tan rind covered in yellow wax Its flavour is tangy it is sometimes seasoned with caraway seeds Molbo Mols A semi-hard cow s milk cheese made in the region of Mols It is very similar to Edam with a delicate light flavour that is slightly tangy salty It has small regular holes is covered in a red wax coating Saga A mix of blue cheese brie creamy blue-veined cheese with a white-mould rind Saga is a very mild blue-veined cheese It comes with a delicate blue mold that may not appear in other varieties of blue cheeses It is aged for more than 60 days Sams cheese Sams A cow s milk cheese named after the island of Sams It is similar to Emmentaler although its flavour is milder gentle nutty in young cheeses pungent with sweet sour notes in older ones Sams s interior has a supple elastic texture a yellow colour a few large irregular holes It is the national cheese of Denmark Vesterhavsost Tybo A cow s milk cheese similar to a mild Sams It is loaf-shaped with a cream-colored holey interior a yellow rind It has a slightly salty smooth lactic flavor Atleet Semi hard cheese with little sour flavor made from cow s milk produced by Valio Eesti Juust Semi hard Dutch-type cheese made from cow s milk produced by Estover Kadaka juust Saaremaa Semi hard smoked cheese made from cow s milk produced by Saaremaa Piimat stus Also available with garlic Aura Blue cheese made from cow s milk produced by Valio Lappi Lapland Made from partially skimmed cow s milk similar to Emmental except that it is pasteurized Leip juusto Southern Ostrobothnia Kainuu Fresh cheese made from cow s beestings Sometimes made from goat or reindeer milk Oltermanni Semisoft cow s milk cheese similar to Danish Havarti Produced by Valio Raejuusto Fresh cheese made from cow s milk similar to cottage cheese Sulguni A pickled Georgian cheese from the Samegrelo region It has a sour moderately salty flavor a dimpled texture an elastic consistency these attributes are the result of the process used as is the source of its moniker pickle cheese Its color ranges from white to pale yellow Sulguni is often deep-fried which masks its odor It is often served in wedges Anthotyros A traditional fresh cheese There are Dry Anthotyros Fresh Anthotyros Dry Anthotyros is a matured cheese similar to Mizithra Anthotyros is made with milk and whey from sheep or goats sometimes in combination The ratio of milk to whey usually is 9-to-1 It is commonly a truncated cone but when shipped in containers may be crumbled as it is removed It may be unpasturized where law allows Chloro Santorini Feta PDO Epirus Macedonia Thrace Thessaly Peloponnese Lesbos Feta is a brined curd white cheese made only in Greece It is made from sheep s milk from a mixture of sheep goat s milk The word feta in Greek means slice 31 Graviera PDO Agrafa Crete Naxos Graviera is a type of Greek hard yellow cheese It is made exclusively from sheep goat milk Kasseri PDO Macedonia Thrace Thessaly Lesbos Kefalograviera PDO Crete Sterea Ellada Kefalotyri Kopanisti PDO Mykonos Malaka Crete Also known as Tiromalama Made from Graviera curd Manouri PDO Thessaly Metsovone PDO Metsovo Epirus Myzithra Crete Tyrozouli Crete Made from Myzithra by adding salt causing dehydration allowing maturation Xynomizithra PDO Crete Myconos Xynotyro Myconos Other PDO cheeses Formaela Arachova Galotyri Thessaly Epirus Kalathaki Limnos Katiki Domokos Ladotyri Lesbos Pichtogalo Chanion Chania Sfela Peloponnese Xygalo Crete Liptauer or K r z tt A spicy cheese spread made with sheep milk cheese 32 goat s milk cheese quark cheese or cottage cheese Orda Made from whey Palpusztai Palpusztai is a Hungarian soft cow s milk cheese known for its pungent odor Trappista cheese Trappista is a traditional Hungarian Bosnian Serbian semi-hard cow s-milk cheese It has a mild flavor melts easily Oazis Smoked cheese Karavan Karavan is a smoked Hungarian cow s milk cheese Pannonia Pannonia Emmentaler is a Hungarian version of the Swiss Emmenthal cheese H f ingi A type of Icelandic cheese described as a creamy-soft almost runny cheese with a white rind crust a smooth mild flavor J i cheese It is a mixture of raw quark and fresh milk but other products can be added Latvijas Kashkaval A type of yellow cheese made of sheep milk In Macedonia the term is often used to refer to all yellow cheeses or even any cheese other than In English-language menus is translated as yellow cheese whereas sirene is usually translated as white cheese simply cheese The taste of the kashkaval is sometimes compared to that of the United Kingdom s cheddar cheese although variations exist Urd An unaged whey cheese Belo Sirenje A type of brine cheese produced in Macedonia called white cheese simply cheese It is made of goat milk sheep milk cow s milk a combination of milks It is slightly crumbly with a fat content of 30 35 It is commonly produced in blocks has a slightly grainy texture bejna Commonly associated with the island of Gozo A small round cheese made from sheep s milk salt and rennet bejniet are prepared served in a variety of forms Until the early 20th century bejniet made from unpasteurised milk were one of the causes of the spread of Brucellosis which was so prevalent as to be called the Maltese fever Kashkaval A type of yellow cheese made of sheep milk In the Moldova the term is often used to refer to all yellow cheeses Urd An unaged whey cheese Bryndza A salty brined cheese made from sheep milk Branz de vaci Made from whole cow milk similar to cottage cheese Brunost A caramelized brown Scandinavian whey cheese Brunost brown cheese is commonly used instead of mysost whey cheese which is the correct name Another variant made using goat milk is referred to sold as geitost Norwegian for goat cheese or in an older Dano-Norwegian spelling no longer used in Norway as gjetost Geitost is made from a mixture of goat s cow s milk ekte geitost real geitost is made with goat s milk only Gamalost Geitost Gudbrandsdalsost Jarlsberg cheese N kkelost Norvegia Pultost Sn frisk Castelo Branco cheese PDO Beira Baixa a cheese named after the city of the same name in Portugal the main city of the district where it is produced The cheese is made from milk produced by either a goat or a ewe has a soft texture Queijo de Nisa PDO Alto Alentejo a semi-hard sheep s milk cheese from the municipality of Nisa It is created from raw milk which is coagulated then curdled using an infusion of thistle Queijo do Pico PDO Azores Originating from the island of Pico this cured cheese is produced in cylindrical formats from cow milk It is considered a fatty cheese the ripening of the cheese forms a yellow exterior irregular crust yellowish-white soft pasty interior Pico cheese has a salty taste a characteristically intense aroma Queijo de Azeit o PDO Azeit o Setubal Sheep s milk cheese originating from the town of Azeit o S o Jorge PDO Azores Produced in the S o Jorge Island this is a hard semi-hard cheese made from unpasteurised cow s milk the pate has small eyes Serra da Estrela PDO Serra da Estrela Produced in a mountainous region this cheeses is made from sheep s milk mostly during the months of November to March The texture of the paste varies depending on its age from a very soft semi-liquid when young to a soft but sliceable solid when older It is a cured cheese created by artisanal producers with a white slightly yellow color a uniform creamy consistency with at most a few small holes in it Requeij o Saloio Brand Santarem cheese Branz de burduf A salty type of cheese prepared with sheep s-milk it has a strong flavor is slightly soft in texture To obtain it sweet ca is cut into small pieces salted then hand-mixed in a large wooden bowl The mixture is then placed in a sheep s stomach into a sheep s skin that has been carefully cleaned sawed on the edges in a tube made of pine bark Branz de Suhaia Ca Sweet non-fermented cheese obtained from cow s sheep s milk Drained in cheesecloth could be eaten fresh smoked further prepared into branz de burduf Ca caval Ca cavalul este un tip de branz f cut din lapte de vac sau oaie produs la inceput in Sicilia dar acum r spandit prin Balcani mai ales in Romania Bulgaria Serbia Ungaria Turcia Grecia Slovenia i Croa ia N sal cheese Telemea Sweet to extremely salty cheese obtained from cow s sheep s raw pasteurized milk Two main categories fresh - available seasonally preserved -available year around Fresh telemea is soft in various degrees of saltiness Preserved telemea is harder salt saturated due to its brine preservation Preserved telemea is almost identical to Greek Feta cheese Urd Sweet soft with a sandy texture cheese obtained from boiled whey of cow sheep milk almost identical to Italian ricotta cheese Bryndza A crumbly salt cheese Circassian cheese A crumbly non-melting mild fresh cheese that is produced in the North Caucasus It is a cultural cheese staple for Circassians that is very famous in Russia Republic of Adyghea Kabardino-Balkaria Karachay Cherkessia Shapsugia in the southern part of Krasnodar Krai Stavropol Krai North Ossetia Moscow and Saint Petersburg the Middle east countries Jordan Turkey Lebanon Syria Israel worldwide mainly countries that have a North Caucasians and Circassians Diaspora s Korall A soft processed cheese made of cow s milk Tvorog A firm quark version somewhat similar to cottage cheese Ka kavalj A type of stretched-curd cheese made out of sheep s or cow s milk Pictured is Ka kavalj Caciocavallo cheese hanged to mature Serbia Pule cheese Reportedly the world s most expensive cheese it is prepared from the milk of Balkan donkeys from Serbia Bryndza A sheep milk cheese made in Poland Slovakia and Ukraine 39 Recipes differ slightly across the countries Liptauer A spicy cheese spread made with sheep milk cheese 32 goat s milk cheese quark cheese or cottage cheese Ov ia hrudka 40 Kravska hrudka Korba iky Orava A type of string cheese made from steamed cheese interwoven into fine braids Common flavors include salty smoked and garlic O tiepok A traditional Slovakian smoked sheep milk cheese it is a protected trade name under the EU s protected geographical indication Parenica A traditional Slovakian cheese it is a semi-firm non-ripening semi-fat steamed usually smoked cheese although the non-smoked version is also produced Parenica is cream yellow in color which is darkened by steaming The cheese is produced in strips which are woven into snail-like spirals Urda Tvaroh Mohant 41 42 A soft cheese with a strong flavor 41 Tolminc cheese 43 Tolmin Made with raw cow milk it has a sweet spicy flavor The cheese is registered as a Protected Designation of Origin 43 Bl Gotland St nga Gotland Blue is made in Sweden by the Arla Foods company in the town of St nga on the island of Gotland This cheese is often characterized as being somewhere between strong mild containing elements of both types The color is a pale yellow it has no holes Greve A semi-hard Swedish cheese made from cow s milk It is similar to Emmental with a mild nutty taste The cream-coloured cheese has a smooth creamy texture with large holes It contains 30-40 fat takes 10 months to attain full ripeness Gr ddost Herrg rdsost A semi-hard cheese made from cow s milk The aged cheese has a mild sweet nutty flavor small round holes It is aged for three four months but often up to 12 even 24 months Hush llsost A semi-hard cows -milk cheese with small granular holes aged around 60 days on average The taste is described as mild yet somewhat sour Moose cheese Bjurholm Sweden A cheese produced in Sweden from moose milk Pr stost Made from pasteurized cow s milk Svecia A semi-hard cow s-milk cheese with a creamy consistency light yellow colour small irregular holes a mildly acidic taste The cheese is aged in a dry environment for at least two months sometimes up to more than a year V sterbottensost Burtr sk A hard cow s milk cheese with tiny eyes holes a firm granular texture Strong in flavour its taste is described as somewhat like Parmesan cheese salty but with more bitter notes V sterbotten cheese must be aged for at least 12 months delost A blue cheese made from pasteurized cow s milk It has a light cream color with evenly distributed blue-gray veins a sharp salty flavor The cheese has a slightly moldy rind Bilozhar Bukovinskyi Bryndza A sheep milk cheese made in Moldova Poland Slovakia and Ukraine 39 Recipes differ slightly across the countries Pictured is Ukrainian Carpathian bryndza Dobrodar Smetankowyi Syr A firm quark version somewhat similar to cottage cheese Ukra nskyi Vurda Lighvan cheese Liqvan a brined curd cheese traditionally made in Iran Having a sour flavor a shape covered by holes the cheese is produced from sheep s milk The name comes from Liqvan a village in Tabriz where it has traditionally been made Talesh cheese Talesh it can only be found in Talesh county this cheese is made from goat sheep milk Once the cheese is processed it is held in sheep goat skin for aging preservation Mahali cheese Mazandaran This cheese is very similar to Indian Paneer It is made from full fat cow s milk It tastes mild is kept in salt brine Tzfatit Kasheh Hard aged Tzfat cheese in Tzfat Israel Upper Galilee Hard texture Savory flavor perfect for grating on top of Shakshouka Tzfatit Tari Fresh Tzfat Cheese Upper Galilee Mild flavor texture ranges from creamy to firm Akkawi Acre A white brine cheese It is named after the city of Acre where it first originated is commonly made using cow milk but can be also be made with goat or sheep s milk Areesh Originated in Egypt It is similar to cottage cheese Shanklish a fermented cheese is made from areesh cheese 45 Baladi Soft-white smooth creamy cheese has a mild flavor The cheese tastes delicious spread on fresh bread crackers It is eaten for breakfast snacks Basket cheese Made from cow s milk it is available fresh dry Fresh basket has no salt taste while dry basket is mildly salty Basket cheese gets its name from the way it is formed inside a basket Charkassiye A soft fresh cheese Jameed Hard dry laban made from goat or ewe s milk 46 Milk is kept in a fine woven cheesecloth to make a thick yogurt Salt is added daily to thicken the yogurt even more the outside of the yogurt filled cheesecloth is rinsed with water to allow any remaining whey to seep through After a few days of salting the yogurt it becomes very dense it can be removed from the cheesecloth shaped into round balls Pictured is white Jameed in a shop front in Jerusalem Jibneh Arabieh A simple cheese found all over the Middle East It is particularly popular in the Persian Gulf area The cheese has an open texture a mild taste similar to Feta but less salty Jibne Baida Arabic for white cheese is a white hard cheese with a pronounced salty taste often boiled before eating Kashkawan A type of yellow cheese made of sheep milk In Albania Bulgaria Republic of Macedonia Serbia and Romania the term is often used to refer to all yellow cheeses or even any cheese other than sirene Kashta is a heavy cream that is very popular in the Middle East Traditionally it is made by skimming the thickest part of the cream from whey The product is used both as an ingredient in cooking is mixed with honey to be eaten as an incredibly rich dessert Rich Cow brand Kashta is a fresh rich-tasting cream product texture of which is smooth thick It has a sixty-day refrigerated shelf life Kenafa Is an unsalted very fresh soft cheese that melts easily freely It is used to make the popular cheesecake like dessert that is sometimes called Kenafa by people in the Middle East mainly Palestine It can also be used as a base for other sweet cheese desserts It is sold frozen because there is no salt in it is available in both retail bulk packages Labneh Similar to Greek yogurt labneh is a strained yogurt product that is common in the Middle East the Levant Pictured is Labneh in olive oil Majdoule A salty white cheese made up of thick strands of cheese braided together hence the name Nabulsi cheese Nablus One of a number of Palestinian white brined cheeses made in the Middle East Its name denotes its place of origin Nablus 47 and it is well known throughout the West Bank and surrounding regions Shelal A salty white cheese made up of strands of cheese woven together Surke or Shanklish a mature cheese made with spices generally presented as balls of cheese covered in za tar orchile powder most often eaten as a starter dish with tomato oil sometimes onion Syrian cheese There are numerous different kinds of Syrian cheese A few of the most common include Ackawi Baladi Charkassiye Tzfat cheese Safed A semi-hard cheese produced in Israel from sheep s milk It was first produced by the Meiri dairy in Safed in 1840 is still produced there by descendants of the original cheese makers Beyaz peynir A salty white cheese made from unpasteurized sheep milk The cheese has a slightly grainy appearance is similar to Greek feta cheese Hellim Ka ar Kelle Peyniri Bal kesir Labne Mihalic Otlu Van Tulum Erzincan zmir Tunceli Ayd n Cheese curds Cheese curds are a key ingredient in poutine Oka Originally manufactured by the Trappist monks who are located in Oka Quebec Canada this cheese has a distinct flavour and aroma is still manufactured in Oka although now by a commercial company Cheddar Cheese Most Canadian Cheddar is produced by a number of large companies in Ontario though other provinces produce some some smaller artisanal producers exist The annual production is 120 000 tons It is aged a minimum of three months but much of it is held for much longer up to 10 years Queso blanco Also known as queso fresco Cuajada Crema 51 A spreadable unripened white cheese 51 Enredo Queto Crema 51 A spreadable unripened white cheese 51 Cuajada Quesillo Queijo seco 52 Quesillo Adobera cheese Anejo cheese A firm aged Mexican cheese traditionally made from skimmed goat s milk but most often available made from skimmed cow s milk After it is made it is rolled in paprika to add additional flavor to its salty sharp flavor Asadero cheese Also known as Oaxaca cheese Pictured is a tlayuda topped with tomato strings of quesillo Oaxaca Chiapas cheese 53 A dry cream cheese with a crumbly texture that is formed into balls often has string cheese wrapped around it 53 Cotija cheese Criollo cheese Lingallin Oaxaca cheese Queso Crema Chihuahua cheese Queso de cuajo Queso Fresco Queso Panela Bergenost Brand name of a semi-soft cheese with a mild smooth flavor a subtle hint of sourness Bergenost is a triple- cream Norwegian -style butter cheese made by Yancey s Fancy of Corfu New York using imported Norwegian cultures Brick cheese Wisconsin Prepared in brick-shaped form the color ranges from pale yellow to white it has a sweet mild flavor when young matures into a strong ripe cheese with age It is medium-soft crumbles easily is somewhat sticky to the knife Cheddar Cheese Cheese curds Best eaten within 24-48 hours of production at room temperature Fresh curds will often come in a bag have a little whey in the bag They are often high in moisture salty will likely squeak while you chew them After a couple days after any refrigeration they can be regenerated with a couple seconds in a microwave but they will not be the same as fresh They are good in an omelete breaded fried at this point After a few days they will be like a young colby cheddar Colby cheese Kin to cheddar but much milder The curd is washed at production to rinse off the lactose milk sugars Bacteria do not have a chance to make the cheese more acidic as it ages unlike cheddar It melts well Colby-Jack cheese Colorado Blackie Colorado A cheese from the American West named for its black waxed rind Cream cheese Creole cream cheese Cup Cheese Farmer cheese Hoop cheese A drier version of farmer cheese Humboldt Fog California A mold-ripened cheese with a central line of edible white ash much like Morbier Liederkranz cheese Limburger cheese Monterey Jack cheese Muenster cheese Nacho cheese Texas Pepper jack cheese A variety of Monterey Jack Pinconning cheese An aged variety of Colby Provel cheese Red Hawk Northern California A soft mildly salty cheese String cheese The particular American variety of Mozzarella with a stringy texture Swiss cheese Teleme cheese Tasty cheese Commonly mistaken by whom as a variety of cheese due to the widespread use of tasty as an adjective for cheeses by Australian manufacturers it is in fact equivalent to Cheddar is a term used in both Australia New Zealand Usage examples include CC s Tasty Cheese tortilla chips Cremoso cheese A fresh cheese elaborated with cow s milk with without the addition of cream It has its origin in Argentina derives from Italian cheeses with similar characteristics as Crescenza Criollo Goya Reggianito Pictured are rounds of Argentine Reggianito cheese accompanied with bread Sardo Chubut Tandil Mar del Plata Chaqueno Menonita Catupiry A soft mild-tasting cheese that can be spread over toasts crackers bread buns used in cooking Because of its low level of acidity catupiry has become an ingredient in various dishes It is one of the most popular requeij o creamy cheese brands in Brazil Minas Queijo coalho Queijo de Colonia or Colony cheese Queijo Meia Cura Queijo Canastra Queijo Coboco Queijo-do-Reino Queijo do Serro Queijo Manteiga Queijo prato Requeij o Chanco cheese Cow s milk cheese originally from the Chanco farm in Maule Region Now it is produced all over south - central Chile represents almost 50 of Chilean cheese consumption Gauda Panquehue Andean Aconcagua region A semi-soft cheese it is one of the most popular cheeses in Chile it is similar in taste to Tilsit and often has chives or red pepper flakes mixed in 54 55 Renaico Queso Campesino 56 Antioquia Cundinamarca Boyaca is called Quesito too fresh made on big wheels traditionally Quesito Costeno 57 Caribbean A kind of Queso Campesino with a high content of salt in order to be kept longer fresh under salt water Cuajada 58 Department of Cundinamarca Boyaca oriental mountains is a kind of fresh done cheese with only one few days of mature Is the same kind as Quesillo Comparable to Mozzarella is kept fresh in Banana leaves where it gets actually its typical form texture Queso Paipa Paipa is a city in Department Boyaca with a high production of Holstein Milk Queso Pera A kind of mature Mozzarella specifically in a pressed form of a pear forms layers which give the special favorite taste An industrial variation is filled with very sweet guave guayaba marmalade Quesillo In Colombia quesillo is a type of double cream cheese wrapped within a plantain leaf made originally in the Tolima Department the town of Guamo is most known for this dairy product Guayanes cheese Guayana Region A soft salty white cheese Queso crineja 59 Queso de mano 60 Queso Llanero 61 Also known as prairie cheese and queso de ano Queso Palmita A soft watery fresh white cheese with big holes produced from pasteurized milk It is usually made in large circular containers 6 feet in diameter four feet in height Queso Parma de Barinitas 62 Queso semiduro 63 Queso telita 51 A mild farmer s cheese that is packaged in liquid 51 Cottage cheese Various A cheese curd product with a mild flavor It is drained but not pressed so some whey remains the individual curds remain loose The curd is usually washed to remove acidity giving sweet curd cheese Many local varieties exist Farmer cheese Various Varieties of which are made in most cultures with a strong dairy culture Port wine cheese An orange- red-colored cheese that prepared with alcoholic port wine as it is made Smoked cheese Various A style of preparing any number of hard semi-hard cheeses using smoke smoke flavoring Pictured is smoked Gruyere cheese Soy cheese Not a dairy product but a cheese analogue made from soybeans soy protein Pictured is soy cheese manufactured to the consistency of a cream cheese Rice cheese As with soy cheese an analogue from rice rice protein Acid-set Blue Brined Cream Goat Green cheese Pasta filata Processed Smear-ripened Smoked Washed-rind Whey Cow Goat Reindeer Sagra List of Italian chefs List of Italian dishes Meal structure Italy portal Food portal Ba tycki Polish brand of cheese 3 Bryndza Sheep milk cheese made in Poland Slovakia and Ukraine 4 Recipes differ slightly across the countries Bryndza Podhala ska Podhale region Polish variety of the soft cheese bryndza It is prepared with sheep milk was registered in the European Union s Register of protected designations of origin protected geographical indications on June 11 2007 5 as a Protected Designation of Origin PDO Bundz Traditionally produced in Podhale A sheep milk cheese Bursztyn A brand of cheese 6 It is a mature cheese similar to Gruyere Farmer cheese In Poland farmer cheese is similar in consistency to cottage cheese 7 The cheese is formed into a loaf 7 It is sometimes referred to as pot cheese 8 Go ka Similar to oscypek o tiepok but made with milk from cattle Gryficki Gryfice Dairy province of Szczecin 9 Production began in 1973 9 Hauskyjza Foodstuff made of cottage cheese caraway and other ingredients which are mixed put aside for a few days to acquire the characteristic sharp flavor tacky consistency then warmed fried Kortowski 10 Koryci ski Podlaskie Voivodeship in eastern Poland Hard yellow cheese made from cow s milk Named after the town of Korycin Krolewski Northwestern Masovia Royal cheese similar in taste appearance to Swiss Emmental Liliput Lechicki Known in Poland as Brochocki cheese which derives from the name of the farmer who began producing it owicki 11 Lubuski Mazurski Oscypek Made exclusively in the Tatra Mountains region of Poland Smoked sheep milk cheese there is also a smaller form called redyko ka known as the younger sister of oscypek Przeworski Radamer Redyko ka Produced in the Podhale region Sometimes known as the younger sister of Oscypek and the two are occasionally confused The cheese is often made in the shape of animals hearts decorative wreaths Rokpol Polish blue cheese similar to Danish blue cheeses The name derives from Roquefort and suggests that it is Polish Roquefort S upski ch opczyk Twarog Also known as Quark cheese Pictured is Polish twarog in the traditional wedge shape Tyl ycki A yellow cheese made from cow s milk A semi-hard cheese that is a variety of Tilsiter 12 Zamojski Zgorzelecki A semi-hard yellow cheese made from cow s milk Acid-set Blue Brined Cream Goat Green cheese Pasta Society International Cheese Awards Lucerne Cheese Festival Mountain Cheese Olympics National Cheese Exchange The Great British Cheese Festival Cheese dishes Cheesemakers Cheese soups Cheeses Blue cheeses Goat milk cheeses Sheep milk cheeses Stretch-curd cheeses Water buffalo cheeses Cheese ripening Dairy salt Cheese dishes Cheesemakers List of cheeses Boiled egg Plain This dish includes boiling long enough to be hard boiled just long enough for the albumen egg white to solidify soft boiled Coddled egg 2 Plain In cooking coddled eggs are gently lightly cooked eggs They can be partially cooked heavily cooked hardly cooked at all Cheese Omelette Sandwiches India Egg omelette stuffed in bread served with lots of cheese on it Fried egg Plain Cooked in hot grease in a skillet cooked lightly on one side only sunny side up cooked lightly on one side turned over briefly over easy cooked on both sides so the white is solid but the yolk still soft runny over medium 3 and thoroughly cooked on both sides with the yolk solid over well with the yolk broken over hard Omelette Plain France A dish made from beaten eggs quickly cooked with butter or oil but not further stirred while cooking in a frying pan sometimes folded around a filling such as cheese vegetables meat often ham some combination of the above Sometimes an Omelette will be placed under a grill to cook the top as it may not be possible to flip the bottom may burn before the top is cooked through Flat Egg Plain UK Similar to an omelette with a single beaten egg but salt pepper is added to the egg prior to cooking cooked in a dry pan with minimal oil When one side is complete it is flipped to the other side The egg is usually cooked until brown on both sides then served on bread A flat egg is always served on bread as a sandwich style never served on a plate with other items as an Omelette can be Flat Egg is a colloquial term differs from an omelette as it never contains any other items is used where a person doesn t like the white yolk of an egg so when beaten they can enjoy a cooked egg Onsen tamago 4 Plain Japan Hot-spring eggs traditional Japanese boiled eggs tamago slow-cooked in the water of hot springs onsen Poached egg Plain An egg that has been cooked by poaching in simmering liquid The term is also applied to a method whereby the egg is placed in a cup suspended over simmering water using a special pan called an egg-poacher Scrambled eggs Plain A dish made from beaten egg whites and yolks of usually chicken eggs Beaten eggs are put into a hot pot pan usually greased stirred frequently forming curds as they coagulate Basted egg Plain Sunny-side-up eggs that are slightly cooked on the top This can be accomplished by spooning fat from the pan onto the eggs 5 or by turning them cooking the yolk side for a few seconds 6 Shirred eggs Plain Also known as baked eggs it is a dish in which eggs have been baked in a flat-bottomed dish the name originates from the type of dish in which it was traditionally baked An alternative way of cooking is to crack the eggs into individual ramekins and cook them in a water bath creating the French dish eggs Avgolemono Savory Mediterranean A family of sauces soups made with egg and lemon juice mixed with broth Baghala ghatogh Savory Iran A Khoresh Persian stew made with Baghalas Rashtian faba beans dill Eggs Usually served with Kateh Persian rice dish in the northern provinces of Iran Bai pong moan Savory Cambodia A Cambodian dish consisting of fried eggs white rice Balut Savory Southeast Asia A steamed fertilized duck egg containing a partially developed duck embryo it is commonly sold as street food in the Philippines Brik Savory Tunisia A Tunisian dish consisting of thin warka pastry around a filling commonly deep fried The best-known version is the egg brik a whole egg in a triangular pastry pocket with chopped onion tuna harissa and parsley Century egg 7 Savory China Originated as an ingredient an appetizer in Chinese cuisine made by preserving duck chicken or quail eggs in a mixture of clay ash salt quicklime and rice hulls for several weeks to several months depending on the method of processing Now commonly found in some East Southeast Asian countries especially those with Chinese heritage 8 Iritamago ja Savory Japan Chawanmushi Savory Japan An egg custard dish found in Japan that uses the seeds of ginkgo 9 Chinese steamed eggs Savory A Chinese home-style dish found all over China Eggs are beaten to a consistency similar to that used for an omelette water is added the mixture steamed C lb r Savory Turkey Poached eggs with yogurt often with garlic mixed in Creamed eggs on toast Savory United States A breakfast dish consisting of toast or biscuits covered in a gravy made from bechamel sauce and chopped hard-boiled eggs Croque Madame Savory France A croque-monsieur sandwich served with a fried egg or poached egg on top Deviled eggs Savory Italy Yolks of hard-boiled eggs are mashed with cream mayonnaise mustard seasonings then mounded piped into the white of the boiled egg Served cold often al fresco Eggah Savory Arab Cuisine Eggs binding a filling of vegetables meat sometimes with Arabic spices Egg bhurji Savory India Similar to scrambled eggs mixed with fried onions spices Egg curry Savory India A spicy dish made with boiled eggs tomatoes fried onions normally eaten with bread rotis Egg butter Savory Finland A mixture of butter and hard boiled eggs Egg foo yung Savory Eggs are stirred together with vegetables such as bean sprouts scallions then quickly cooked in a hot skillet deep-fried in oil served with gravy Egg in a basket Savory An egg fried within a hole in a slice of bread Egg khesh citation needed Savory India Egg drop soup Savory A Chinese soup of wispy beaten eggs in boiled chicken broth Egg salad Savory Egg salad is often used as a sandwich filling typically made of chopped hard-boiled eggs mayonnaise mustard minced celery onion salt pepper paprika It is also often used as a topping on green salads It s also sometimes referred to as egg mayonnaise Egg sandwich Savory A sandwich with some kind of egg filling Sliced hard boiled eggs egg salad scrambled eggs are popular options Additional fillings such as various meats cheeses abound A common version is the fried egg sandwich Egg thread nets 10 Savory Thailand Used to hold other foods Eggs brains Savory Pork brains or those of another mammal scrambled eggs It is a dish of the Portuguese cuisine known as Omolete de Mioleira Eggs Benedict Savory United States Poached eggs on Canadian bacon on top of toasted English muffin halves covered with hollandaise sauce Eggs Connaught citation needed Savory Eggs do pyaza 11 Savory India A type of dopiaza made with eggs Eggs Fitzpatrick citation needed Savory Ireland 12 Eggs moghlai 13 Savory India United Kingdom Eggs Muldoon citation needed Savory Eggs Neptune Savory A variation of Eggs Benedict with crab meat replacing Canadian bacon Eggs Florentine Savory A variation of Eggs Benedict with spinach replacing Canadian bacon Eggs Royale Savory A variation on Eggs Benedict replacing the ham with smoked salmon Eggs thoren citation needed Savory India Ervilhas com ovos 14 Savory Portugal Eyerlekh Savory Ashkenazi Jewish Creamy flavorful unhatched eggs found inside just-slaughtered chickens typically cooked in soup Farofa de ovos 15 Savory Brazil Fl ske ggekage 16 17 Savory Denmark A oven baked pan fried thick omelette egg cake topped with crispy bacon tomatoes chives French Toast Savory Sweet Bread dipped in raw egg yolk is shallow fried on a pan Frittata Savory An Italian egg-based dish similar to an omelette or crustless quiche enriched with additional ingredients such as meats cheeses vegetables or pasta Gari foto 18 19 Savory West Africa Gyeran changjorim Savory Korea Salted egg with soy sauce Gyeran-mari Savory Korea Gyeranppang Snack food Korea A snack food prepared with egg rice flour Hangtown fry Savory United States A type of omelette made famous during the California Gold Rush in the 1850s The most common version includes bacon and oysters combined with eggs and fried together 20 Huevos divorciados Savory Mexico A Mexican breakfast featuring two fried eggs separated by a column of chilaquiles each egg is covered by a different salsa Huevos motulenos Savory Mexico A breakfast food made with eggs on tortillas with black beans and cheese often with other ingredients such as ham peas plantains and salsa picante 21 Huevos rancheros Savory Latin America Eggs either poached in salsa fried served on top of corn tortillas frijoles Toppings may include avocado slices melted cheese sour cream cilantro etc Huevos rotos es Savory Spain Fried scrambled eggs are served on top of fried potatoes sometimes with ham and or other types of meat such as chorizo If the eggs are fried they may be put whole on top of the potatoes they may be cut up Indian omelette Savory A version of the omelette found in Indian cuisine Its main ingredients are eggs herbs tomatoes and spices that vary by region Jajka faszerowane 22 Savory Poland Deviled Eggs Yolk mixture can vary by region Kai doon citation needed Savory Thailand Kai kwan 23 Savory Thailand Kai look koei 24 Savory Thailand Kai tian citation needed Savory Thailand Kai tord gup moo citation needed Savory Thailand Khai yat sai Savory Thailand A type of Thai omelette the name means stuffed eggs The egg is cooked lightly topped with various ingredients then folded over Khanom khai Savory Thailand Kedgeree Savory British corruption of Indian Khichdi A dish consisting of cooked flaked fish sometimes smoked haddock boiled rice parsley hard-boiled eggs curry powder butter or cream occasionally sultanas Kluski z zoltek citation needed Savory Poland Noodles with yolk Usually pan fried Kuku food Savory Iran 25 Genre of egg dishes cooked in a pancake pattie shape with one more ingredients Kuro-tamago hard-boiled egg Savory Japan Black boiled egg cooked in sulphur rich hot spring Loco moco Savory United States White rice topped with a hamburger patty a fried egg brown gravy Machaca eggs Savory Northwest Mexico Southwest United States Shredded beef with scrambled eggs sometimes other ingredients such as onions chili peppers Matzah brei Savory Ashkenazi Jewish Matzo fried with eggs Menemen Savory Turkey Migas Savory Tex-Mex Mirza-Qasemi Savory Iran Eggs Tandoori kabobed aubergine tomato seasoned with garlic salt pepper Nargesi Spinach Omelette Savory Iran Made with eggs fried onion and spinach It s spiced with salt garlic pepper Named after Narcissus flower Nargesi Kebab Savory Afghanistan Pakistan India A kind of Kofta with a chicken egg in the middle Named after Narcissus flower because when koftas are cut they look like the flower s petals Ojja bi l-Hrus citation needed Savory Tunisia Okonomiyaki Savory Japan Egg-and-flour mix cooked on a griddle with Philadelphia Cheesy Eggs citation needed Savory Pickled egg Savory Typically hard boiled eggs that are cured in vinegar or brine This was originally done like many foods as a way to preserve the food so that it could be eaten months later Pickled eggs have since become a favorite among many as a snack or hors d oeuvre popular in pubs bars taverns around the world in places where beer is served Rafanata Savory Italy A type of omelette usually made with eggs horseradish cheese 26 Salted duck egg Savory China Originated in China it is a duck egg pickled in salt water brine given it a unique flavor texture when cooked with the whites becomes salty with a little snappier texture the yolk has a peanut-butter-like creamy texture Scalloped eggs 27 Savory Scotch egg Savory United Kingdom A hard-boiled egg wrapped in sausage meat coated in bread crumbs baked deep-fried Shakshouka Savory Tunisia Smoked egg Savory China 28 Souffle Savory Sweet France Stratta Savory United States Steak eggs Domestic cat Equines Donkey Horse Lagomorphs Rabbit Hare Marsupials Kangaroo Oves sheep Domestic sheep Rodents Guinea pig Edible dormouse Coypu nutria Capybara Rat Suidae swine Domestic pig Venison Cervidae Moose rarely domesticated Reindeer Red deer Fallow deer Elk Birds Chicken Domestic duck Domestic goose Domestic turkey Domesticated quail Domestic pigeon Guineafowl Ostrich Emu Fish Carp Catfish - 100 farm raised 1 Flounder Trout Salmon - 60 farm raised 2 Striped Bass Sturgeon Tilapia Insects Chapulines Maguey worm Mopane worm Silkworm Locust Grasshopper Crustaceans Crayfish Crab Lobster Shrimp Prawns Mollusks Oysters Mussels Land snails Abalone Reptiles Alligator Crocodile Turtles 50 50 burger California United States Half ground bacon half ground beef burger patty developed by Scott Slater for Slater s 50 50 restaurant Another variety is half kangaroo meat and half bacon Angus burger Angus cattle were developed from cattle native to the counties of Aberdeenshire and Angus in Scotland 2 and are known as Aberdeen Angus in most parts of the world A hamburger made using beef from Angus cattle The name Angus burger is used by several fast-food hamburger chains for one more premium burgers however it does not belong to any single company Pre-made frozen Angus burgers are increasingly available from retailers Australasian hamburgers Australasia Popular regional hamburger ingredients in Australia New Zealand include canned beetroot and pineapple 3 4 Pictured is a burger with slices of canned beetroot within it Bacon cheeseburger An A W Restaurant in Lansing Michigan in 1963 Hamburger with bacon cheese is a bacon cheeseburger which became an official menu item at an A W Restaurant owned by Dale Mulder in Lansing Michigan in 1963 5 6 Hamburgers with bacon but no cheese may be referred to as bacon burgers citation needed Barbecue burger Prepared with ground beef mixed with onions and barbecue sauce then grilled Once the meat has been turned once barbecue sauce is spread on top grilled until the sauce caramelizes The bread bun is buttered also spread with a light layer of barbecue sauce then toasted on the grill B fsandwich 7 Denmark Classic Danish take on a hamburger It contains the hamburger elements of a cooked ground beef patty placed inside a sliced bread roll B fsandwiches are typically sold from hotdog stands traditional fastfood establishments in later years some traditional Danish restaurants have also started serving gourmet versions Butter burger Most likely first served in 1936 at Solly s Grille in Milwaukee In the Upper Midwest particularly Wisconsin burgers are often made with a buttered bun butter as one of the ingredients of the patty with a pat of butter on top of the burger patty 8 Buffalo burger Prepared with meat from the American Bison 9 buffalo burgers have less cholesterol less fat fewer calories than beef hamburgers chicken hamburgers The American Heart Association recommended buffalo burgers in 1997 as more heart-healthy than chicken beef 10 California burger In portions of the Midwest East coast a hamburger served with lettuce tomato onion is referred to as a California burger citation needed However in the Western U S a California burger most often consists of a normal cheeseburger with the addition of guacamole or avocado and bacon 8 Carolina burger In portions of the Carolinas a Carolina-style hamburger with everything may be served with cheese chili onions mustard cole slaw 11 Common in local restaurants in the Carolinas it is also periodically offered at Wendy s restaurants as the Carolina Classic 12 Cheeseburger Hamburger accompanied with melted cheese The term itself is a portmanteau of the words cheese hamburger The cheese is usually sliced then added a short time before the hamburger finishes cooking to allow it to melt In fast food restaurants the cheese that is added to a cheeseburger is typically American cheese but there are many other variations Mozzarella blue cheese Swiss cheese pepper jack especially cheddar are popular choices Chili burger Thomas M Ptomaine Tommy DeForest appears to have developed the chili burger in the 1920s 13 Consists of a hamburger with the patty topped with chili con carne 14 15 16 Curry burger Variant of the American hamburger that is seasoned with curry Made with ground beef chicken lamb it is typically seasoned with curry powder as well as yogurt onions green peppers other spices then served on a traditional hamburger bun citation needed Green chile burger Owl Bar Grill in San Antonio New Mexico circa 1945 17 Burger topped with Roasted New Mexico chiles Many places around New Mexico serve variations of this burger 18 Hamdog Combination Hamburger Hotdog Bun Invented in 2004 by Australian Mark Murray Patented in 2009 The Hamdog received global media recognition late 2016 as the worlds only Patented Trademarked burger Australian invention that consists of a special combination hamburger hotdog bun A meat patty is split in half has a sausage run through the middle It is then topped just as a conventional burger Hamdog Chandler Goff the owner of Mulligan s a suburban bar in Decatur Georgia invented the hamdog in February 2005 19 American dish that consists of a hot dog that is wrapped in a beef patty deep-fried covered with chili a handful of French fries a fried egg Hawaii burger Topped with pineapple and often teriyaki sauce from the Japanese-American culture Jucy Lucy Two bars on the same street in South Minneapolis both claim to have invented the sandwich Matt s Bar and the 5-8 Club 20 A cheeseburger that has the cheese inside the meat patty rather than on top A piece of cheese is surrounded by raw meat cooked until it melts resulting in a molten core of cheese within the patty Kimchi burger It has been stated that Uncle Joe s Hamburger of Seoul South Korea was the inventor of the kimchi burger 21 22 A hamburger that includes kimchi in its preparation 23 Luther Burger The origin is disputed According to legend the burger was named for was a favorite and possible invention of singer songwriter and record producer Luther Vandross 24 The Daily Telegraph reported that Mulligan s a suburban bar in Decatur Georgia may be progenitor of the burger when the owner substituted the doughnuts when running out of buns 24 25 Hamburger cheeseburger prepared with one more glazed doughnuts in place of the bun Naan burger Made with naan bread naan burgers the use of flatbread creates a taste experience different from hamburgers made with bread Pastrami burger Trend started at Crown Burgers of Utah in 1978 which they call the Crown Burger A burger with cheese thin-sliced pastrami on top 8 Patty melt Hamburger sandwich consisting of a ground beef patty pieces of sauteed grilled onion and Cheddar or Swiss cheese between two slices of bread traditionally rye though sourdough is sometimes substituted Rice burger Created in Japan by MOS Burger Style of hamburger in which the bun is a compressed cake of rice 26 The MOS Burger fast-food restaurant chain introduced the rice burger in 1987 27 28 and it has become a popular food item in East Asia Salmon burger Fishcake made mostly from salmon in the style of a hamburger Salmon burgers are especially common in Alaska where they are routinely offered as an alternative to beef hamburgers 29 Slider Very small square hamburger patty sprinkled with diced onions served on an equally small bun According to the earliest citations the name originated aboard U S Navy ships due to the way greasy burgers slid across the galley grill while the ship pitched rolled 30 31 Other versions claim the term slider originated from the hamburgers served by flight line galleys at military airfields which were so greasy they slid right through you because their small size allows them to slide right down your throat in one two bites White Castle trademarked the spelling variant Slyder used it between 1985 2009 32 Primarily refers to small hamburgers but can also cover any small sandwich served on a slider roll Slopper The slopper originated in 1965 earlier in Pueblo Colorado however the exact restaurant is disputed 33 Some say that it was created at Coors Tavern while others argue that it originated at Star Bar 33 Cheeseburger hamburger served open-faced smothered in red chile green chile aka chile verde green chile sauce Sloppers generally include grilled buns are often topped with freshly chopped onions Eating a slopper is no easy task The use of a fork spoon is essential but a fork knife fork spoon combination is recommended Slugburger Northeast Mississippi Traditional southern delicacy found in northeast Mississippi particularly Corinth Consisting of a patty made from a mixture of beef pork an inexpensive extender such as soybeans it is deep fried in oil 8 It is typically served on a bun with mustard pickles onion in some places with a side of French fries Steak burger Typically prepared with ground sliced minced beefsteak meat Additional meats are also used Steamed cheeseburger Mainly available in central Connecticut It is believed to have been invented at a restaurant called Jack s Lunch in Middletown Connecticut in the 1930s Instead of being fried in a pan grilled on a grill a steamed cheeseburger is steamed in a stainless-steel cabinet containing trays that hold either a hamburger patty a piece of cheese This method of cooking makes the fats in the meat melt away resulting in a moist juicy burger which is then put on a bun covered with the melted cheese Various customary toppings can then be added to the burger 34 Teriyaki burger The origin is disputed Some sources state it as a Japanese invention while others list an origin amongst Japanese-Americans in Hawaii Teriyaki burger refers to a variety of hamburger either topped with teriyaki sauce with the sauce worked into the ground meat patty Veggie burger Veggie burger garden burger tofu burger uses a meat analogue a meat substitute such as tofu textured vegetable protein seitan wheat gluten Quorn beans grains an assortment of vegetables which are ground up formed into patties Angus burger Buffalo burger Bun kebab Cheeseburger Chili burger Hamburger Hamdog Jucy Juicy Lucy Luther Burger Naan burger Patty melt Rice burger Slider Slopper Slugburger Steak burger Veggie burger Bacon Deluxe Baconator Big Classic Big King Big Mac Big N Tasty Burger King premium burgers McDonald s Deluxe line Quarter Pounder Whopper Cheeseburger history History of the hamburger History
