foods This article needs additional citations for verification Please help improve this article by adding citations to reliable sources Unsourced material may be challenged removed August 2014 Learn how when to remove this template message Sosatie A dish of the Cape Malay people of South Africa 4 It is a type of kebab related to satay which came to Indonesia via Muslim traders from India was brought from there to South Africa 5 Suya Kewap A popular spicy meat kebab enjoyed by many across West Africa Originally from Nigeria this kebab has tastes of peanuts spicy pepper is sold by street vendors as a snack entire meal The kebabs are enjoyed with onion bell pepper pieces It is a traditionally Muslim kebab prepared according to Halal methods 6 Kyinkyinga A Ghanian kebab similar to synonymous with suya 7 8 9 Khan kebab Lyulya kebab Russian - served skewered wrapped in lavash bread 10 Sham kebab Tava kebab Bihari kabab Skewered pieces hunks strips of lean beef marinated in spices yogurts chillies tenderised to perfection before slowly grilled on a charcoal flame The dish was brought from Bihar India see Biharis in Bangladesh 11 Tikka kebab Made of chunks of grilled chicken marinated with yogurts sauces spices 12 Naga doner kebab One of the most well-known Bangladeshi kebabs commonly eaten in East London England It is made of meat cooked on a vertical rotisserie then drizzled with the Naga morich It is also known to be the most spiciest kebab due to the presence of the chilli It can be fused with the Shatkora kebab as well see below Reshmi kebab Minced chicken 13 adequately seasoned then barbecued on a charcoal grill Shami kebab Normally made of minced meat with paste of lentils chopped onion coriander green chillies usually added to the mixture which is kneaded in a disc-like shape fried Best results are obtained when fried in ghee In some places a binding agent is used to keep the kebab together Meat can also be replaced with egg known as Dim Kebab Enda Kebab Shatkora doner kebab One of the most well-known Bangladeshi kebabs commonly eaten in East London England as well as other areas with a high Bangladeshi diaspora It is made of meat cooked on a vertical rotisserie then drizzled with the Shatkora plant It is also known as the Hatkora Hatkhora doner in Sylheti It can be fused with the Naga doner kebab as well see above Sheekh kebab Prepared with minced meat with spices grilled on skewers 14 It is often served with a Bengali sauce known as Raita or mint sauce Tandoori kebab Chunks strips of meat marina Chuanr Uyghur Kewap Chinese Chuanr or Yangrouchuan The most popular Xinjiang dish in China chunks of mutton mutton fat pierced on metal or wood bamboo skewers grilled on a coal-fired barbecue served with cumin and chili paste Across Xinjiang neighbouring regions such as Kyrgyzstan the mutton fat is valued equivalent to more than the meat itself as it provides energy during the harsh winter months It has also become a popular street food all over north west China where a wide variety of foods are cooked in such a manner Chuanr was traditionally made from lamb yang r u chuan which is still the most common but now chicken pork beef seafood are used It is typically roasted over charcoal electric heat but it is sometimes cooked by deep frying in oil popular in Beijing Sheftalia A traditional Cypriot sausage made of ground pork lamb wrapped in caul fat that is served alone in a pita usually with tomato cucumber parsley lemon Souvlaki Skewers consisting of pork chicken lamb that is barbecued 15 Pictured is a souvlaki platter Souvlaki is described in the Oxford Companion to Food as a type of kebab that is part of the heritage of Islam 5 Gyros Introduced to Athens in the 1950s by immigrants from Turkey the Middle East gyros was originally known simply as d ner kebab 16 Made from chopped meat usually pork chicken formed into a large loaf for slow-roasting on a vertical rotisserie cooker the auto-donner See also doner kebab Thin portions are shaved off served in a pitta bread with onion Greek yogurt-cucumber-garlic sauce tzatziki Popularized in US by Greek restaurateurs in the Greektown Chicago neighborhood Souvlaki In the 1960s vendors began selling dishes in the same style as gyros made with souvlaki which resembles Turkish shish kebab but is usually made with pork 16 Souvlaki skewer consists of small skewers of meat barbecued then served plain in a pitta sandwich with salad Chicken 17 and lamb are also sometimes used It is sometimes served on a skewer as a dinner in combination with rice potatoes tzatziki sauce In Athens it is called kalamaki with souvlaki referring to both gyros kalamaki Souvlaki is described in the Oxford Companion to Food as a type of kebab that is part of the heritage of Islam 5 Bihari kabab Skewered pieces of meat marinated in spice Originally a dish from the non-vegetarian cuisine Muslims invented Bihari kabab of the North Indian state of Bihar as it is made out of beef It has spread to other countries 11 Boti kebab A mutton kebab 18 Boti kebab is pictured at the bottom of the image Achari Tikka Chicken tikka Another tandoori kebab made of cubed chicken marinated with yogurt spices 19 Dora kabab 20 21 Galawat kabab A variant of Shami kebab made without any admixture binding agents comprising just the minced beef Muslim origin the spices Speciality of Lucknow Hariyali kabab Punjabi style chicken tikka or kabab made with combination of mint and coriander Kakori kabab Made of minced beef meat with spices a specialty of Muslims of Lucknow Delhi Galauti kebab A smoked patty prepared using leg of lamb that includes onion garlic ginger saffron spices which is cooked on a griddle 22 Hariyali kebab A vegetarian kebab prepared using lentils spinach 23 24 Tangri kebab Chicken legs roasted on open fire with hot spices laced with butter or ghee 25 Kastoori kebab 26 Dahi ke kabab 27 Burra kebab 28 29 Kalmi kebab A chicken kebab 30 Kalmi kebab is pictured on the left in the image Paneer kabab Vegetarian kebab Reshmi kabab A traditional kebab of Mughlai cuisine that is prepared with marinated chicken lamb beef 31 Shami kebab Made of minced beef with paste of lentils chopped onion coriander green chillies usually added to the mixture which is kneaded in a disc-like shape fried Best results are obtained when fried in animal fat or ghee in a brass utensil over a coal fire In some places a binding agent is used to keep the kebab together Shikampur kabab Sutli Kebab Sutli kabab is made by wrapping a paste of meat spices around a metal sheekh tying it with a cotton thread then heating it in a barbeque pit Once the kabab is done the thread is removed the kabab is served 32 Berenj goje kabab Chelow kabab rice with kebab Is one of the most common forms of serving kebab in Iran which combines a variety of Persian kebabs with saffroned Basmati rice lavash a paper-thin bread grilled tomato raw onions bell peppers mushrooms and sumac and often a side of salad shirazi mast-o-khiar and doogh nowadays carbonated An old Iranian tradition is to break a raw egg yolk over the rice along with plenty of butter just before serving but not many follow this tradition anymore Dandeh kebab Ghaz kabab Joujeh kabab Grilled chicken on skewers Kabab bakhtiari Combination of Jujeh kabab kabab barg Kabab barg Grilled marinated sirloin Kabab barreh Grilled lamb typically marinated in yogurt with parsley Kabab chenjeh Grilled lamb prepared similar to shish kebab without the vegetables Kabab digi Pan Kabab Kabab hosseini Lamb beef cooked on skewers with onions tomatoes green peppers Kabab isphahani Kabab Jigar-o Del-o Gholveh Heart liver kidney Kabab kermanshahi Kabab koobideh Ground beef lamb usually sirloin often mixed with parsley and chopped onions Kabab kurdi Ground lamb beef onions garlic tomatoes Kabab loghmeh Minced lamb meatballs first fried the grilled over charcoal fire eaten with chopped parsley chopped onions sumac A summer outing favorite Kabab mahitabeh Pan fried Kabab Kabab rashti Also known as Kabab Shomali includes almond pistachio barberry Kabab shamshiri It is a kabab with kabab-barg on one side of skewer kabab-kubideh on the other Kabab shirazi Kabab soltani Combination of kabab koobideh kabab barg Kabab torsh Gilan northern Iran Also called tursh-e-kabab grilled beef marinated in a mixture of pomegranate juice crushed walnuts parsley crushed garlic olive oil Kabab va nun Kabab with bread Kabab vaziri Combination of kabab joojeh kabab koobideh skewers Kabab-e donbalan Lamb testicles kabab 33 Kababe shandiz Sonnati kabab Kebab halabi A kind of kebab served with a spicy tomato sauce and Aleppo pepper very common in Syria Lebanon and the Galilee region in Northern Israel named after the city of Aleppo Halab Aleppo is well known for its kebab cuisine reportedly having at least 26 original dishes 34 Kebab hindi Rolled meat with tomato paste onion capsicum pomegranate molasses Kebab kamayeh Soft meat with truffle pieces onion various nuts Kebab karaz For cherry kebab in Arabic meatballs lamb along with cherries cherry paste pine nuts sugar pomegranate molasses It is considered one of Aleppo s main dishes especially among Armenians Kebab khashkhash Rolled lamb beef with chili pepper paste parsley garlic pine nuts Pictured is Kebab khashkhash from Aleppo Kebab siniyye For tray kebab in Arabic lean minced lamb in a tray added with chili pepper onion tomato Kebab tuhal Lamb rounds stuffed with parsley hot green peppers pine kernels 35 Shawarma Similar to a doner kebab made with chunks of lamb meat Chapli kebab A delicacy of Pakistan from Khyber Pakhtunkhwa province marinated beef in spices deep fried flat 36 In Pakistan it is sometimes deep fried in animal tallow it is a common kebab a Lola kabab Gola kabab Kabab of Pakistan and Afghanistan rolled meatballs originating in Peshawar and Kandahar Seekh kebab Kebab of Pakistan prepared with minced meat with spices grilled on skewers It is cooked in a Tandoor is often served with chutneys or mint sauce It is often included in tandoori sampler platters which contain a variety of tandoor cooked dishes A seekh kebab can also be served in a naan bread much like d ner kebab Seekh kebabs are part of the traditional Pakistani diet Shami kebab Made of minced meat with paste of lentils chopped onion coriander green chillies usually added to the mixture which is kneaded in a disc-like shape fried Best results are obtained when fried in ghee In some places a binding agent is used to keep the kabab together Tandoori kebab Kabab of India Pakistan chunks strips of meat marina Malai tikka Kabab of Pakistan chunks strips of chicken marinated in a white yoghurt garlic sauce grilled Reshami kebab Kabab of Pakistan minced chicken adequately seasoned then barbecued on a charcoal grill Bihari kebab Kabab of Pakistan chunks strips of lean beef marinated in a spicy yoghurt chilli marinade tenderized to perfection before slowly grilled on a charcoal flame Espetadas Meat skewer usually beef 38 Frig rui Small pieces of meat usually pork beef mutton lamb chicken grilled on a skewer very similar to shashlik 39 or shish kebab Often the pieces of meat alternate with bacon sausages vegetables such as onions tomatoes bell peppers mushrooms It is seasoned with spices such as pepper garlic savory rosemary marjoram laurel Stonner kebab A Scottish dish Pincho moruno Meat skewer usually made of chicken pork sliced in cubes marinated in paprika other spices Adana kebab Also known as k yma kebab kebab with hand-minced z rh meat mixed with chili on a flat wide metal skewer shish associated with Adana region although very popular all over Turkey 40 Ali Pa a kebab Ali Pasha kebab Cubed lamb with tomato onion parsley wrapped in filo 40 Alinazik kebab Ground meat kebab sauteed in a saucepan with garlic yogurt eggplants added Antep kebab Half-fat minced meat mixed with thin slices of the same meat made into balls cooked between thick slices of eggplant Bahc van kebab 41 Boneless lamb shoulder mixed with chopped onions tomato paste Beykoz kebab Tomato onion flavoured lamb wrapped in aubergine slices garnished with lamb brains 40 Beyti kebab Ground lamb beef seasoned grilled on a skewer often served wrapped in lavash and topped with tomato sauce and yogurt traced back to the famous kebab house Beyti in Istanbul and particularly popular in Turkey s larger cities 42 Bostan kebab Lamb aubergine casserole 40 Ca kebab spoke kebab Cubes of lamb roasted first on a ca a horizontal rotating spit then on a skewer a specialty of Erzurum region with recently rising popularity Cardak kebab 43 Stuffed lamb meat wrapped in a crepe or filo Ci er kebab liver kebab Lamb liver kebab on a skewer a k a ci er i C kertme kebab Sirloin veal kebap stuffed with yogurt and potatoes C p i small skewer kebab A specialty of Selcuk and Germencik near Ephesus pounded boneless meat with tomatoes garlic marinated with black pepper thyme and oil on wooden skewers 44 Doner kebab skender kebap D ner kebap served with yogurt tomato sauce and butter originated in Bursa The kebab was invented by skender Efendi in 1867 He was inspired from Ca kebab turned it from horizontal to vertical slim kebab stew Another version of the aubergine kebab without its skin marinated in sunflower oil 40 44 Ka t kebab Lamb or veal cooked in a paper wrapping 44 K l c i Brochette of swordfish 40 i k fte Also known as Shish k fte minced lamb meatballs with herbs often including parsley and mint on a stick grilled Kuyu kebab pit kebab Prepared from the goat it is special for Ayd n region similar to tand r kebab Kuzu i Shish kebap prepared with marinated milk-fed lamb meat Manisa kebab This Manisa region version of the kebab is smaller flat size shish meat on the sliced pide bread flavored with butter stuffed with tomato garlic green pepper Orman kebab forest kebab Lamb meat on the bone cut in large pieces mixed with carrots potatoes peas 40 Patates kebab 45 Beef chicken mixed with potatoes onions tomato sauce bay leaves Patl can kebab aubergine kebab A unique kebap meat marinated in spices served with aubergines hot pide bread a yogurt sauce 44 i kebab Prepared with fish lamb chicken meat on thin metal reed rods grilled 40 44 i tavuk Also known as Tavuk i Yogurt - marinated chicken grilled on a stick 44 Sivas kebab Associated with the Sivas region similar to Tokat kebab but especially lamb ribs are preferred it also differs from Tokat kebab on the point that there are no potatoes inside Tand r kebab tandoor kebab Lamb pieces sometimes a whole lamb baked in an oven called a tand r which requires a special way of cooking for hours Served with bread raw onions 40 Tantuni Tantuni is a spicy durum consisting of julienne cut beef or sometimes lamb stir-fried on a sac with a hint of cotton oil It is a specialty of the city of Mersin Turkey Tas kebap veal stew Stewed meat in a bowl beginning with the cooking of the vegetables in butter employing a method called ya a vurmak butter infusion before the meat itself is cooked in the same grease Testi kebab earthenware-jug kebab Ingredients are similar to c mlek kebab prepared in a testi instead of a guvec generally found in Central Anatolia the Mid-Western Black Sea region Tire kebab Minced meat cooked on sheesh served with maydanoz sauce on top of special tire bread Tokat kebab Associated with the Tokat region it is made with marinated lamb grilled inside an oven together with aubergines tomatoes potatoes entire onions garlics served over a special flatbread called lava a thicker yufka softened with the juice of the meat tomatoes Urfa kebab From Urfa similar to Adana kebab but not spicy Vali Kebab Governor Kebab Chislic This is a migration of Russian culture into South Dakota by the German-Russian population Salmon kebab A kebab popular throughout the Pacific Northwest s United States coastal areas especially during salmon runs 46 Samak kebab Grilled fish on a stick Satay A Southeast Asian dish consisting of diced sliced meat skewered grilled over a fire then served with various spicy seasonings It was developed by Javanese street vendors as a unique adaptation of Indian kebabs 47 5 Shashlik Shashlyk meaning skewered meat was originally made of lamb Nowadays it is also made of pork beef depending on local preferences religious observances Shishleek A term with various uses in Iran it refers to grilled baby lamb chops usually from the leg typically marinated in Israel to grilled turkey Kabab Memuleh b hatzilim A kebab balls made of minced beef garlic parsley baharat salt black pepper onions cumin which stuffed with a mixture of fried grilled eggplants tahini Originally from Israel Rullakebab Literally kebab roll a type of kebab popular in Finland It consists of d ner kebab strips salad wrapped inside a pita bread pizza crust forming a tube roll like construction of vegetarianism Inca Mayan Medieval Ottoman Peasant Soviet Thirteen Colonies Cuisine classique Fast food Fusion Haute Molecular gastronomy Note by Note Nouvelle List of cuisines Lists of prepared foods Food portal Drink portal Category Commons Cookbook WikiProject blefl sk Denmark blefl sk is a traditional dish in Danish cuisine The dish made of bacon onions apples sugar served on rugbr d 4 Angels on horseback Angels on horseback is a dish created by wrapping oysters in bacon placing them on a skewer The skewered pieces are then dusted with cayenne pepper and broiled until the bacon becomes crisp 5 Bacon cabbage Ireland Bacon and cabbage is a traditional Irish dish It is created by boiling shoulder collar bacon in a saucepan 20 minutes before the bacon is finished cooking chopped cabbage is added to the water It is then sometimes covered with parsley sauce or mustard sauce made from some of the used cooking liquid 6 Bacon egg pie Bacon egg pie is made by rolling out a pastry in a pie dish filling it with chopped hard-boiled eggs crushed bacon small amounts of salt milled black pepper An egg-milk mixture is then poured into the pie another layer of pastry is added on top 7 Bacon eggs full breakfast A study at the University of Alabama found that eating a breakfast of bacon eggs may be the healthiest way to start the day because it programs the body s metabolism to burn more calories 8 The full breakfast is a traditional food in England US Canada Ireland 9 Side dishes can include black pudding white pudding sausage toast fried bread baked beans hash browns pancakes cheese 9 10 Bacon bits Real bacon bits are made from bacon that has been cooked then dried then crushed into small pieces 11 Imitation bacon bits are fashioned from textured vegetable protein 12 13 Bacon bits are commonly used as a topping garnish they can be incorporated into foods as an ingredient 11 Bacon cake Sweet savory cake made with bacon Bacon egg cheese sandwich A bacon egg cheese sandwich can be made in several ways One way involves using a sliced bagel a couple of slices of bacon a fried egg layered into sandwich form 14 Another way uses a crescent roll instead of a bagel 15 Bacon explosion United States The recipe for bacon explosion was released onto BBQ Addicts blog on December 23 2008 16 It was instantly popular generating 500 000 hits to the blog 17 18 Bacon explosion is made by weaving thick-cut bacon into a lattice spreading a layer of italian sausage on the lattice sprinkling crushed bacon on the top Barbecue sauce is poured onto this mass followed by a sprinkle of barbecue seasoning 17 The result contains at least 5 000 calories 21 kJ 19 Bacon ice cream England Bacon ice cream or bacon-and-egg ice cream is a modern invention in experimental cookery generally created by adding bacon to egg custard and freezing the mixture Although it was a joke in a Two Ronnies sketch it was eventually created for April Fools Day Heston Blumenthal experimented with the creation of ice cream making a custard similar to scrambled eggs then adding bacon to create one of his signature dishes It now appears on dessert menus in other high-end restaurants Bacon sundae United States The bacon sundae has been a seasonal offering sold by American restaurant chains Burger King and Denny s 20 21 Bacon martini United States A bacon martini is made by soaking strips of browned bacon in vodka for at least a day 22 It is finished when the vodka becomes opaque 23 A bacon martini is served by pouring it into a mixing glass half full of ice cubes mixing in a little vermouth 22 Bacon sandwich United Kingdom A bacon sandwich is a form of sandwich made from cooked bacon between two slices of bread usually buttered Often some form of sauce such as Brown sauce or Ketchup is included Bacon vodka A bacon flavoured vodka that is often used in cocktails such as Bloody Mary or bacon martini Bacon-wrapped scallops Scallops wrapped with bacon then cooked Bacon-wrapped shrimp Bacon-wrapped shrimp are shrimps which have the tails removed are wrapped in bacon 24 Baconator United States A hamburger from Wendy s that consist of two beef patties two slices of American cheese six strips of bacon mayonnaise ketchup on a bun Bacone San Francisco A cone made of bacon filled with scrambled eggs hash browns cheese topped with country gravy and a biscuit 25 BLT sandwich Great Britain A bacon lettuce tomato sandwich BLT is a closed-face sandwich containing mayonnaise layers of bacon lettuce leaves tomato slices 26 27 Culinary evidence shows that bacon lettuce tomato sandwiches are descended from the Victorian age tea sandwiches 28 Chicken fried bacon Texas A dish from Texas served with a white gravy cream sauce Chivito sandwich Uruguay A national dish of Uruguay that consists primarily of a thin slice of filet mignon churrasco beef with mayonnaise black green olives mozzarella tomatoes commonly also bacon fried hardboiled eggs ham It is served in a bun often with a side of French fries Chocolate covered bacon United States Sometimes offered at state fairs in gourmet candy bars Clams casino Rhode Island Clam on the halfshell with bacon a dish believed to have originated in Narragansett Rhode Island Club sandwich United States A traditional American sandwich with bacon others meats like turkey chicken as well as vegetable toppings such as lettuce tomatoes Mayonnaise is spread on the bread which is toasted 29 30 Cobb salad United States A garden salad that includes bacon avocado hard-boiled egg and roquefort cheese Coddle Ireland An Irish dish consisting of layers of roughly sliced pork sausages thinly sliced somewhat fatty back bacon with sliced potatoes onions varci Balkans A speciality of West Balkan cuisine that consists of thick bacon pieces that are fried in their own fat Fool s Gold Loaf Denver Colorado An Elvis favorite the sandwich consists of a single warmed hollowed-out loaf of bread filled with one jar of creamy peanut butter one jar of grape jelly a pound of bacon Garbure France A thick French soup stew of ham with cabbage other vegetables usually with cheese stale bread added Guanciale Italy An unsmoked Italian bacon prepared with pig s jowl cheeks Hangtown fry California A type of omelette made famous during the California Gold Rush in the 1850s The most common version includes bacon oysters combined with eggs fried together Hoppin John Southern United States Southern United States version of Rice beans that also contains bacon chopped onions beside the traditional ingredients beans rice Hot Brown Louisville Kentucky The Hot Brown is an open-faced sandwich of turkey bacon covered in Mornay cheese sauce May include other spices tomatoes Jambonette France A French culinary term for chopped pork bacon enclosed in rind moulded into a pear shape cooked Kranjska klobasa Slovenia A Slovenian sausage that consists of pork beef bacon spices Kugelis Lithuania A Lithuanian national dish that can be described as a casserole made with potatoes onion milk bacon eggs eaten with apple sauce Luther Burger United States A sandwich burger that is made with a doughnut instead of a burger bun contains a beef patty bacon stripes sometimes sliced cheese is served with French fries Maple bacon donut United States A maple bacon doughnut is built by placing strips of bacon on a soft maple doughnut with maple icing 31 In the pictured type two strips of bacon lie along the donut 32 Another version uses crushed bacon bits on an O -shaped donut 33 Mitch Morgan Telluride Colorado A cocktail that consists of a shot of bourbon whiskey served with a piece of fried bacon as a cocktail garnish Oysters en brochette New Orleans A traditional dish of the Creole cuisine of New Orleans It is skewers of raw oysters alternating with pieces of partially cooked bacon that are breaded with corn flour then deep-fried sauteed The pieces are then usually removed from the skewers served on top of triangle toasts with Meuniere sauce Peanut butter banana bacon sandwich United States A peanut butter banana bacon sandwich is a closed-face sandwich containing peanut butter chopped bacon sliced bananas 34 Pig Candy Pig candy is a dessert made from thick strips of smoked bacon and pecans coated them in caramel or another type of sugar 35 36 Pigs in a blanket UK version United Kingdom In the United Kingdom pigs in blankets refers to small sausages usually chipolatas wrapped in bacon 37 38 P rags Latvia An oblong crescent-shaped baked Latvian bread roll pastry most often containing a filling of finely chopped bacon onion Quiche Lorraine Quiche k i Lorraine is a baked dish made with eggs and milk or cream in a pastry crust in the form of an open-topped pie It contains cheese smoked bacon or lardons 39 Rouladen Germany A traditional dish in German cuisine bacon onion pickles mustard that are wrapped in thinly sliced beef then broiled Otherwise known as Beef Olives Rumaki Polynesian Duck chicken liver wrapped in bacon Samgyeopsal Korea A Korean dish of grilled at your table bacon served with a pepper sauce Salt pork Salt-cured pork that was a common standard portion throughout the American Civil War Seven-layer salad A salad that consist of at least seven layers of which one is made of bacon pieces Other layers may include iceberg lettuce tomatoes cucumbers onions sweet peas hard boiled eggs sharp cheddar cheese The salad is garnished with a mayonnaise-based dressing and or sour cream Szalonna Hungary Hungarian back bacon made of smoked pork fat with the rind traditional in Hungarian cuisine Slavink Netherlands A Dutch meat dish consisting usually of ground meat called half half half beef half pork wrapped in bacon cooked in butter vegetable Stegt Fl sk Denmark A dish from Denmark of thick slices of bacon often eaten with potatoes parsley sauce med persillesovs Tatws Pum Munud Wales Traditional Welsh Stew made with sliced vegetables potatoes smoked bacon Turos csusza Hungary A Hungarian savoury curd cheese or cottage cheese noodle dish made with small home made noodles pasta topped with crispy fried bacon sour cream unguiculata cowpea Vicieae Lens L culinaris lentil Vicia V faba fava bean broad bean Akara Acaraje West Africa Brazil Fried dough made from ground black-eyed peas black-eyed pea flour Onions peppers salt to taste are added for more flavor Typically eaten as a breakfast with pap or custard locally called akamu by Igbo people Achappam Kerala India Sweet shaped like a star Bamiyeh zulbi ball bad Iran Azerbaijan Traditional treat made from a yogurt starch-based dough which is fried before being dipped in syrup Similar to Turkish tulumba Banh chu i chien Vietnam Banana fritter Several varieties of banana may be used Banh g i Vietnam Empanada -like pastry filled with minced cellophane noodles minced pork cloud ear fungus thin slices of Chinese sausage Banh ran banh cam Vietnam Glutinous rice ball coated with white sesame seeds filled with sweetened mung bean paste Banh r Vietnam Sweet potato pancake Banh tom banh tom H Tay Vietnam Sweet potato battered shrimp fritter Bannock Canada Also called frybread Bannock Scotland A bread the same thickness as a scone Native Americans particularly Metis in western Canada the northern Great Plains in the United States adopted bannock in their own cuisine over the 18th 19th centuries BeaverTails Canada Pastries 1 - registered trademark oblong shaped fried dough like American elephant ears Beignet France The pastry is also present in New Orleans Louisiana as a deep-fried choux pastry covered with confectioner s sugar in the U S and Belgium sometimes described as a French doughnut however as with other variants of fried sweet pastry the beignet typically has its own distinctive characteristics shape texture These differences are sufficient in the minds of some of beignet devotees to object to it being considered a doughnut Berliner Germany and Switzerland The doughnut equivalents typically do not have the typical ring shape except for a variety in southern Germany as so-called Auszogne which have a ring shape but a skin in the middle but instead are solid usually filled with jam German doughnuts are sometimes called Berlin doughnuts in the US Bhatoora Indian Punjab Pakistan Very chewy bread made by flattened dough being fried until it puffs into a light brown fluffy form Binangkal Philippines Fried flour balls covered with sesame seeds Bolinho de chuva Brazil Deep-fried sweet dough balls Bomboloni Italy Similar to German Berliner with a cream or chocolate filling Boortsog Central Asia A fried dough food found in the cuisines of Central Asia Idel-Ural and Mongolia They may be thought of as cookies biscuits since they are fried they are sometimes compared to doughnuts Bugnes France Bunuelo Spain They typically consist of a simple wheat-based yeast dough often flavored with anise that is thinly rolled cut shaped into individual pieces then fried finished off with a sweet topping Bunuelos are first known to have been consumed among Spain s Morisco population C kc k Tatarstan Bashkortostan Russia A sweet made from unleavened dough cut rolled into hazelnut-sized balls which are then deep-fried in oil Chakli Murukku India A South Indian snack of savory crunchy twists made from rice and urad dal flour 2 Murukku means twisted in the Tamil language 3 The town of Manapparai in Tamil Nadu is particularly known for its murukku 4 Murukku is made in many varieties as a traditional treat for festivals such as Diwali and Krishna Janmashtami 5 Murukku are often served on special occasions within Iyer Tamil Brahmin families 6 Chapssal doughnut Korea Chewy mildly sweet doughnuts made with glutinous rice flour and filled with sweetened red bean paste Chiacchiere Italy And lattughe in Lombardy Cenci Italy And Donzelle in Tuscany - Chiacchiere also called cenci - lit rags can be served with honey on top or powdered sugar Donzelle are stripes of fried bread dough usually served with ham mozzarella Chiburekki Central Asia Crimea Russia A fried turnover with a filling of ground or minced meat and onions It is made with a single round piece of dough folded over the filling in a half-moon shape A national dish of the Crimean Tatars it is also popular throughout Central Asia Russia Ukraine Turkey Churro Spain A thin cylinder of deep-fried pastry with a characteristic ridged surface due to being extruded through a star shaped hole Churros are often had for breakfast in local fiestas matched with thick chocolate or white coffee They are sometimes homemade bought frozen to fry at home but most are bought at cafes from fixed ambulatory churrerias Ciambelle Italy The doughnut equivalents but they are never glazed Coxinha Brazil A croquette-like food with chicken filling Croquette s Europe Usually made of mashed-potato Crostoli Italy Or crostui in Friuli Venezia Giulia Curry bread Japan A curry -filled bread dipped in panko and deep fried It is usually pre-packaged sold in convenience stores bakeries Dutchie Canada Originated at Tim Horton s restaurants is a square doughnut-like pastry topped with raisins a sugary glaze Elephant ears United States Fairground specialty a large flat round fried yeast dough often covered in fruit sugar also called fried bread fried dough Whales Tails tiger ears pizza frita frying saucers doughboys Similar to Canadian BeaverTails Empana Curacao Aruba Bonaire Caribbean Dough made from pre-cooked cornmeal salt sugar aniseseed buter water It can have various fillings is fried in oil The filling can be ground meat cheese chicken tuna Empana s are sold at all places that cater to eaters on the go during the day as a filling snack but mostly in the morning as a fast breakfast item At parties often smaller sized ones are served Falafel Middle East Deep-fried balls of ground chickpeas fava bean Very popular amongst vegans and vegetarians as an alternative to kebab as it s served alongside hummus wrapped in a lavash with fresh vegetables various sauces usually available in kebab spots Fartura Portugal Fairground specialty fried in a spiral then snipped into pieces that are powdered with sugar see fartura Faworki Poland Also known as chrust is a fried crispy flat dough sometimes twisted sprinkled with confectioners sugar Frappe Italy And Sfrappole in Emilia Romagna Festival Jamaica Fried Sweet Dough 7 Fraser United Kingdom A disc of leavened wheat flour dough shallow fried in oil A traditional dish prepared by travelling communities usually in a frying pan over an open fire Frasers may be savory sweet can contain spices chopped onions garlic tomatoes In the 1990s frasers became a staple food of British environmental activists occupying wild sites threatened by government road building programs Fried bread United Kingdom - Is triangular usually quarter half slices of white bread fried in traditionally bacon dripping served on a plate with eggs bacon sausage black pudding beans tomatoes as part of a traditional Full English breakfast Fried Coke United States A creation made in the summer of 2006 which has proven very popular in Texas Batter is mixed with Coca-Cola syrup fried after which it is topped with more Coke syrup whipped cream a cherry etc 8 Fritter Is any kind of food coated in batter deep fried Although very similar to a doughnut it differs in the fact that it requires some base ingredient beyond the dough it is cooked with Fritule Croatia Frybread United States Also known as popovers is a Native American fried dough which may range from bread-like to donut-like depending on the source as many tribes use different recipes Funnel cake United States A creation which is made with fried sweet pastry where the pastry dough is extruded through a funnel into a pan of hot oil allowed to criss-cross in the oil until the string of dough fills the bottom of the pan in a kind of tangled spaghetti-like arrangement which is cooked as a cake rather than an individual snack Funnel cakes are usually associated with carnivals fairs amusement parks and seaside towns much like cotton candy Gogo i Romania Round ring shaped fried dough usually topped with powdered sugar filled with fruit jam chocolate cream Haliva Circassia Russia A fried dough turnover filled with either potatoes or Circassian cheese Hirschh rner Germany A dough that uses Hirschhornsalz Pottasche as leavening agents The dough is rolled out thin cut into diamonds One corner is pulled through a slit cut in the middle of each diamond They are then deep fried dripped off turned over in a bowl of granulated sugar until covered A Northern German specialty prepared on New Year s Eve Hushpuppies United States Savory fried dough balls made from a heavy cornmeal batter Jalebi India Pakistan Hindi Urdu Punjabi Telugu Jilapi Bengali this is a deep-fried sweet batter with rose water saffron Similar to Persian Zoolbiya Jersey wonders Jersey These are also known as Mervelles Jin deui China A hollow fried pastry made of glutinous rice flour that is coated with sesame seeds and filled with a sweet filling Kachori India Dough balls filled with different kinds of savoury stuffings like de-skinned moong bean de-skinned black gram etc along with salt pepper red chili powder other spices Kachori Pakistan Doughnuts filled with ground beef lamb deep fried Vegetarian ones often contain potatoes Karinto Japan Khuushuur Mongolia A fried turnover with a filling of ground or minced meat beef mutton onions garlic other spices Khvorost Russia In Russian crisp pastry made out of dough shaped into thin twisted ribbons deep-fried sprinkled with powdered sugar Kleina Iceland Plural Kleinur Klejne Denmark Plural Klejner Koeksister South Africa A traditional South African confectionery made of fried dough infused in syrup honey The name derives from the Dutch word koek which generally means a wheat flour confectionery also the origin of the American English word cookie Krafne Croatia From German - Krapfen Krapfen Austria and Bavaria Round fried dough typically filed with apricot jam vanilla cream topped with powdered sugar Kro tule Croatia Other local names hru tule hrustule hrostule krustavice krustule From Latin Crustulum cookie pastry Langos Hungary Laufabrau Iceland A traditional kind of Icelandic bread that is most often eaten in the Christmas season 9 Originating from northern Iceland but now eaten throughout the entire country 9 it consists of round very thin flat cakes with a diameter of about 15 to 20 cm 6 to 8 inches decorated with leaf-like geometric patterns fried briefly in hot fat oil 10 Lokma or Loukoumades Turkey Greece Somewhat like crisp doughnut holes loukoumades pronounced loo-koo-MA-thes consist of deep-fried dough balls marinated in honey cinnamon L rtsy Finland A thin half-moon shaped pastry originally from Savonlinna eastern Finland It is made with a variety of fillings the most common ones are either a savory meat filling a sweet apple filling Luchi India Eastern Bangladesh Made of wheat flour typical of Oriya Assamese Bengali cuisine dough is made by mixing fine maida flour with water spoonful of ghee then divided in small balls flattened by rolling-pin individually deep-fried in cooking oil ghee 4-5 inches diameter usually served with curries gravies Luqmat al-qadi Middle East literally judge s mouthful this is a relative etymological ancestor of the Greek Loukoumas Also called sfingis in Arabic and lokma Turkish see below Ma Hua China A fried dough twist made by frying a bar of dough in peanut oil Ma hua has a shiny golden look Malasada Portugal A fried dough from Sao Miguel Island Azores Portugal which are also popular in Hawaii and in Cape Cod Massachusetts where they are called flippers Mandazi East Africa A fried bread served with no glazing frosting that is popular in areas around the Swahili countries of Kenya Tanzania Often eaten along with breakfast tea as a snack by itself Meat doughnut Finland Lihapiirakka M kitzi Bulgaria - similar to Funnel cake Mutzenmandeln Germany Dough triangles deep fried covered in confectioner s sugar Originally from Southern Germany now a common fair snack offered by pastry stalls around Christmas throughout Germany Namak pare Pakistan India A crunchy savory snack of the Indian Subcontinent they re ribbon-like strips of pastry delicately seasoned with cumin seeds carom seeds and caraway seeds and deep fried in pure ghee clarified butter Nonnevotte Netherlands and Belgium Literally nuns bottoms eaten around the Carnival season in Limburg Oliebollen Smoutebollen Netherlands and Belgium Referred to as Dutch doughnuts or occasionally as Dutch Donuts which contain pieces of apple and or dried fruit like raisins traditionally eaten around New Year Ox-tongue pastry China An elliptical-shaped dough that resembles an ox tongue They are sweet in taste the texture is chewy fine P czki Poland Springy doughnuts filled with jam often coated with granulated powdered sugar See also Ponchiki Russian pyshki or Ponichki Bulgarian Pakora India Pakistan Also called bhajji in India Telugu this is a deep-fried vegetable fritters in a gram flour batter In Pakistan pakoras filled with ground beef are also common Pampushky Ukraine Panikeke Samoa Also called panikeke lapotopoto this is a deep fried sweetened fritter Panikeke are often served with butter and or jam Papadum Papar India Also called papad papar etc this is a fried wafer made from a dough made of lentils often urad dal spices When fried as a dough with sufficient moisture it is called pappa am When fried dry it is called appal am Papadum Pakistan A fried wafer made of rice flour often sprinkled with spices eaten as a snack Paraoa Parai New Zealand Fried wheat dough sometimes with fermented potato rewena leavening 11 Often served with butter and golden syrup Paratha Bangladesh India Pakistan Also called parantha porota etc this is a pan-fried flatbread often stuffed with vegetables cheese ground meat In Pakistan parathas stuffed with either potatoes radishes ground meat are popular a common breakfast dish Layered parathas lachah tehdaar parathas are often used as a wrap for kebab rolls Pastechi Curacao Aruba Bonaire Caribbean Pastry made from white flower baking powder salt sugar water lard butter It can have various fillings is traditionally fried in oil but for lesser fat content more healthy version it can be baked in the oven The filling is usually ground meat cheese but chicken tuna saltfish bakiou are also very popular On Aruba more variations for the fillings are prepared like corned beef curry chicken ham cheese conch meat Pastechi s are sold at all places that cater to eaters on the go during the day as a filling snack but mostly in the morning as a fast breakfast item At parties often smaller sized ones are served Pastel Brazil A thin pastry envelope containing minced meat catupiry and chicken shrimp another filling then deep-fried Pasztecik szczeci ski Poland Machine-produced deep-fried yeast dough stuffed with meat vegetarian filling Peremech or belyash Tatarstan Bashkortostan Russia Peremech Tatar is a fried bun made of either leavened unleavened dough stuffed with minced meat It usually has a hole in the middle A similar dish is called belyash Russian in Russian Pestinos Spain Petulla Albania Dough with yeast Very similar to the fried dough found in US amusement parks fairs Picarones Peru A sweet ring-shaped pumpkin-based fritter often served with a molasses syrup Pirozhki pyrizhki Bulgaria Russia Ukraine Pirozhki Russian or pyrizhki Ukrainian i are traditional Eastern European baked fried buns stuffed with a variety of fillings Porras Spain Often served for breakfast especially in Madrid Priganice Montenegro Fritters flat doughnuts served with honey cheese jam Puff Puff Nigeria Also a West African dish is a fried sweet dough with no glazing frosting made from flour sugar yeast vanilla extract typically served as an appetizer when entertaining guest bought as a snack from a street vendor Puftaloon Australia Made from flour salt butter milk traditionally fried in animal fat popular with children in winter Puri India Unleavened made of wheat flour refined whole-wheat coarse dough of flour salt rolled into small circle bigger cut into small circles deep fried in ghee vegetable oil puffs up in all directions like a round ball from steam inside Variations include the North Indian bhatoora Hindi bha r the Bengali luchi Bengali Poori Pakistan Unleavened made of all-purpose flour deep-fried bread It is served in breakfast with chickpeas semolina halwa as a part of halwa poori Papri India Crisp fried dough wafers made from refined white flour oil In papri chaat the papris are served with boiled potatoes boiled chick peas chilis yogurt tamarind chutney topped with chaat masala sev Rissole France Minced meat fish enclosed in pastry deep fried Rosette Sweden Ornate irons are dipped into batter then dropped into hot oil The pastry quickly separates from the iron which is removed The rosettes are then fried to a light brown removed from the oil sprinkled with powdered sugar Rosquillas Spain Samosa India Pakistan Including variants such as mitha samosa shingara etc this is a deep-fried filled pastry Sata andagi Japan A sweet ball-shaped snack similar to the doughnut native to the Okinawa Prefecture Schneeballen Germany Snowballs Dough cut into strips formed into a ball fried then covered in toppings popular in Rothenburg Shuangbaotai China A sweet fried dough food with cavernous holes in the food a crisp outside They are made by sticking two small pieces of dough together frying them causing them to separate slightly while still connected thus resembling conjoined twins for which the food is named Shelpek Kazakhstan A deep-fried flatbread commonly consumed all over Kazakhstan Smultring Norway Literally lard ring this is similar to a doughnut but smaller without glacing filling flavored with cardamom Sopaipilla United States Argentina Chile Peru Uruguay A fried dough side dish dessert popular among Mexican-Americans in the Southwest Sopaipillas puff with air when fried the finished product resembling a pillow They are often served with honey but may also be sprinkled with a cinnamon sugar mixture Sopaipillas are characteristic of Tex-Mex or New Mexican cuisine Struffoli Italy A dessert of Neapolitan origin Sufganiyah Israel Jewish Telebhaja Bengali fritters Bengal Tenkasu Japan Often produced as byproduct of Tempura cooking because bits of fried batter are easily made while deep frying but they are also produced at factories by deep frying trickling batter Timbit Canada Doughnut holes sold in many different flavors originating at Tim Hortons and seen as somewhat iconic in Canada Toutin or Touton Canada Fried bits of leftover bread dough often served with molasses Most popular on Newfoundland Tulumba Turkey Balkans Traditional treat consisting of fried batter soaked in syrup Similar to bamiyeh in Iranian cuisine Twisted doughnut Korea Philippines A traditional doughnut variant from Korea and the Visayas islands of the Philippines with a distinctive twisted shape Urr dla Germany A fried dough made in Upper Franconia and served sprinkled with powdered sugar It is a specialty of Franconian Switzerland in the area around Forchheim Also called Braada breite Kuchla 12 U tipci Serbia Vada India Also called vara bara etc this is lentil cakes shaped into patties donut shapes Verhuny Ukraine or Khvorost literally angel wings Vetkoek South Africa Pronounced FET-kook this is a fried bread dough traditional to Afrikaner and also called magwenya by the indigenous population It is typically rolled into a ball or hot dog bun shape Youtiao China A popular breakfast food in Chinese culture They are savory and oily in taste The texture is crispy on the outside chewy on the inside with large holes Zeppole Italy Commonly light-weight deep-fried dough balls about 2 inches 5 1 cm in diameter these doughnuts fritters are usually topped with powdered sugar may be filled with custard jelly cannoli-style pastry cream a butter-and-honey mixture Wikimedia Commons has media related to Fried dough foods Africa Asia Awameh Bambalouni Bamiyeh fresh hand-pulled pasta The miller s wife s pasta Abruzzo Matriciani Similar to perciatelli but folded over rather than hollowed out Perciatelli Identical to bucatini From perciare to hollow Maccheroncelli Maccheronicini Mezzanelli Long Macaroni 4 Pici Very thick irregular long hand-rolled pasta 9 From appiciare to stick 9 Lunghetti Montalcino pinci Montepulciano umbrici ciriole Umbria 9 10 Tuscany 9 Spaghetti A long thin cylindrical pasta of Italian origin made of semolina or flour and water 11 Spaghettini spaghettoni are slightly thinner thicker respectively 12 Little strings 2 Spaghetti is the plural form of the Italian word spaghetto which is a diminutive of spago meaning thin string twine 11 Vermicelli fide fidi fidelini ristoranti vermicelloni filatelli vermicelloni giganti spaghettini spaghettoni 4 12 Vermicelli A traditional pasta round that is thicker than spaghetti refers in U S to a style thinner than spaghetti Worms 2 Vermicelloni Thick vermicelli Large worms Bavette Narrower version of tagliatelle Bibs 2 Bavettine Narrower version of bavette Fazzoletti Thin rectangles squares of pasta Handkerchief 13 Fazzoletti di seta mandilli di sea Ligurian dialect 13 Liguria 13 Fettucce Wider version of fettuccine Little slices Fettuccine Ribbon of pasta approximately 6 5 millimeters wide Larger thicker than tagliatelle 14 Little slices 15 from affettare to slice 14 Lasagnette fettucce ramicce sagne 4 14 Rome 14 Fileja Elongated screw 16 17 filateddhi filatelli fusilli maccaruni aru ferru ricci di donna 18 Vibo Valentia 19 Lagane 20 Wide pasta Lasagnoni Bardele 4 Lasagna Square rectangle sheets of pasta that sometimes have fluted edges lasagne ricce The square of pasta is lasagna while the dish is lasagne 21 Possibly from Latin lasanum or Greek lasonon Cooking pot 15 21 or the greco-roman laganum a flat piece of bread 21 bardele lasagnoni Veneto capellasci Liguria sagne Salento lagana Apulia 21 the fluted version can also be doppio festone sciabo sciablo 22 Lasagnette Narrower version of lasagne Little lasagne Lasagnotte Longer version of lasagne Bigger lasagne Linguettine Narrower version of linguine Little tongues Emilia-Romagna strengozze Marche sagne mpezze Latium pizzelle Apulia foglie di salice Piedmont 25 Pappardelle Thick flat ribbons of egg-based dough From Tuscan papparsi to pig out 26 Papparelle 4 paparele Veneto paspardelle Marche 26 Tuscany and northern Italy 26 Pillus Very thin ribbons Pizzoccheri A type of short tagliatelle a flat ribbon pasta made with buckwheat flour the lack of gluten makes them hard to manipulate 27 From pinzochero bigot 27 Fugascion pizzocher di Tei 27 Valtellina Lombardy 27 Sagnarelli Rectangular ribbons with fluted edges Rombi Rhombus -shaped ribbons Sagnette Short thick ribbons from Abruzzo and Molise Also called sagne or tagliolini Scialatelli or scialatielli Short flat ribbons Sorrento 28 Spaghetti alla chitarra Square spaghetti 29 made of egg flour Named after the guitar-like device used to cut the pasta 29 which has a wooden frame strung with metal wires sheets of pasta are pressed down onto the device then the wires are strummed so the slivers of pasta fall through Abruzzo Stringozzi Similar to shoelaces Shoestring-like Tagliatelle Ribbons of egg-based pasta 30 Generally narrower than fettuccine From the Italian tagliare meaning to cut 30 Testaroli Trenette Thin ribbon ridged on one side Slightly thicker than linguine Tripoline Thick ribbon ridged on one side Signorine 4 Anelli anelloni anellini anelletti Short tubular annular-shaped pasta sometimes with ridges on the inside outside 32 Rings small rings Anelloni d Africa large rings 33 Calamarata Wide ring shaped pasta Squid-like Calamaretti Little squids Casarecce Short lengths extruded into a S shape 34 From casereccio meaning homemade Casarecci Cesariccia 4 Cavatappi Corkscrew-shaped macaroni Corkscrews Cellentani 35 amori spirali tortiglioni fusilli rigati Chifferi Short wide macaroni Can be smooth lisce furrowed rigati From the Austrian cookies Kipferl 36 Fagioloni Short narrow tube Large beans Fusilli Long thick corkscrew-shaped pasta that may be solid hollow The word fusilli presumably comes from Italian fuso meaning spindle 37 Eliche girandole rotini tortiglioni spirali 4 37 Fusilli bucati A hollow version of Fusilli 38 Note different shapes can be attached to this name Can be long short twined lunghi corti gemellati 39 Holed spindles Busiata maccaruna di casa pirciati filati cu lu pirtuso fusilli col buco 40 39 Gemelli A single S-shaped strand of pasta twisted in a loose spiral The name derives from the Italian for twins 15 Gomiti Elbow maccheroni furrowed From gomito elbow 41 Maccheroni Tubes either bent straight 42 From Greek for food made from barley 43 Macaroni 4 outside of Italy maccheroncini 44 Naples 44 Maccheroncelli Hollow tube-shaped pasta that is slightly smaller than a pencil in thickness 45 Small maccheroni Marziani Short spirals Martians refers to the antennae of cartoon martians citation needed Mezzani pasta Short curved tube 46 47 Half-size ones Perciatelloni Mezze Zite Regine Scaloppi Napoletani 4 Mezze penne Short version of penne Half-pens Mezzi bombardoni Wide short tubes Half bombards Paccheri Large tube pasta often topped with sauce stuffed with ingredients 48 May collapse under own weight when cooking 49 from Napolitan paccharia Slaps with a depreciative -ero to indicate something common 49 The name has been ascribed to a slapping sound they may make when eaten 48 Naples 49 Pasta al ceppo Sheet pasta that is similar in shape to a cinnamon stick 50 Log-type pasta Penne Medium length tubes with ridges cut diagonally at both ends They can be either lisce smooth or rigate grooved Mostaccioli is also sometimes used for Barilla products pennette have a shorter length and pennoni are wider thicker 51 Pens after a quill pen feathers 2 Pennine mezze pennette lisce mezze penne mezzani pennettine pennuzze penne regina 4 mostaccioli penne a candela penne di natale natalini penne di ziti zitoni 52 Lazio 52 Penne ricce Curled penne variant usually grooved Curly penne Rigatoncini Smaller version of rigatoni Small lined ones Rigatoni Medium-Large tube with square-cut ends sometimes slightly curved Always grooved straight bent depending on extrusion method 53 From rigare to line furrow groove 53 Bombardoni cannaroni rigati cannerozzi rigati rigatoni romani trivelli tuffolini rigati 53 Lazio 53 Sagne ncannulate Long tube formed of twisted ribbon Caned lasagne Sedani Slightly larger than maccheroni with a similar slight bend Can be smooth lisce furrowed rigati From sedano celery Sedanini cornetti diavoletti diavolini folletti zanne d elefante if smooth 54 Spirali Spiraled tubes Spirals Spiralini Scharfalini Tightly coiled spirali Little spirals Tortiglioni Larger tubes than rigatoni the grooves are also deeper spiral around the pasta 55 From Latin torquere to twist 55 Elicoidali 4 Campania Lazio 55 Trenne Penne shaped as a triangle Tuffoli Ridged rigatoni Ziti Long narrow hose-like tubes larger than mezzani also called mezzi ziti or bucatini that are traditionally broken before being put to cook 56 The addition of the word rigati e g ziti rigati denotes lines ridges on the pasta s surface Ziti candelati are longer zitoni a bit larger Bride bridegroom ziti is plural in Sicilian dialect 56 Boccolotti zitoni zituane candele ziti candelati 4 56 Southern Italy 56 Boccoli Short thick twisted shape Sardinia Campanelle or torchio Flattened bell-shaped pasta with a frilly edge on one end Torchio are identical with a smooth edge 57 Bellflower 15 58 gigli are lilies 15 torchio is a press usually for olive grapes but also pasta 57 Gigli 58 cornetti corni di bue 4 Castellane Shell pasta coiled into a conical shape Castellane can be translated as castle dweller for the shape of the pasta loosely resembles that of a long flowing robe Cavatelli Short solid lengths Exist in three size usually measured in fingers one two three 59 From the verb cavare meaning to hollow Gnocchetti manatelli orecchie di prete strascinati truoccoli capunti cingule minuich rascatelli zinnezinne Basilicata cantaroggini cavatieddi cecatelli cicatelli cecatidde mignuicchi strascenate tagghjunghele Apulia and Campania pincinelle Marche cavatielle ncatenate cazzarille ciufele Molise cavasuneddi cavatuneddi gnucchitti gnocculi Sicily 59 Southern continental Italy i e Campania Apulia Molise Basilicata Calabria and Sicily 59 Cencioni Petal shaped slightly curved with rough convex side Little rags Conchiglie Seashell shaped usually furrowed rigate Shells 2 Arselle abissini coccioline conchigliette tofettine 60 cinesini margaritine cinesi rigati mezzi cocci margherite rigate cappettine 4 Corzetti Flat figure-eight stamped from Liguria 61 The name derives from a XIV Century Genovese coin the corzetto 61 Curzetti Genoa crosets Piedmont crosetti Emilia-Romagna croxetti torsellini 61 Creste di galli Short curved ruffled Cock s comb 2 Farfalle Bow tie butterfly shaped Butterflies 2 fiochetti fiocconi farfalloni galla genovese 4 strichetti Modena nocchette Apulia and Abruzzo 62 Fiorentine Grooved cut tubes Florentine Fiori Shaped like a flower Flowers Foglie d ulivo Shaped like an olive leaf Olive leaves Fusilli Avellinesi Ribbon rolled around a stick The word fusilli presumably comes from fuso as traditionally it is spun by pressing rolling a small rod over each thin strips of pasta to wind them around it in a corkscrew shape much like a modern Turkish spindle Long rifles Garganelli Egg pasta in a square shape rolled into a tube From garganel oesophagus 63 15 Maccheroni al petine Marche fischioni 63 Emilia-Romagna 63 Gnocchi Lobed shells Not to be confused with gnocchi dumplings Possibly knots 15 Gramigne Spaccatelle Short curled lengths of pasta Spaccatelle are larger 64 From gramigna weed 2 or spaccatura slot 64 Crestine margherite lisce fagioletti zitellini tubettini lunghi 4 gramignoni spaccatelle 65 Sicily 64 Lanterne Curved ridges Lanterns Lumache Snailshell-shaped pieces Larger than gomiti Snails 2 Lumachelle lumachette cirillini 4 chifferini ciocchiolette cirillini gomitini gozziti lumachelle lumachoni pipe pipette tofarelle 66 Maccheroni al pettine Egg pasta in a square shape rolled into a tube pressed on a weaving reed in Italian pettine bigger than garganelli Maccheroni on weaving reed Mandala Designed by Philippe Starck in 1987 for French pasta maker Panzani intended to compensate for overcooking 67 A reference to mandalas Marille Designed by Giorgetto Giugiaro in 1983 - like a rolling ocean wave in cross-section with internal rugosities but unsuccessful no longer produced 67 From mare meaning sea Malloreddus Hand-rolled shell-shaped pasta In Campidanese dialect a malloreddu is a male cow plur malloreddus 68 Gnocchetti sardi 4 caidos macarones cravaos maccaronis de orgiu 68 Sardinia 68 Orecchiette Irregular disc with a central dome a slightly thicker crown Strascinate are identical but flat 69 Little ears 2 strascinate recchini Rome recchietele Campania Molise and Basilicata orecchie di prete Abruzzo and Basilicata cicatelli Apulia recchie di prevete Foggia cagghiubbi fenescecchie Bari chancierelle pochiacche small big versions Tarento stacchiodde Lecce 69 Apulia 69 Pipe rigate Very similar to Lumaconi but has lines running the length of it Smoking pipes Quadrefiore Square with rippled edges From quadro square and fiore flower Radiatori Shaped like radiators they were created between the First and Second World Wars 70 They are often used in similar dishes as rotelle or fusilli because their shape works well with thicker sauces 71 Radiator 15 Marziani 4 Ricciolini Short wide pasta with a 90-degree twist Little curls Ricciutelle Short spiralled pasta Little curls Rotelle Wagon wheel-shaped pasta Little wheels Biciclette ruotine ruote rotelline ruotelline rotine rotini world s rarest pasta made of 256 equal strands of thinly pulled folded dough laid in the sun to dry 74 The threads or wool of God Nuoro 75 better source needed Trofie Thin twisted pasta made of durum wheat water 76 Trofie bastarde are made with chestnut flour 77 possibly from Greek trophe food 15 or local Genovese dialect strofissia or strufuggia to rub 77 Rechelline trofiette 77 Liguria 77 characters Alphabet Alphabetti Spaghetti trademark Anelli Small rings of pasta not to be confused with Calamaretti Rings small rings Aneletti aniduzzi cerchionetti taraduzzi 33 Sicily 33 Anellini midolline semoni risone risoni 4 riso 83 Pastina Although pastina is the name for an entire family of miniature pasta shapes it is also used to describe the most basic one in this family - small spheres smaller than acini di pepe Little pasta Piombi Spheres slightly larger than acini di pepe Pearl pasta Puntine Smaller version of Risi Quadrettini Small flat squares of pasta Little squares 15 schiaffoni 4 Cappelletti Squares of dough filled with minced meat closed to form a triangle Little caps hats 94 95 cappelli cappelli del prete nicci in Tuscany 94 Caramelle A stuffed pasta resembling casa house Veneto Conchiglioni Large stuffable seashell shaped Large shells Culurgiones A stuffed pasta typical with a filling of potato mint Sardinia particularly the South-Eastern Ogliastra region Fagottini A purse bundle of pasta made from a round of dough gathered into a ball-shaped bundle often stuffed with ricotta fresh pear Little cloth bundles Lumaconi Large snailshell-shaped pieces Large snails Lumachoni Mezzelune Semicircular pockets about 2 5 in diameter Half-moons Occhi di lupo Large stuffed penne-shaped pasta Ribbed wolf eyes 2 Pansotti Triangular shape with a bulging center does not contain meat 97 Big bellies 97 Ravioli di magro 97 Liguria 97 Ravioli Two squares of pasta on top of another stuffed with cheese ground meat pureed vegetables mixtures thereof Many claimed origins possibly from rapa vegetable root or rabibole cheap stuff in Ligurian dialect simply from avvolgere to wrap 87 Sacchettini Round similar to fagottini but also may use ravioli stuffing A small square of pasta brought around the stuffing twisted Little sacks Sacchettoni Large sacchetini Large little sacks Sacchetti 4 Tortelli Square sheet of pasta folded into a triangle discus folded into half-circle with both extremities subsequently joined to form a ring shape About 30x35 mm in size Sweet variations can be found tortelli cremaschi 98 Little pies 98 Cappellacci turtello Emilia-Romagna tordelli Tuscany casonsei Bergame and Brescia 98 Tortellini Ring-shaped usually stuffed with a mixture of meat cheese About 25x20mm in size 99 Small tortelli 99 Agnoli presuner prigioneri Capri 99 Tortelloni Round rectangular similar to tortelli but larger 38x45mm Stuffing usually does not include meat 100 Tufoli A pasta shell large enough for stuffing as with meat cheese From a southern Italian dialect plural of tufolo tube modification of Latin tubulus tubule Large tube Maniche Gigantoni Occhi di elefante Elefante Canneroni grandi Occhi di bove 4 Canederli Small balls of dough Italy Sicily Breaded deep fried stuffed rice balls Arroz caldo Philippines Thin rice porridge cooked with chicken ginger onions garnished with spring onions toasted garlic and calamansi Arroz chaufa Peru Chow fun rice Chinese fried rice with a Peruvian twist Arroz borracho Puerto Rico Rice cooked with sazon sofrito chickpeas ground meat beer Arroz con gandules Puerto Rico A part of the Puerto Rican gastronomy consisting of a combination of rice pigeon peas olives capers pork cooked in the same pot with Puerto Rican-style sofrito spices annatto oil 2 Arroz con huevo frito Central America and South America Rice with fried egg Arroz con pollo Spain Rice with chicken the dish which originated in Spain as a form of pilaf is a staple throughout Latin America 3 4 5 6 7 It is a traditional dish of Latin America and the Caribbean especially in Puerto Rico Colombia Venezuela Ecuador Panama Peru Cuba Costa Rica Honduras the Dominican Republic where it is called locrio de pollo and Saint Martin where it is called lokri locreo Arroz de lisa mullet rice Colombia Caribbean region Traditionally served in bijao leaf with cooked cassava a triangle of costeno cheese and a sauce of suero atollabuey Arroz negro Spain Black rice dish blackened with cuttlefish ink Baghali polo Iran This is rice with lima beans and dill Banh ch ng Vietnam This is a cake-dish usually eaten on Tet Vietnamese new year eve which is pork in the center mashed pea rice wrapped in leaves Ba-wan Taiwan This is a savory snack food made from rice paste meat usually shiitake mushrooms and bamboo shoots It is often found at Taiwan night markets Also called rou-wan-zhi Bi pong moun Cambodia A rice egg dish Several variations exist Bibimbap Korea Mixed vegetables on rice Bibingka Philippines A rice cake usually eatan during Christmas May be topped with cottage cheese salted egg freshly grated shredded young coconut meat Biko Philippines A sweet dish made of sticky rice cooked in coconut milk and sugar topped with thick caramelized coconut syrup and latik Dan Bauk Myanmar Burmese style Biryani Biryani Indian subcontinent Preparation of spicy fried rice with meat fish chicken vegetables Bisi bele bath India A rice-based dish with its origins in the state of Karnataka India Bisi-bele-bhaath translates to hot lentil rice in the Kannada language The traditional preparation of this dish is quite elaborate involves the use of spicy masala toor dal a type of lentil and vegetables Spices like nutmeg and asafoetida curry leaves and tamarind pulp used in its preparation contribute to the unique flavor taste of this dish Bhaat Indian subcontinent Rice that has been cooked either by steaming boiling Bokkeumbap Korea Fried rice usually with some other ingredient like kimchi bokkeumbap Kimchi fried rice Boribap Korea Rice boiled with barley Boudin United States Cajun rice dressing stuffed into a sausage casing Cabidela Portugal Rice with chicken rabbit meat Chakara pongali India Chalbap Korea Cooked sweet rice mixed with red beans jujubes and chestnuts Chao Vietnam Chazuke Japan Dashi green tea hot water poured over cooked rice Common toppings include Japanese pickles tsukemono nori fish roe such as tarako or mentaiko Chimichanga Mexico parts of southern United States This is a deep-fried burrito most commonly made with rice cheese machaca carne adobada shredded chicken folding it into a rectangular package deep-frying Carri Mauritius Reunion Rice with chicken beef tomatoes chili curry Chitranna India This is a rice preparation made by sauting groundnut sesame seeds red chili and turmeric in oil adding it to cooked rice mixing Ci fan tuan Shanghai China and Taiwan Prepared by tightly wrapping a piece of youtiao fried dough with glutinous rice Claypot chicken rice China Malaysia and Singapore This is a rice dish served with sliced chicken salted fish Chinese sausage vegetables The rice is cooked in the claypot first the cooked ingredients are added in later Some places serve it with dark soya sauce Traditionally the cooking is done over a charcoal stove giving the dish a distinctive flavour C m t m Vietnam A dish in Vietnamese cuisine made from rice with fractured rice grains T m refers to the broken rice grains while c m refers to cooked rice 8 9 Congee East South and Southeast Asia A type of porridge Sometimes called rice congee but often simply shortened to congee There is a large variety of congee in Hong Kong it is eaten very frequently as a staple food The base is made by boiling rice then letting it simmer for a long time Different ingredients are added depending on the region The length of the simmering also varies by region Cantonese congee is generally cooked longer for a smoother texture Coriander rice India Easily made by using boiled rice coriander paste oil chana dal cumin seeds jeere lemon juice salt Curd rice India Simple preparations are a mixture of boiled rice yogurt More complex variations also exist Curry rice Japan also popular in other parts of East and Southeast Asia Although curry is often eaten with rice in many countries it is seen as a main dish The Japanese kar raisu lit curry rice though is a standard combination of rice with a British influenced Japanese curry of which there exist several types Dal bhat Indian subcontinent Rice lentil soup Dirty Rice Cajun cuisine Creole cuisine Pictured is dirty rice topped with a pork chop Dolma Armenia Azerbaijan Turkey Middle East Eggplant Zucchini peppers onion tomatoes stuffed with rice Dosa India Rice and lentil pancakes with origins in Udipi Karnataka Popular breakfast dish in South India Etouffee Cajun Creole cuisine Found in both Cajun and Creole cuisine Etouffee is typically prepared with shellfish over rice The dish employs a technique known as smothering a popular method of cooking in the Cajun areas of southwest Louisiana Fried rice China Pictured is Chinese-style fried rice from Singapore Fried rice Philippines Extremely traditional rare Jambalaya Cajun Creole Meat-seafood-vegetable stock to which rice is added Jibaro Puerto Rico Yellow-rice cooked with annatto oil sofrito spices with a fried egg on top Jiuniang China This is a sweet dish made from fermenting sticky rice with yeast This can be eaten alone steamed is added to other foods Jollof rice West Africa tomato pepper based stew to which rice is added boiled in usually served with chicken salad fried plantain Ofada rice Nigeria Ofada rice is a local Nigerian Delicacy eaten in Palm leaves It is made from locally produced grown rice It is usually garnished with cow meat parts fried ground pepper Juk Korea Generic term for porridge made from rice There are many different varieties Kabsa KSA Jordan Rice usually long-grain mostly basmati cooked with meat spices vegetables Kateh Iran A simple sticky-rice dish from Mazandaran and Gilan Kande Pohe India A simple flattened rice dish from Maharashtra usually eaten as breakfast Katsudon Japan A bowl of rice topped with a deep-fried pork cutlet egg condiments Kedgeree India Flaked fish usually smoked haddock boiled rice eggs butter Ketupat Indonesia Malaysia Also called Lontong - Rice wrapped in coconut leaves weaved pouch boiled serve with other food such as Satay vegetables fried chicken curry etc Khao kan chin Thailand A northern Thai dish of rice that is mixed with pork blood steamed inside a banana leaf It is served with cucumber onions fried dried chillies Khao kha mu Thailand Originally a Thai Chinese dish it is rice served with sliced pork leg that has been stewed in soy sauce spices Khao khluk kapi Thailand Rice is fried with shrimp paste and served with sweet pork sour mango fried shrimp chillies shallots Khao lam Thailand Glutinous rice is boiled steamed with sugar sometimes other ingredients in a section of bamboo Most often eaten as a snack dessert This is very similar to lemang Khao man kai Thailand The Thai version of Hainanese chicken rice it is made in a slightly different way than the original served with a very different dipping sauce made from fermented soy beans garlic ginger and bird s eye chilies Khao mok Thailand The Thai version of a biryani it is typical of Thai-Muslim cuisine Khao na pet Thailand The Thai version of a Cantonese style roast duck served with rice Khao niao mamuang Thailand Sticky rice cooked in sweetened thick coconut milk served with slices of ripe mango Khao phat kaeng kiao wan Thailand Rice fried with green curry Khao phat kaphrao Thailand Rice fried with holy basil and meat Khao phat nam liap Thailand Rice fried with the fruit of the Canarium album Khao tom mat Thailand A traditional Thai dessert made from sticky rice coconut milk and bananas It s usually wrapped in banana leaf or coconut leaf Khao tom pla Thailand A rice soup with fish Kheer Indian subcontinent Sweet dish of rice cooked in milk dry fruit sugar Cooled before serving Khichdi Indian subcontinent Rice cooked with lentils vegetables spices Kiribath Sri Lanka Cooked with milk Also known as Milk-rice Kongbap Korea Brown white rice cooked together with beans and sometimes also other grains Kushari Egypt Rice lentils chickpeas and macaroni topped with tomato sauce fried onion Lemang Indonesia Malaysia Glutinous rice with coconut milk cooked in bamboo stalks over open fire Traditional dish of the Minangkabau people accompanying Rendang Lime rice India Loco Moco Hawaii United States A bowl of rice topped with a meat patty and gravy with a sunny side up egg on top Lokri Saint Martin Rice bite-size pieces of chicken mixed
