Philippines Spring rolls wrapper made from rice flour Maifun Asia This is a category which includes both dry in-broth rice vermicelli noodle dishes The specific dish is usually named after its non-vermicelli ingredients its preparation E g Cao mai fun panfried maifun will usually have a protein such as pork chicken and seasonings usually green onion Mandi Yemen Rice cooked with meat lamb or chicken a mixture of spices Mansaf Iraq Jordan Palestine Saudi Arabia and Syria Rice is cooked separately lamb meat is cooked in a sauce of fermented dried yogurt served with rice bulgur Maqluba Middle-East Consisting of rice eggplant cauliflower casserole that is then turned upside down when served The dish can include fried tomatoes carrots potatoes cauliflower eggplant chicken lamb When the casserole is inverted the top is bright red from the tomatoes that now form the top layer cover the golden eggplant Moa amar Egypt Rice with milk chicken soup A sort of rice made by adding milk chicken soup to the rice letting it into the oven Eaten instead of white rice Very popular in Egypt Mont di Myanmar A thin rice noodle dish a semi staple dish of Rakhine State Rakhine Mont de is either a salad with dry roasted conger eel and chili as a soup Mandalay mont de is with larger rice noodles with meat based sauce Mont Lin-ma-ya Myanmar Literally Husband Wife Couple Snack It is a fritter made with rice flour where two halves thus Couple are fried with quail eggs steamed garden beans spring onions The halves are then connected sprickled with salted roasted sesame Mosaranna India Curd rice considered a staple food of brahmins of the Karnataka state of South India In this dish curd is added to cooked rice eaten straight away Sometimes mustard seeds red chillies curry leaves lentils are fried in oil and added to the dish To add more flavour ginger-garlic paste finely chopped red onions are also added to the yogurt rice mixture Fresh finely chopped cilantro is used as garnish Mujaddara Iraq Jordan Lebanon Palestine and Syria Rice with lentel friend rice Serviced with yougurt salad Nasi Campur Indonesia Malaysia Literally mixed rice in both Indonesian Malaysian in addition also called nasi rames in Indonesia refers to a dish of rice topped with various meat vegetable dishes peanuts eggs fried-shrimp krupuk Nasi Dagang Malaysia Rice steamed in coconut milk fish curry and extra ingredients such as fried shaved coconut hard-boiled eggs and vegetable pickles Nasi goreng Indonesia Malaysia This is type of fried rice usually cooked with shrimp paste chicken meat salted fish or and vegetables Nasi kandar Malaysia Famously served by local Indian Muslims very popular in Penang Nasi kapau Indonesia Nasi Kapau is a Minang steamed rice topped with various choices of dishes originated from Nagari Kapau Bukittinggi West Sumatra Indonesia Nasi kerabu Malaysia Dish from Kelantan consisting of rice with various wild herbs spices grated coconut dried shrimp fish Nasi kuning Indonesia Indonesian for yellow rice sometimes called Nasi Kunyit Indonesian for turmeric rice is an Indonesian rice dish cooked with coconut milk and turmeric 10 11 Nasi lemak Malaysia Coconut steamed rice Nasi Padang Indonesia Steamed rice served with various choices of pre-cooked dishes it is a miniature banquet of meats fish vegetables spicy sambals eaten with plain white rice it is Sumatra s most famous export the Minangkabau s great contribution to Indonesian cuisine 12 Nasi tumpang Malaysia rice with different layer of dishes wrapped in a cone shape with banana leaf packed Nasi uduk Indonesia 13 Steamed rice cooked in coconut milk Nurungji Korea a traditional Korean food made of scorched rice After boiling serving rice a thin crust of scorched rice will usually be left in the bottom of the cooking pot This yellowed scorched state is described as nureun in Korean and nurungji derives from this adjective 14 Okowa Japan Sticky glutinous rice mixed with all kinds of vegetables meat steamed Onigiri Japan Short grained rice formed into balls with without savory fillings a popular snack Orez Shu it Israel consisting of white beans cooked in a tomato paste served on white rice Pabellon criollo Venezuela Rice shredded beef stewed black beans Paella Spain Pancit bihon Philippines Noodles made from rice flour also refers to the cooked dish made with rice noodles with slivers of meat and or seafood vegetables mainly onions carrots beans cabbage seasoned with soy sauce and calamansi Panta bhat Indian subcontinent A lightly fermented rice-based dish consumed in Bangladesh and the eastern Indian states of West Bengal and Assam Pares Philippines A dish composed of rice topped with beef braised with soy sauce seasoned with garnished with spring onions Perde pilav Turkey A special pilav with chicken meat all wrapped inside yufka thin Turkish dough cooked in an oven Ph Vietnam Rice noodle soup Pilaf Indian subcontinent Iran Turkey Rice cooked in a seasoned broth 15 In some cases the rice may also attain its brown color by being stirred with bits of cooked onion as well as a large mix of spices Depending on the local cuisine it may also contain meat fish vegetables dried fruits Platillo Moros y Cristianos Cuba Rice beans Plov Central Asia Medium grain rice with carrots onions spices lamb and cottonseed oil Pongal India Sakkara pongal A sweet rice dish cooked with rice moong dhal jaggery milk flavoured with cardamom garnished with cashew raisins Ven pongal rice moong dhal milk salt pepper corns ginger cummin seeds curry leaves Puffed rice cakes Indian subcontinent Commonly used in breakfast cereal snack foods served as a popular street food Pulihora India Pulihora is rice seasoned with tamarind citation needed Puso Cebu Philippines Rice filled inside a pouch made with woven strips of coconut frond then boiled Puto Philippines A pudding made from stone-ground soaked rice sugar often with coconut milk then steamed Various toppings such as cheese salted egg or minced meat may be added Puttu India Pictured is puttu and kadalakkari Red beans rice New Orleans United States Staple made with kidney beans ham bones pickled pork andouille sausage onion celery bell pepper seasonings Rice curry Indian subcontinent A meal of plain spiced fried rice which is served together with several other dishes of which at least one is a curry on one plate but sometimes with the other dishes on the side Rice gravy United States A staple of Creole and Cajun cuisine Rice peas Caribbean Rice with kidney beans black-eyed peas pigeon peas Rice-A-Roni United States Pilaf -like boxed food mix that consists of rice vermicelli pasta seasonings Rice bath India A seasoned rice with vegetables Such as egg-plant peas tomato a breakfast dish from Karnataka India Rice bread Bread made from rice flour Rice cakes Asia A rice cake may be any kind of food item made from rice that has been shaped condensed otherwise combined into a single object Rice congee East Southeast and South Asia Also called Rice Porridge - a watery rice gruel eaten with various additions side dishes Rice Krispies United States A breakfast cereal made of crisped rice Rice Krispies are also used to make Rice Krispies treats by combining the cereal with melted marshmallows Rice noodle roll China Rice pudding Worldwide Sweet dish of rice cooked in milk coconut milk other thickening liquid Eaten with various spices fruits condiments etc in different regions Risotto Italy Rice dish made by first frying in butter after which broth is added Riz gras Burkino Faso A dish with meat vegetables atop rice Sandige India Deep fried meal accompaniment made with rice sago ash gourd San Pyote Myanmar Burmese rice congree with either duck fish Sarma Turkey Azerbaijan Armenia Grape cabbage leaves stuffed rolled with rice various herbs spices Sel roti Indian subcontinent Ring shaped bread made from rice flour eaten during Hindu festivals especially Tihar Serabi Indonesia An Indonesian pancake that is made from rice flour with coconut milk or just plain shredded coconut as an emulsifier Each province in Indonesia has various serabi recipes corresponding to local tastes 16 17 Sholeh Zard Iran This is a saffron rice dessert with nuts and rosewater Shrimp Creole Louisiana Creole cuisine Cooked shrimp in a mixture of whole diced tomatoes the Holy trinity of onion celery bell pepper spiced with Tabasco sauce or another hot pepper sauce and or cayenne-based seasoning served over steamed boiled white rice 18 Shwe Htamin Myanmar Burmese dessert dish Baked sweetened glutinous rice and jaggery Shwe Yin Aye Myanmar Dessert dish consisting of glutinous rice coconut milk jelly Sinangag Philippines Fried rice sauteed in garlic A vital part of the silog meal Sinangag at Itlog trans fried rice egg Siopao China Japan Philippines Thailand Steamed meat dumpling made with rice flour Spanish rice Mexico Side dish made from white rice tomatoes garlic onions green red bell peppers other ingredients Steamed rice East and Southeast Asia Steaming rice soup China Stir fry China Pictured is Thai Phat naem sai khai sausage of rice-fermented raw pork skin stir fried with egg Suman Philippines Sticky rice cooked with coconut milk sugar wrapped in banana coconut leaves Sushi Japan Sticky rice flavored with vinegar sugar with various fillings toppings Sweet saffron rice India Dish consisting of joha rice sugar and saffron ehriyeli pilav pilaf with orzo Turkey Dish consisting of rice with orzo Tangyuan China Taiwan A traditional at least from the Ming dynasty food that is made from glutinous rice paste that has been rolled into small balls boiled then put into a soup base These are traditionally white in color like the moon eaten during the first full moon after Chinese New Year symbolize togetherness of family They are also often pink a mixture of pink white balls because red signifies good luck in Chinese culture but red dye added to the white results in pink Sometimes savory sweet stuffings such as red bean paste are added Tapai Indonesia Teurgoule France rice pudding that is a speciality of Normandy Thai fried rice Thailand Thalassery biryani India Also known as Malabar biryani Thalassery biryani is a rice-based dish made with spices rice khyma rice not basmati rice chicken specially dressed for biriyani Variations upon the dish may use mutton fish eggs vegetables Waakye Ghana Rice beans cooked with waakye leaves to give it a brownish colour Eaten with shito eggs meat fish Xoi Vietnam Yabra Middle East Turkey Grape leaves stuffed with rice cooked with vegetables The dish name differs from one country to another Yakimochi Japan Literally grilled or broiled mochi or pounded rice cake Traditionally it is prepared using a small charcoal grill but in modern times a gas grill can be used During the time of the Autumn Moon it is traditional to eat fresh yakimochi while sipping sake and enjoying the view of the full moon Yay Monte Myanmar Thin savory rice pancake with boiled garden peas spring onions salted sesame garnish Yeung Chow fried rice China A popular Chinese -style wok fried rice dish in many Chinese restaurants in China the Americas Australia United Kingdom Vietnam the Philippines The ingredients vary but there are staple items such as cooked rice preferably day old because freshly cooked rice is too sticky barbecued pork Cooked shrimp scallions spring onions green onions chopped including green ends and egg yolks Yin yang fried rice Hong Kong Dish served with chicken in tomato sauce on one side shrimp peas in an egg white sauce on the other shaped into a yin yang symbol with rice as base Zarda Indian subcontinent Sweet dish of rice cooked in clarified butter banaspati oil with a variety of dried fruits such as orange in color Zeera rice India Steamed rice Zeera cumin Zeera powder ginger-garlic paste salt oil chana dal red chillies Zereshk polo Qazvin Province Iran This is caramelized barberries sprinkled on plain buttery basmati rice served usually with chicken Zongzi China Glutinous rice stuffed with various ingredients wrapped in bamboo leaves Uppudu pindi India A rice dish made from rice flour made like upma eaten in Telangana Zosui Japan A rice soup made from pre-cooked rice water Leftover soup from nabe is often re-used for zosui mg 8 399 mg 5 0 48 mg Units g micrograms mg milligrams IU International units Percentages are roughly approximated using US recommendations for adults Source USDA Nutrient Database Ackee saltfish Jamaica Salt cod sauteed with boiled ackee onions Scotch Bonnet peppers optional tomatoes spices such as black pepper and pimiento It can be garnished with crisp bacon fresh tomatoes is usually served as breakfast dinner alongside breadfruit hard dough bread dumplings fried plantain bogreen bananas Jamaica s national dish Bacalaito Puerto Rico Dominican Republic Salt cod fritters filled with minced cod fish garnished with cilantro tomatoes onions A traditional snack typically eaten with an entire meal Bacalaitos are served at the beach cuchifritos at festivals They are crisp on the outside dense chewy in the inside Scotland and Orkney Made with speldings young fish of the Gadidae family such as cod haddock or whiting The name is a derivative of cabillaud the French name for cod Other ingredients include parsley horseradish and mashed potato The sauce is made with butter flour milk hard-boiled eggs and nutmeg Alternate versions outside the traditional version s only difference are usually an addition of more spices Codfish Bras Style Portugal Made with eggs onions thinly sliced potatoes in matchstick-size salt codfish soaked minced garlic clove extra virgin olive oil bunch fresh parsley chopped black Portuguese olives salt pepper 7 Crappit heid Scotland English stuffed head Can be traced to the fishing communities of the North Hebrides North-Eastern Scotland in the eighteenth century In a time when money was scarce the more expensive fillets of fish such as cod or haddock would be sold to market but the offal and less attractive parts were retained by the fisherfolk for the pot Cullen skink Scotland Thick soup made of smoked haddock potatoes onions An authentic cullen skink will use finnan haddie but it may be prepared with any other undyed smoked haddock The soup is often served as a starter at formal Scottish dinners It has been described as smokier more assertive than American chowder and heartier than classical French bisque 8 Fish brewis Newfoundland Consists of cod and hard bread or hard tack With the abundance of cod around the coasts of Newfoundland Labrador it became synonymous with many Newfoundland households as a delicacy to be served as a main meal salt fish is soaked in water overnight to reduce the salt content The hard bread is broken into bite-size pieces is also soaked in water overnight The next day the fish hard bread are boiled separately until tender then both are served together The traditional meal is served with scrunchions 9 salted pork fat which has been cut into small pieces fried Both the rendered fat the liquid fat are then drizzled over the fish hard bread Fish ball Widespread Usually made from a white fish such as cod or haddock Fishcake British Similar to a croquette consisting of a filleted fish and potato patty sometimes coated in breadcrumbs or batter fried Salted cod is traditionally used as a filling though since cod stocks have become depleted other varieties of white fish are used such as haddock or whiting 10 The fishcake has been seen as a way of using up leftovers that might otherwise be thrown away In Mrs Beeton s 19th century publication Book of Household Management her recipe for fishcakes calls for leftover fish cold potatoes 11 Fish finger Fish fry 120px Fish pie 120px Fried fish Lutefisk Pescado frito Scrod 120px Taramosalata Traditional Grimsby International units Percentages are roughly approximated using US recommendations for adults Source USDA Nutrient Database Avruga caviar Spain Avruga is marketed by the Spanish company Pescaviar as a caviar substitute It is made from herring 40 salt corn starch lemon juice citric acid xanthan gum sodium benzoate squid ink and water Unlike caviar it does not contain fish roe 9 Bloater England Popular in the 19th early 20th centuries bloaters are now rare They can be contrasted with kippers Kippers are salted cold smoked overnight while bloaters are salted less not smoked for so long Kippers are split gutted before smoking while bloaters are smoked whole without gutting Kippers are associated with Scotland while bloaters are associated with England Bloaters have their own characteristic slightly gamey flavor are called bloaters because they swell bloat during preparation 10 11 12 13 14 Brathering Germany A dish of fried marinated herring A common recipe starts with fresh herrings with the head gut removed that are breaded or turned in flour fried then pickled in a marinade of vinegar The pickled herrings are then boiled briefly in water containing onion salt spices like pepper bay leaves mustard seeds a little sugar The herring are served cold with bread fried jacket potatoes 15 Buckling European A hot-smoked herring similar to a kipper or bloater The guts are removed but the roe or milt remain Buckling is hot-smoked whole as opposed to kippers which are split gutted then cold smoked Bucklings can be eaten hot cold 16 17 Dressed herring Russia A layered salad of diced salted herring covered with alternating layers of grated boiled vegetables potato carrot beet root chopped onions Optionally includes a layer of fresh grated apple The final layer is beet root covered with mayonnaise which gives the salad a rich purple color Often decorated with grated boiled eggs Popular in Russia other countries of the former USSR where it is traditional at New Year Christmas celebrations Also known as herring under a fur coat or just fur coat 18 19 20 21 Fischbr tchen lit fish sandwich Germany A sandwich roll made with fish onions sometimes also made with remoulade pickles Most commonly made with bismarck herring or soused herring eaten in Northern Germany due to the region s proximity to the North Sea Baltic Sea ledzie Poland Pickled herring with chopped onions eggs peeled chopped hard-cooked apple - lemon juice sour cream garlic salt pepper added to herring mixed well Sprinkled with dill parsley Served with rye bread It is also Traditionally served in one of the twelve dishes served at Christmas Eve Wigilia Gibbing Gwamegi Korea Herring roe Japan Called Kazunoko Usually it is served as a part of Osechi in the Japanese new year Herring spawn Japan Called Komochi-Kombu Usually it is served as a part of Sushi or Chinmi Herring noodle Japan Called Nishin-soba Hokkaido Herring spawn Japan Called matsumae-duke Hokkaido Herring soup Sweden Kibinago Japan Kipper United Kingdom A whole herring that has been split from tail to head gutted salted pickled and cold smoked Pickled herring Shmaltz herring Solomon Gundy Jamaica Soused herring Netherlands Surstr mming Sweden Rollmops Vorschmack Ashkenazi Jews Eastern Europe Chopped herring salad Wikibooks Cookbook has a recipe module on Herring as food Clupea Clam Cod Crab Fish head Fish stews Fried fish Herring Raw fish Salmon Shrimp Sushi sashimi Barbecue Beef Shredded beef Steak Veal Chicken Duck Egg Eggs Benedict Scrambled eggs Goat Hamburgers Hot dogs Kebabs Lamb Meatball Mixed grill Pork Bacon Ham dishes Hams Sausages Sausage dishes Skewered foods Blood Cheese Fish seafood Vegetable Cakes Candies Chocolate bars Chocolate-covered Cookies Cookie sandwiches Shortbread Desserts Custard Doughnuts Pastries Choux pastry Poppy seed Pies tarts flans Food portal Category Lists of foods Carpaccio Italy Very thin slices of marinated swordfish tuna other large fish a variant of the more common beef carpaccio Ceviche Peru Marinated raw fish dish Crudo Italy Raw fish dressed with olive oil sea salt citrus E ia Ota Tahiti Raw tuna in lime coconut milk Esqueixada Catalan Salad based on raw cod tomato black olives Gravlax Nordic Raw salmon lightly cured in salt sugar and dill Usually served as an appetizer sliced thinly accompanied by a dill mustard sauce with bread boiled potatoes Made by fishermen in the Middle Ages who salted salmon lightly fermented it by burying it in the sand above the high-tide line Today it is no longer fermented Instead the salmon is buried in a dry marinade of salt sugar dill cured for a few days As the salmon cures by the action of osmosis the moisture turns the dry cure into a highly d brine which can be used as part of a sauce 8 Gohu Ikan Maluku Indonesia Gohu Ikan could be made with tuna skipjack or grouper The fish is cut into small pieces To remove the fishy smell the fish meat is washed repeatedly until there s no more blood left After cleaning thoroughly the fish meat is marinated with salt citrus juice The red fish meat will become a bit white It is then mixed stirred with sliced onion rica a spicy chili basil leaves It has a sour flavor spicy with a strong aroma of basil Roasted coarsely grounded canary seeds can be used as a flavor enhancer Hinava Malaysia A traditional Kadazan-Dusun dish from Sabah Raw fish typically firm fleshed white fish marinated with citrus juice usually calamansi lime sliced shallots julienned ginger grated dried seed of the bambangan fruit a species of wild mango found in Borneo Optional additions include sliced chilli bitter gourd Hoe Korea Raw seafood slices typically served with either soy-sauce hot pepper paste based dipping sauce Kelaguen Mariana Islands Kilawin Philippines Marinated raw fish similar to ceviche It is generally marinated in a local vinegar e g coconut cane palm vinegar and or local citrus such as kalamansi sometimes lime Some regions add a little coconut milk to the marinade Koi pla Thailand Minced finely chopped raw fish in spicy salad The most popular raw fish dish in Isan Kokoda Fiji Appetiser side dish of any white fish A common staple Kuai China Finely cut strips of raw fish meat which was popular commonly eaten in the early history dynastic times of China According to the Book of Rites compiled between 202 BCE 220 CE kuai consists of small thin slices strips of raw meat which are prepared by first thinly slicing the meat then cutting the thin slices into strips In modern times the dishes are more often referred to as raw fish slices Commonly used fish in ancient times include carp and mandarin fish but salmon is also used in modern times Sauces were an essential part of kuai dishes with green onions used for preparation of sauces in spring and mustard seed used for sauces in autumn According to many classical texts kuai served without sauces was deemed inedible should be avoided 9 Lakerda Turkey Pickled bonito dish eaten as a mezze in the cuisines of the former Ottoman Empire Lakerda made from one-year-old bonito migrating through the Bosphorus is especially prized Lap pa Larb pla Laos Thailand A Lao and Thai salad of raw freshwater river fish mixed with lime cilantro mint scallions roasted rice chilis Ota ika Tonga Raw fish dish typically made with coconut cream tomatoes lemon spring onions Poke Hawaii Raw fish salad Sashimi Japan Sliced raw seafood Dipped in soy sauce wasabi before eating Soused herring maatjes matjes Netherlands New season herring soaked in a mild preserving liquid Stroganina Siberia A dish of the indigenous people of northern Arctic Siberia made from raw thin sliced frozen fish 10 Tiradito Peru Variant of ceviche influenced by sashimi Tuna tartare United States 11 Minced raw tuna dish Umai Malaysia A closely similar dish like the hinava popular with the Melanau community in Sarawak Xato Catalan Raw cod anchovies tuna fish with escarole arbequinas olives romesco sauce Yusheng Malaysia Raw fish salad Anchovy Barramundi Billfish Carp Catfish Cod Eel Flatfish Flounder Herring Mackerel Salmon Sardine Shark Sturgeon impact of meat production List of meat dishes Meat cutter Meat tenderness Pescetarianism Pink slime Plant-based diet Preservation Psychology of eating meat Meat paradox Red meat Semi-vegetarianism Slaughter Slaughterhouse Veganism Vegetarianism White meat Angels on horseback England Oysters wrapped in bacon served hot In the United Kingdom they can also be a savoury the final course of a traditional British formal meal They are somewhat similar to devils on horseback and the Midwestern version of pigs in a blanket a traditional dish of the American Midwest Antipasto Italy The traditional first course of a formal Italian meal Traditional antipasto includes cured meats olives peperoncini mushrooms anchovies artichoke hearts various cheeses such as provolone or mozzarella pickled meats vegetables both in oil in vinegar Arab salad Middle East Any of a variety of salad dishes that form part of Arab cuisine Batata vada India A popular Indian vegetarian fast food in Maharashtra India it literally means potato fritters The Marathi word batata means potato in English It consists of a potato mash patty coated with chick pea flour then deep-fried and served hot with savory condiments called chutney The vada is a disc around 2 to 3 inches 5 1 to 7 6 cm in diameter Barbajuan Monaco An appetizer mainly found in the eastern part of French Riviera and Northern Italy a barbajuan is a fritter filled with Swiss chard spinach and ricotta cheese among other ingredients Blooming onion United States Typically this consists of one large onion which is cut to resemble a flower then battered and deep-fried It is served as an appetizer at some restaurants Bruschetta Italy An Italian antipasto its origin dates to at least the 15th century It consists of grilled bread rubbed with garlic and topped with olive oil salt pepper It is often topped with tomato Buffalo wing United States A chicken wing section wingette drumette that is generally deep-fried unbreaded coated in a sauce of vinegar -based cayenne pepper hot sauce and butter in the kitchen 1 Canape France A small prepared usually decorative food held in the fingers and often eaten in one bite Carpaccio Italy Raw meat such as beef veal venison salmon or tuna thinly sliced pounded thin served mainly as an appetizer Pictured is carpaccio with cheese Caviar Iran Russia Traditionally it refers to roe from wild sturgeon in the Caspian and Black Seas 2 Chaat India Chaat is a term describing one of many types of savory snacks typically served at road-side tracks from stalls or food carts in India 3 4 Chicken fingers United States Chicken fingers are prepared by dipping chicken meat in a breading mixture then deep-frying them 5 In North America they are usually prepared from the breast muscles of chicken 6 Chicken lollipop India An hors d oeuvre made from the drummette segments of chicken wings or from drumsticks The flesh on the segments is pushed to one end of the bone Crab puff United States Balls of crab meat that have been deep-fried in batter 7 8 They are often served in restaurants as an appetizer side dish 9 Crab rangoon United States These are deep-fried dumplings served in American Chinese more recently Thai restaurants stuffed with a combination of cream cheese lightly flaked crab meat more commonly canned crab meat or imitation crab meat with scallions and or garlic Crostini Italy Small slices of grilled toasted bread and toppings which may include a variety of different cheeses meats and vegetables may be presented more simply with a brush of olive oil and herbs or a sauce Crudites France Sliced whole raw vegetables 10 which are sometimes dipped in a vinaigrette or other dipping sauce Dahi puri India An Indian snack which is especially popular in the state of Maharashtra the dish is a form of chaat and originates from the city of Mumbai 11 It is served with mini- puri shells golgappa which are more popularly recognized from the dish golgappay Dahi puri and pani puri chaats are often sold by the same vendor Dahi vada India An Indian chaat prepared by soaking vadas in thick dahi yogurt To add more flavor they may be topped with coriander or mint leaves chili powder crushed black pepper chaat masala cumin shredded coconut green chilis or boondi Deviled eggs Italy Boiled eggs shelled cut in half filled with the yolk mixed with other ingredients such as mayonnaise and mustard 12 but many other variants exist internationally Devils on horseback England A hot hors d oeuvre the recipes vary but in general are variations on angels on horseback made by replacing oysters with dried fruit The majority of recipes contains a pitted date though prunes are sometimes used 13 stuffed with mango chutney and wrapped in bacon Eggplant salads appetizers Middle East Arab culture Many cuisines feature eggplant salads appetizers Fattoush The Levant A Levantine bread salad made from toasted fried pieces of pita bread khubz arabi combined with mixed greens and other vegetables 14 fattoush belongs to the family of dishes known as fattat plural or fatta which use stale flatbread as a base 14 Fried mushrooms Deep-fried mushrooms they have been dipped in batter In the United States some other countries they are often served as an appetizer or snack Garlic knot A type of garlic bread appetizer they are found in many pizzerias around the world They are usually made with pizza dough and garlic or garlic powder They can also be topped with Parmesan cheese oregano and or parsley Gravlax Nordic countries Raw salmon cured in salt sugar and dill gravlax is usually served as an appetizer sliced thinly accompanied by hovm stars s literally steward sauce also known as gravlaxs s a dill mustard sauce either on bread of some kind with boiled potatoes Haggis pakora Scotland An Indo-Gael fusion food haggis sheep s heart liver lungs onion oatmeal is flavored with Indian spices formed into balls coated in a batter of gram flour yogurt spices deep-fried in the same manner as an Indian pakora Jalapeno popper United States These are jalapeno peppers that have been hollowed out stuffed with a mixture of cheese spices sometimes ground meat They are either breaded and deep-fried wrapped in bacon and baked or grilled Malakoff 15 Switzerland Romandy A fried ball of cheese Matbucha Middle East Arab culture Tomatoes and roasted bell peppers seasoned with garlic and chili pepper 16 the name of the dish originates from Arabic means cooked salad It is served as an appetizer often as part of a meze Meze Middle East Balkans Caucasus In Levantine cuisines and in the Caucasus region meze is served at the beginning of all large-scale meals 17 Mozzarella sticks France Elongated pieces of battered or breaded mozzarella Nachos Piedras Negras Coahuila Mexico In their simplest form nachos are tortilla chips totopos covered in nacho cheese shredded cheese and or salsa Oblo ene chlebi ky Czechoslovakia A Czech and Slovak appetizer snack it consists of an open-faced sandwich topped with butter and a variety of other toppings such as cured meats fish hard-boiled egg vegetables Onion ring United States Generally it consist of a cross-sectional ring of onion the circular structure of which lends itself well to this method of preparation dipped in batter or bread crumbs and then deep-fried a variant is made with onion paste Pakora India It is created by taking one two ingredients such as onion eggplant potato spinach plantain paneer cauliflower tomato chili pepper occasionally bread 18 or chicken and dipping them in a batter of gram flour and then deep-frying them The most popular varieties are palak pakora made from spinach paneer pakora made from paneer soft cheese pyaz pakora made from onion and aloo pakora made from potato Paneer tikka India Made from chunks of paneer marinated in spices grilled in a tandoor 19 20 it is a vegetarian alternative to chicken tikka and other meat dishes 21 22 23 It is a popular dish that is widely available in India other countries with an Indian diaspora 24 25 Panipuri India A popular street snack in India Pakistan Bangladesh Sri Lanka and Nepal it consists of a round hollow puri fried crisp filled with a mixture of flavored water pani tamarind chutney chili chaat masala potato onion chickpeas It is generally small enough to fit completely into one s mouth It is a popular street food dish in Mumbai Delhi Karachi Lahore Dhaka Kolkata and Kathmandu Papadum India A thin crisp Indian preparation it is sometimes described as a cracker It is typically served as an accompaniment to a meal in India It is also eaten as an appetizer a snack can be eaten with various toppings such as chopped onions chutney other dips and condiments Papri chaat India A Pakistani North Indian fast food chaat an Indo-Aryan word which literally means lick is used to describe a range of snacks and fast food dishes papri refers to crisp fried dough wafers made from refined white flour and oil In papri chaat the papris are served with boiled potatoes boiled chick peas chilis yogurt and tamarind chutney topped with chaat masala and sev Pizzetta A miniature pizza it is prepared in a similar fashion but is only a few inches in diameter Poke United States Hawaii A raw salad served as an hors d oeuvre in Hawaiian cuisine modern poke typically consists of cubed ahi yellowfin tuna sashimi marinated with sea salt a small amount of soy sauce inamona roasted crushed candlenut sesame oil limu seaweed chopped chili pepper Potato skins United States Slices of half-circular pieces of potatoes with the skin left on one side a quarter-inch so of the inside of the potato on the other the potato side is covered with toppings such as bacon cheddar cheese green onions anything else that might be found on a baked potato Potato wedges Wedges of potatoes often large unpeeled that are either baked or fried Prawn cocktail A seafood dish it consists of shelled prawns in mayonnaise tomato dressing served in a glass also referred to as a shrimp cocktail 26 Pu pu platter United States An assortment of small meat seafood appetizers a typical pupu platter as found in American Chinese cuisine might include an egg roll spare ribs chicken wings chicken fingers beef teriyaki skewered beef fried wontons crab rangoon fried shrimp among other items accompanied by a small hibachi grill Queso flameado Mexico United States Southwest Its typical main ingredients are melted cheese a characteristic meat sauce of loose fresh chorizo tomato onion chili and spices Rocky Mountain oysters North America Bull calf testicles used for human consumption it is a well-known novelty dish in parts of the American West and Western Canada where cattle ranching is prevalent castration of young animals is common prairie oysters is the preferred name in Canada where they may be served in a demi-glace not deep-fried 27 In Oklahoma the Texas Panhandle they are sometimes called calf fries but only if taken from very young animals 28 Rumaki mock-Polynesian Water chestnuts and liver wrapped in bacon or as a substitute either pastrami or cured salted beef called beef fry and marinated in a flavored soy sauce 29 Saganaki Greece Various Greek dishes prepared in a small frying pan itself called a saganaki they are best-known as being an appetizer of fried cheese Sakinalu chakli India A special type of snack they are prepared in Maharashtra Karnataka Telangana parts of Guntur District are very popular in all districts of Telangana Region 30 31 It is essentially made up of rice flour and with small amount of spices sesame seeds carom seeds ajwain and salt prepared during Makar Sankranti festival by most people irrespective of caste creed 32 Sakinalu are also given to the groom s by the bride s parents for distributing among their relatives friends 33 Samosa also known as tikona India Pakistan This is a fried baked pastry with a savory filling such as spiced potatoes onions peas lentils ground lamb ground beef ground chicken The size shape consistency may vary but typically they are distinctly triangular Samosas are often accompanied by chutney 34 They are a popular appetizer or snack in South Asia Southeast Asia Central Asia Southwest Asia the Arabian Peninsula the Mediterranean the Horn of Africa North Africa and South Africa Salmon tartare Prepared with fresh raw salmon and seasonings it is commonly spread on a cracker artisan-style bread enjoyed as an appetizer Stuffed mushrooms Mushrooms filled with a stuffing baked broiled Sushi 35 36 37 38 Japan Cooked vinegar-flavored rice combined with other ingredients the Oxford English Dictionary notes the earliest written mention of sushi in English in an 1893 book A Japanese Interior where it mentions sushi as a roll of cold rice with fish seaweed some other flavoring 39 40 However there is also mention of sushi in a Japanese-English dictionary from 1873 41 and an 1879 article on Japanese cookery in the journal Notes Queries 42 Tapas Spain A wide variety of appetizers snacks in Spanish cuisine tapas have evolved through Spanish history by incorporating ingredients influences from many different cultures countries Tokwa t baboy Philippines A typical Philippine appetizer it usually includes pork ears pork belly deep-fried tofu is dipped in a mixture of soy sauce pork broth vinegar chopped white onions scallions red chili peppers Zakuski Russia A Russian term for hors d oeuvres snacks appetizers it is served before the main course Usually presented buffet style it often consists of cold cuts cured fishes mixed salads kholodets pirozhki various pickled vegetables such as tomatoes beets or cucumbers sauerkraut pickled mushrooms deviled eggs hard cheeses caviar canapes open sandwiches breads African Angolan Central African Republic Chadian Ethiopian Libyan Nigerian Nigerien Togolese Tunisian Western Saharan American Italian-American Jewish-American New Orleans World s Finest Chocolate in Chicago Bonnat Chocolates France 1884 More than 40 single origin bars Bonnat Chocolatier is the oldest artisan producer of chocolate in the world citation needed producing around 100 tons per year Bonnat was the first chocolate maker to create single-origin single-estate chocolate bars Bonnat began exporting chocolate to the French colonies in 1919 Castronovo Chocolate seed Pies tarts flans Food portal Category Lists of foods Amasi A word for fermented milk that tastes like cottage cheese plain yogurt It is very popular in South Africa Amazake Japan A traditional sweet low- non-alcohol depending on recipes Japanese drink made from fermented rice Appam India A type of South Indian pancake made with fermented rice batter coconut milk It is a popular food in South Indian states of Kerala and Tamil Nadu It is also very popular in Sri Lanka where it is commonly referred to by its anglicized name as Hoppers Atchara A pickle made from grated unripe papaya that is popular in the Philippines It is often served as a side dish for fried grilled foods such as pork barbecue The name may come from several names for South Asian pickle and is related to acar from neighbouring Indonesia and Malaysia Ayran A cold yogurt beverage mixed with salt 1 In addition to Turkey where it is considered a national drink ayran is found in Iran there called doogh Afghanistan Armenia here called tan Azerbaijan the Balkans Kazakhstan Kyrgyzstan Lebanon Syria and across the Caucasus 2 Its primary ingredients are water yogurt Bagoong Philippines A Philippine condiment made of partially completely fermented fish shrimp and salt 3 The fermentation process also results in fish sauce known as patis 4 Bagoong monamon Prepared by fermenting salted anchovies Bagoong terong Made by salting fermenting the bonnet mouth fish Banh cu n Northern Vietnam 5 Made from a thin wide sheet of steamed fermented 6 rice batter filled with seasoned ground pork minced wood ear mushroom minced shallots Beer A traditional alcoholic depending on recipes beverage made from grains hops Blaand A fermented milk product made from whey It is similar in alcohol content to wine Boza A traditional fermented drink with alcohol found in many countries Bread Any biologically yeast s as opposed to baking powder leavened bread Brem Indonesia A traditional fermented food of Indonesia that uses rice Burong mangga Philippines Made by mixing sugar salt water to mangoes that have previously been salted Burong talangka Philippines Made by mixing crablets salt left in a jar to ferment thoroughly It can be eaten after 2-5 days In the some communities calamansi chili dayap and or soy sause is are added to enhance the flavor while fermentation is occurring Buttermilk Calpis Japan An uncarbonated soft drink manufactured by Calpis Co Ltd that is produced using lactic acid fermentation Chass Gujarat India The word used for buttermilk in Rajasthani and Gujarati 7 Chass is the traditional Gujarati beverage from Gujarat India Cheese Some cheeses such as Shanklish pictured are fermented as part of their production Cheonggukjang Korea A fermented soybean paste used in Korean cuisine that contains both whole ground soybeans Chicha In South America and Central America chicha is a fermented or non-fermented beverage usually derived from maize 8 Chicha includes corn beer known as chicha de jora and non-alcoholic beverages such as chicha morada Chinese pickles Various vegetables fruits which have been fermented by pickling with salt brine marinated in mixtures based on soy sauce or savory bean pastes Cincalok Cocoa Cocoa bean fermentation for chocolate other cocoa products Cod liver oil Traditional preparation method Cod liver oil was traditionally manufactured by filling a wooden barrel with fresh cod livers seawater allowing the mixture to ferment for up to a year before removing the oil Creme fraiche A soured cream containing 30 45 butterfat and having a pH of around 4 5 9 It is soured with bacterial culture but is less sour than U S -style sour cream has a lower viscosity and a higher fat content Curtido A type of lightly fermented cabbage relish It is typical in Salvadoran cuisine and that of other Central American countries is usually made with cabbage onions carrots sometimes lime juice Dhokla Gujarat India A vegetarian food item made with a fermented batter derived from rice and chickpea splits 10 Doenjang Korea A thick bean paste that includes fermentation in its preparation Doogh Ancient Persia A savory yogurt-based beverage Dosa India A fermented crepe or pancake made from rice batter and black lentils It is a staple food in many parts of India Pictured is Rava dosa a type of Dosa dish Plain dosa Masala dosa are better fermented dishes The batter is fermented for 8 to 10 hrs Doubanjiang A spicy salty paste made from fermented broad beans soybeans salt rice various spices Douchi A type of fermented salted black soybean Douzhi Beijing This is a fermented dish from Beijing cuisine It is similar to soy milk but made from mung beans It is a by-product of cellophane noodle production It is generally slightly sour with an egg-like old socks like smell Fermented bean curd Fermented tofu pictured is a type of Fermented bean curd Fermented bean paste A category of fermented foods typically made from ground soybeans which are indigenous to the cuisines of East and Southeast Asia In some cases such as in the production of miso other varieties of beans such as broad beans may also be used 11 Fermented fish A traditional preparation of fish Before refrigeration canning other modern preservation techniques became available fermenting was an important preservation method Fermented milk products Also known as cultured dairy foods cultured dairy products cultured milk products fermented milk products are dairy foods that have been fermented with lactic acid bacteria such as Lactobacillus Lactococcus and Leuconostoc Pictured is matzoon a fermented milk product of Armenian origin Filmj lk Nordic countries A mesophilic fermented milk product that is made by fermenting cow s milk with a variety of bacteria from the species Lactococcus lactis and Leuconostoc mesenteroides 12 13 Fish sauce Ganjang Korea a kind of Korean soy sauce made from fermented soybeans Ganjang is a uniquely Korean condiment Garri a popular West African food made from cassava tubers Garum Garum was a fish sauce made from the fermentation of fish entrails used as a condiment in the cuisines of ancient Greece Rome Byzantium It is believed to have resembled the fermented anchovy sauce colatura di alici still produced today in Campania Italy Gejang Korea Gochujang Korea Gundruk - Nepal Gundruk is made by fermenting leaves of vegetables of Brassica family Hakarl Iceland Made by fermenting shark meat then hanging it to dry Pictured is Hakarl hanging to dry in Iceland Hongeohoe Korea Idli India Igunaq Injera A sourdough-risen flatbread with a unique slightly spongy texture Traditionally made out of teff flour 14 it is a national dish in Ethiopia and Eritrea Iru food Jeotgal Korea Jogijeot Made with fish in Korea Korea Kapusta kiszona duszona Poland Katsuobushi Japan Kaymak Kefir A fermented milk product Kenkey Ketchup In Indonesian cuisine which is similar to Malay the term seal Kombucha Fermented tea Khanom chin Kumis Kusaya Japan A traditional salted fermented fish dish originating in the Izu Islands often eaten with sake sh ch a local drink called Shima Jiman Kuzhi traditional Japanese food made from soybeans fermented with Bacillus subtilis var natto Some eat it as a breakfast food It is served with soy sauce karashi mustard Japanese bunching onion Natt may be an acquired taste because of its powerful smell strong flavor slimy texture In Japan natt is most popular in the eastern regions including Kant T hoku Hokkaido Nem chua Vietnam Nem chua is a Vietnamese fermented pork dish usually rolled cut in bite sizes The meat is sweet sour salty spicy It is often served with bird s eye chili garlic and Vietnamese coriander Ngapi Ogi cereal ferment Burma Portuguese ground red pepper Pimenta Moida Pee-men-tah Mo-ee-dah a k a Massa de piment o pronounced mah-ssah de pea-meant-ow Portugal Salt substitute staple in the Azores Base for many Portuguese dishes Shepherd peppers Fresno red Banana pepper Cubanelle Chile Pepper even Red bell peppers salt The addition of olive oil paprika wine vinegar garlic varies Wash peppers de-stem cut in 1 2 allowing peppers to air dry Grind peppers with 1 3 seeds are ground salt allow to ferment for 24-72hrs until boiling subsides Jar adding salt olive oil to top for enhance preservation taste Pepper heat range typically from 0-1000 Scoville Pulque Puto Pictured is puto in banana leaf Rakfisk R u n p Ryazhenka Saeujeot Korea Salami Italy Sauerkraut Finely cut cabbage that has been fermented by various lactic acid bacteria including Leuconostoc Lactobacillus and Pediococcus 16 17 It has a long shelf life and a distinctive sour flavor both of which result from the lactic acid that forms when the bacteria ferment the sugars in the cabbage SCOBY algam Turkey algam is a popular beverage from southern Turkey s cities of Adana Mersin It is made with the juice of red carrot pickles salted spiced flavoured with aromatic turnip celem fermented in barrels with the addition of ground bulgur Shark meat Shark meat is sometimes fermented Shiokara Shrimp Paste Belacan Malaysia Fermented Shrimp paste Sinki food Skyr Smantan Smetana dairy product Som moo Sour cabbage Vegetable preserve similar to sauerkraut with the difference that it is prepared through the lacto-fermentation of whole heads the bacterial fermentation of milk Zha cai Chakuli pitha India A rice-based fried pancake traditionally made in the Indian state of Odisha It is made from fermented rice and black gram Enduri Pitha India A traditional pitha made in the northern central region Indian state of Odisha A fermented batter made of rice and black gram is steamed with without stuffing made of coconut jaggery and black pepper in ica in ica in Slovakia in ice in the Czech Republic entyca in Poland A drink made of sheep milk whey as a by-product in the process of making bryndza cheese African Angolan Central African seed Pies tarts flans Food portal Category Lists of foods Aloo pie Trinidad Tobago savory This soft fried pastry is a variant of the samosa made from flour water filled with boiled spiced mashed potatoes and other vegetables like green peas Its shape is similar to a calzone it is usually larger than a samosa approximately 5 inches 13 cm long 1 Apple crisp Apple crumble United States sweet A dessert consisting of baked apples topped with a crispy crust Many different kinds of fruit can substituted for apples one of the most common variants is apple rhubarb crisp including rhubarb It is an easy to make tasty alternative to apple pie and apple cobbler Apple pie Netherlands Germany sweet A fruit pie or tart in which the principal filling ingredient is crisp acidic cooking apples such as the Bramley or Granny Smith Australian New Zealand meat pie Australia and New Zealand 2 savory A hand-sized meat pie containing largely minced meat and gravy sometimes with onion often consumed as a takeaway food snack The pie itself is congruent with the United Kingdom s steak pie Bacon egg pie Various savory A pie containing bacon egg and often onion Bakewell tart Great Britain sweet A tart with a shortcrust pastry shell spread with jam filled with a sponge-like ground almond filling 3 Often covered with nuts such as almonds peanuts a top layer of almond flavored icing a half glace cherry Banana cream pie United States sweet A cream pie made with a rich custard made from milk cream flour eggs combined with sliced bananas in a pastry graham crumb crust It is often made with a whipped cream topping Banoffee pie Great Britain sweet An English pastry-based dessert made from bananas 4 toffee 4 and cream either on a pastry base graham crumb crust Bean pie United States sweet A sweet custard pie with a filling of mashed beans sugar butter milk spices including vanilla cinnamon nutmeg Bedfordshire clanger Bedfordshire England UK savory sweet An elongated suet crust pie with a savory filling at one end meat potatoes vegetables a sweet filling jam fruit at the other Bisteeya pastilla etc Morocco savory A traditional Berber meat pie traditionally made of squab fledgling pigeons in crisp layers of warka dough with a crunchy layer of toasted ground almonds cinnamon sugar Many variant transliterations bastilla bsteeya b stilla bstilla Blackberry pie United States Germany sweet A fruit pie with a filling made from blackberries Black bottom pie United States sweet A layer of chocolate pastry cream pudding the black bottom topped with whipped cream meringue in a crust of variable composition Black bun Scotland sweet A pastry-covered fruitcake traditionally eaten on Twelfth Night Blueberry pie New England United States Germany sweet A fruit pie or tart in which the principal filling ingredient is blueberries Bob Andy pie United States Amish community sweet A sweet custard pie spiced with cinnamon and cloves Bougatsa Greece sweet savory Consists of custard cheese minced meat filling between layers of phyllo Boysenberry Northeastern United States sweet Made with boysenberries often simmered into a softer sweeter preserve -type gel most frequently with a second covering crust either lattice with only a few cutouts Bridie Forfar Scotland savory A small savory pie filled with minced steak butter and beef suet seasoned with salt pepper Sometimes with an addition of minced onions Buko pie Philippines sweet A sweet pie originating from the Philippines It was only available to the island country until a method of freezing was used It is a very popular pie consisting of young coconuts Bumbleberry pie Canada has become popular in the Midwestern United States sweet This is a sweet fruit pie in which the filling consists of blackberries blueberries raspberries and strawberries 5 Other varieties also include other berries the addition of grapes The color of the filling is a deep purple it is baked in a typical pie shell pate sucree Bundevara Serbia sweet An elongated strudel-like pie filled with sweetened pumpkin Bundner Nusstorte Graubunden Switzerland sweet A traditional sweet caramelised nut -filled pastry generally walnut Burek Mediterranean Sea the Slavic cuisines throughout the Balkans and the former Ottoman Empire savory Phyllo filled with cheese meat potatoes other vegetables Butter pie Lancashire England UK savory Made with sliced potatoes onion butter salt pepper in a light pastry casing Butter tart Canada sweet Butter sugar eggs in a pastry shell with raisins pecans or walnuts often added Buttermilk pie Southern United States sweet A traditional custard-like pie in a pastry crust with a filling made of a mixture of sugar butter eggs buttermilk and flour Canele France sweet A small French pastry with a soft tender custard center a dark thick caramelized crust Cantaloupe pie Southern United States sweet A custard pie of cantaloupe butter eggs nutmeg with meringue topping Caramel tart Australia sweet A sweet tart filled with soft piped caramel Sometimes topped with whipped cream drizzled with chocolate Cashew pie sweet Prepared using cashews as a main ingredient Cheesecake United States Germany sweet Cream cheese and pastry may come in a variety of flavors Cheese pie United States Germany sweet A pie with a filling similar to cheesecake with a graham wafer crust often topped with fruit Cherry pie United States Germany sweet A pie baked with a cherry filling Usually made with tart rather than sweet cherries so as to control the sweetness of the pie Chess pie Great Britain sweet A custard pie with a filling composed of eggs butter granulated sugar brown sugar vanilla and corn meal Chestnut pie savory sweet Prepared using chestnuts as a primary ingredient Chicken mushroom pie Great Britain savory A pie made with a pastry crust with a filling of small pieces of chicken sliced mushrooms in a creamy sauce Chiffon pie United States sweet A pie with a filling made by folding meringue and or whipped cream into a mixture resembling a fruit curd most commonly lemon in a crust of variable composition Can also be made with canned pumpkin in place of the fruit Chinese pie Pate chinois Quebec Canada savory A layered French Canadian dish similar to English cottage pie It is made with ground beef and sauteed onions on the bottom layer canned corn whole-kernel creamed for the middle layer mashed potatoes on top Coconut cream pie United States sweet A cream pie made with a rich custard made from milk cream flour eggs shredded coconut in a pastry graham crumb crust usually topped with whipped cream toasted coconut Cookie Cake Pie United States sweet A combination of cookie dough cake batter baked together in a pie crust Corned beef pie Great Britain savory A pie with a filling of corned beef onion other vegetables such as corn peas carrot The pie can be made with a mashed potato topping as in cottage pie with a traditional pastry crust Cottage pie Shepherd s pie Great Britain Canada savory A meat pie with a crust of mashed potato Coulibiac Russia savory A baked pie with a filling made with salmon or sturgeon 6 rice hard-boiled eggs mushrooms and dill dulce de batata sweet potato jam dulce de leche guava or strawberry jam 10 Pasty Cornwall United Kingdom Canada savory A traditional lunch food for Cornish miners The rolled part of the crust was used as a handle left uneaten where it was soiled with arsenic-laden ore from the miner s hand Peach pie United States sweet Prepared with peaches as the primary ingredient with added spices such as nutmeg ginger cinnamon May be strictly a fruit pie a custard based pie Because peaches are a high moisture fruit produce copious amounts of juice as they cook peach pies often have a lattice top to allow steam to vent prevent excessive liquid build-up during baking which could result in a runny pie Peanut pie sweet Prepared with peanuts or peanut butter as a primary ingredient Pear tart France sweet peanuts Afghan salad Afghanistan Vegetable salad Prepared with the primary ingredients of tomato cucumber onion carrot cilantro mint lemon juice Ambrosia United States Fruit salad Mixed with sour cheese lettuce olives Italian dressing Arab salad Arab cuisine Vegetable salad Combines many different vegetables spices often served as part of a mezze Asinan Indonesia Vegetable fruit salad A pickled through brined or vinegared vegetable or fruit dish commonly found in Indonesia The vegetable asinan is preserved vegetables served in a thin hot peanut sauce with vinegar topped with peanuts and krupuk The fruit asinan is preserved tropical fruits served in sweet hot sour vinegar chili sauce sprinkled with peanuts Banana salad 1 South African cuisine 1 Fruit salad Composed of condensed Food portal Category Lists of foods Bacon United Kingdom Often eaten with ketchup or brown sauce Bacon egg cheese United States Breakfast sandwich usually with fried scrambled egg Bagel toast Israel Pressed toasted bagel filled with vegetables cheese grilled on a sandwich toaster or panini press Baked bean United States Canned baked beans on white brown bread sometimes with butter Banh m 4 Vietnam Filling is typically meat but can contain a wide range of foods including sardines tofu pate eggs Served on an airy baguette with pickled carrots cilantro and peppers Barbecue 5 6 7 United States Served on a bun with chopped sliced shredded meat pulled pork beef chicken typically sometimes topped with coleslaw Barros Jarpa Chile Ham cheese usually mantecoso which is similar to farmer cheese Barros Luco Chile Beef usually thin-cut steak cheese Bauru Brazil Melted cheese roast beef tomato pickled cucumber in a hollowed-out French roll Beef on weck United States Buffalo New York Roast beef on a Kummelweck roll Beirute Brazil Melted cheese sliced fresh tomatoes with oregano lettuce leaves roast beef on Arab bread with mayonnaise BLT United States Named for its ingredients bacon lettuce and tomato Often served on toasted sliced bread spread with mayonnaise Bocadillo de calamares Spain Baguette bread filled with fried squid Bologna United States Canada Pre-sliced sometimes fried bologna sausage between slices of white bread with various condiments such as mustard and mayonnaise Boloney Bologna salad sandwich NE Pennsylvania A mixture of bologna sausage and sweet gherkin pickles is processed through a meat grinder Mayonnaise or Miracle Whip is added to the mixture The salad mixture is left to meld flavors for several hours then spread thickly on sandwich bread Some recipes call for adding minced white onion hard boiled egg to the salad Ham is sometimes substituted for the bologna in which case it becomes a ham salad sandwich Bosna Austria Usually grilled on white bread containing a bratwurst sausage onions a blend of tomato ketchup mustard and curry powder Bratwurst Sandwich Germany The Bratwurst sandwich is a popular street food in Germany Generally served in a roll with mustard Some vendors offer a side dish of sauerkraut or french fries Breakfast roll United Kingdom Ireland Convenience dish on a variety of bread rolls containing such breakfast items as sausages bacon white or black pudding mushrooms tomatoes hash browns and fried eggs often eaten with ketchup or brown sauce Breakfast United States Typically a scrambled or fried egg cheese a sausage patty or other breakfast meat served on a biscuit or English muffin British Rail United Kingdom Reference to the poor quality of catering on the now-defunct British Rail this refers to any poor-quality sandwich often stale Broodje kroket The Netherlands Soft bread roll containing a ragout -based croquette often eaten with mustard Bun kebab Pakistan Consists of a shallow-fried spicy patty onions and chutney or raita in a hamburger hot dog bun Butterbrot Germany Single open-faced containing butter as the common ingredient with sweet savory toppings depending on the meal Carrozza Italy Breaded fried cheese sandwich Caviar Russia Red caviar with butter on white bread sometimes decorated with fresh parsley Cemita Mexico Sliced avocado meat white cheese onions red sauce salsa roja on a fluffy sesame-seeded egg roll originally from the city of Puebla Chocolate Mexico Rye bread butter chocolate shot sprinkles fine small chocolate candies Chacarero Chile commonly referred to as a grilled cheese sandwich Cheese pickle United Kingdom Slices of cheese typically Cheddar and pickle a sweet vinegary chutney with the most popular brand being Branston sandwiched between two slices of bread Cheesesteak United States Philadelphia Pennsylvania Thinly sliced steak melted cheese in a long roll also known as a Philadelphia Philly cheesesteak Chicken the chicken salad sandwich the shredded or barbeque chicken sandwich Chicken salad Sandwich prepared with chicken salad as a filling Chicken schnitzel Australia Sandwich of crumbed pan-fried chicken fillet on buttered bread with shredded iceberg lettuce mayonnaise Chickpea salad 8 9 United States Chickpea salad is a vegan sandwich filling with a texture similar to tuna salad Chickpea salad consists of mashed up chickpeas onions other seasonings Some versions also include tuna 10 Chili burger United States Hamburger with the patty topped with chili con carne Chimichurris Dominican Cutlet sandwich Italian United States Italy Especially popular where there are large populations of immigrant Italians these cutlet sandwiches are made with breaded veal chicken cutlets They can be served with provolone cheese long hots chili peppers and or sauteed greens spinach or broccoli raab Sometimes they are served Parmesan style with tomato sauce and mozzarella and Parmesan cheese Breaded cutlets schnitzels cotoletta or escalope may have first appeared on the culinary scene with the Napoleonic armies for conservation purposes Napoleon offered a monetary reward to the person who developed a method to transport conserved food for a longer amount of time that then could be consumed unspoiled Although the breading of meat concept was not the winner it was a culinary development that was quickly adopted in Austria northern Italy Dagwood United States Multiple layers containing a wide variety of meats condiments named for Dagwood Bumstead of the comic strip Blondie Deli Germany Sandwich usually ordered at a deli choices include type of bread toasted untoasted type of meat cold cut type of sliced cheese vegetable fillings lettuce tomato onion etc condiments Denver United States Sandwich containing a Denver omelette Doner kebab Turkey Doner kebab is meat cooked on a vertical spit normally veal or beef but also may be a mixture of these with lamb sometimes chicken This may be served wrapped in a flatbread such as lavash or pita as a sandwich Donkey burger China Chopped shredded savory donkey meat in a bun sold in Baoding Hebei Province as street food also in high-end restaurants Doubles Trinidad Tobago Two flat fried bara bread containing curried chickpeas or garbanzo beans Dynamite United States Woonsocket Rhode Island Made of ground beef tomato sauces spices many onions peppers It is a popular food served at local family gatherings fundraising benefits usually made in large quantities Dyrl gens natmad Denmark Made with a piece of dark rye bread a layer of leverpostej topped with a slice of salt beef and a slice of meat aspic topped with raw onion rings garden cress Elvis United States Peanut butter banana bacon Egg Worldwide Generic common British comfort food notable for the fact that it encases breaded fish in more bread Fool s Gold Loaf Colorado United States Consists of a single warmed hollowed-out loaf of bread filled with Monte Cristo United States Sliced ham and cheese usually Emmental or Gruyere between slices of French toast and batter-fried In some regions it is sprinkled with powdered sugar served with jelly or jam In other regions New England it is served savory with French mustard no powdered sugar Montreal-style smoked meat Canada Sandwich made from cured smoked brisket with yellow mustard usually on rye bread Mortadella Any sandwich containing mortadella a large Italian sausage Mother-in-law United States Hot dog bun containing a Chicago-style corn-roll tamale topped with chili Muffuletta United States Originated in New Orleans Italian-American community this contains meats cheeses olive salad on a round bun Naan Pakistan Beef on naan bread Oblo ene chlebi ky Czech Republic Type of open sandwich served as an appetizer or snack Open-faced 28 29 Nordic Consists of a single slice of bread with one more food items on top See also pizza Pambazo Mexico Made with pambazo bread dipped in a red guajillo pepper sauce filled with potatoes and chorizo Pan-bagnat France Round bread bread bagnats topped with green salad tomatoes hard-boiled eggs tuna anchovies cucumbers fava beans artichokes green peppers radishes onions basil black olives Condiments may include garlic vinegar olive oil salt pepper Served chilled Panini Italy In Italy panino is the word for a sandwich made from bread other than sliced bread in which case Italians call it a tramezzino Examples of bread types used are ciabatta rosetta and baguette The bread is cut horizontally filled with deli ingredients such as salami ham cheese mortadella other food is sometimes pressed by a warming grill In the United States United Kingdom and Canada the term panini is used to refer to a long pressed toasted sandwich there is widespread availability use of sandwich presses often known as panini presses Pastrami on rye Classic sandwich made famous in the Jewish kosher delicatessens of New York City Patty melt United States Consists of a hamburger patty pieces of sauteed grilled onion and Cheddar or Swiss cheese between two slices of bread Peanut butter jelly United States Jam is often used in place of jelly Also known as a PB J PB J may also be served with fresh fruit rather than jam with thin sliced apples pears bananas Pebete Argentina Simple Argentine sandwich traditionally filled with cheese cured meat tomato mayonnaise Pebete actually refers to the bread used for the sandwich - a soft oval bun with a spongy inside a thin toasted crust Pepito Steak sandwich that is common in Mexico Venezuela In Spain it usually also contains aioli Pepper egg 30 31 United States Chicago Scrambled eggs and grilled bell peppers served on French bread Pepper egg Italian Italy the USA in areas where there was a concentration of Italian immigrants Sauteed Italian long hots sliced not diced in olive oil garlic is optional coated with scrambled eggs cooked until the eggs are firm Seasoned with salt pepper and Parmesan or other hard aged cheese such as Romano or Pecorino Then the mixture is stuffed into an Italian-style roll between two slices of Italian bread This may also be served with sliced tomatoes Pimento cheese Southern United States Common food preparation in the Southern United States a spread or relish made with cheese mayonnaise pimentos salt and pepper blended to either a smooth chunky paste 32 Regional variations incorporate additional ingredients Also eaten in the United Kingdom see Tea in this list the Philippines 33 Pistolette Stuffed fried bread roll sometimes called stuffed pistolettes in the Cajun areas around Lafayette This also refers to a type of submarine-shaped bread about half the size of a baguette that is popular in New Orleans for Vietnamese banh m and other sandwiches 34 Pljeskavica Balkans Patty dish popular in the Balkan region of Southeastern Europe a sandwich utilizes the Pljeskavica patty bread Po boy United States Crusty long roll split filled with cold cuts roasted beef fried seafood The New Orleans analogue to the sub hoagie Polish boy United States Cleveland Ohio Kielbasa sausage in a bun covered with french fries barbecue sauce or hot sauce and coleslaw Porchetta Italy A sandwich made of roast pork with italian-type spices such as rosemary garlic fennel others in varying proportions It is popular as street food usually sold from white trucks throughout central Italy It was transplanted to America in the late 19th century by Italian immigrants is known as the roast pork sandwich very popular in the northeastern United States In America it is often served with provolone cheese greens which may be spinach or broccoli raab Porilainen Finland Half-inch slice of thick sausage usually with diced red sweet onion sliced pickles ketchup mustard sometimes mayonnaise on white bread Pork chop bun Macau Popular dish in Macau the bun is extremely crisp outside very soft inside containing a freshly fried pork chop Pork tenderloin United States Midwest Thin tenderized deep-fried pork loin served on a bun Prawn roll Australia Prego Portugal These steaks flavored with onions red wine are called prego nailed steaks because a small meat mallet is typically used to nail the garlic slices into the steak The marinade is red wine based includes onions the aforementioned garlic chilies bay leaf parsley oregano ground black pepper olive oil The steak is grilled placed in Portuguese rolls called carcacas A reduced marinade based sauce is drizzled over the meats Primanti Pittsburgh Pennsylvania United States Selection of grilled meats topped with french fries coleslaw tomato on Italian bread Prosperity Sandwich United States St Louis Ham turkey topped with broiled cheese Sometimes includes bacon tomato Pudgy pie 35 United States Sandwich made in a pan with margarine on the outside either savory with pizza sauce other fillings on the inside sweet containing pie filling The term pudgy pie is sometimes used to refer to pie irons a gadget used for campfire cooking 36 37 Pulled pork Southern United States Barbecue sandwich in which pork usually shoulder is smoked slowly at a low temperature until the meat becomes tender enough that it can be pulled shredded with two forks The pork is served on a bun often topped with barbecue sauce and vinegar - or mayonnaise -based coleslaw depending on the region Queen United Kingdom Germany Sausage on a roll bread served with a variety of sauces toppings Schmitter 39 Philadelphia Pennsylvania USA The Schmitter is a steak beef sandwich but not a cheesesteak It was developed at McNally s Tavern in Chestnut Hill in the 1960s in response to a favored sandwich of a friend co-worker of the proprietor s husband It is named after Schmidt s beer with which it was served The filling consists of grilled beef steak onions topped with grilled cooked cotto salami American cheese tomato It is topped with a sauce consisting of mayonnaise sweet pickle relish ketchup and Worcestershire sauce served on a kaiser roll Sealed crustless United States The filling in this sandwich is sealed between two layers of bread by a crimped edge has the crust subsequently removed A popular variety in the United States is peanut butter jelly This type of sandwich is mass-produced by The J M Smucker Company under the brand name Uncrustables Shawarma The Levant Flatbread with fillings of beef spinach tomatoes cucumber tahini sauce wrapped grilled Shooter s sandwich England Prepared by filling a hollowed-out long loaf of bread with cooked filet mignon steak cooked mushrooms of chicken pork lamb veal venison beef grilled on a spit served in a bun St Paul St Louis Missouri United States Egg foo young patty containing bean sprouts and minced white onions dill pickle slices white onion mayonnaise lettuce tomato on white bread Steak bomb United States Grilled over-stuffed submarine roll containing shaved steak topped with salami melted provolone sauteed onions bell peppers Steak burger Typically prepared with ground sliced minced beefsteak meat Additional meats are also used Steak United States Prepared with cooked steak served on bread or a roll Steak sandwiches may include toppings such as cheese onions mushrooms bell peppers hot peppers tomatoes in some instances fried eggs cole slaw or french fries Submarine Sub Baguette United States Generic sandwich served on a long French Italian roll which may contain a wide variety of sliced meats vegetables condiments including lettuce tomato sweet peppers onions olives mushrooms Also known regionally as a hero a hoagie a grinder a zep among other names In the United Kingdom it is named a baguette after the French bread used to make it Taylor Ham Pork roll Sandwich New Jersey Pork roll still is the predominant term in South Jersey but in the northern part of the state it is Taylor Ham 42 It is grilled pork roll served several ways This can be served with a fried egg a fried egg with cheese Variations include serving with grilled pork roll cheese just grilled pork roll Although classically served on a kaiser roll bread variations include bagels English Muffins other breads Tavern United States Common in Iowa consists of a mixture of unseasoned ground beef and sauteed onions sometimes topped with pickles ketchup mustard on a bun Tea United Kingdom Thinly sliced white bread with crusts removed lightly buttered containing a light spread of cream cheese or mayonnaise mixture often radishes cucumber asparagus or watercress Other fillings may be pimento cheese ham with mustard smoked salmon fruit jam curried chicken and egg salad TLT T empeh L ettuce and T omato 43 44 45 United States Vegan version of the BLT smoky baked tempeh lettuce tomato avocado served on toasted sourdough bread Toast UK Thin slice of toast between two thin slices of bread with a layer of butter salt pepper to taste Toast Hawaii Germany Slice of toast with ham a maraschino cherry in the middle of a pineapple slice cheese grilled from above so the cheese starts to melt Toastie Two slices of bread with various fillings toasted in a sandwich toaster Tofu 46 47 United States Tofu typically broiled baked with vegetables Tongue toast Sauteed beef tongue and scrambled eggs served open-faced 48 49 Torta Mexico Mexican roll either telera or bolillo spread with mayo and or refried beans stuffed with various sliced meats cheeses vegetables usually tomatoes onions avocado your choice of pickled jalapenos chipotle peppers It can either be made ahead tightly wrapped for a packed lunch if made to order grilled on both sides with some butter Torta ahogada Mexico Guadalajara Birote bread similar to bolillo filled with carnitas deep-fried pork shredded chicken other meats beans and cheese The torta is then dipped in a very hot tomato dried chile de arbol sauce topped with pickled sliced onions Tramezzino Italy Triangular white bread with the crusts removed with fillings such as tuna olive prosciutto served in Italian bars throughout the day Trancapecho 50 Bolivia Slice of breaded meat fried potatoes a fried egg rice salad tomatoes onions and locotos between two slices of bread Tripleta 51 52 53 Puerto Rico Although there are numerous variations the main distinction is a combination of three meats typically grilled such as beef usually churrasco steak or cube steak roast pork pernil chicken ham Condiments may include some combination of mustard ketchup and mayonnaise often combined to create a special sauce Popular toppings include thin crispy fried potato sticks shoestring potatoes thinly sliced cabbage lettuce onion tomato pickles and Swiss cheese The sandwich is often toasted in a sandwich press Tuna United States Usually made with tuna salad which may include mayonnaise sweetcorn cucumber or celery Other common variations include the tuna boat and tuna melt Vada pav India Potato fritter coated in chickpea flour batata vada in a bun 54 Vegemite Australia Vegemite is a dark brown Australian food paste made from used brewers yeast extract a by-product of beer manufacturing various vegetables wheat spice additives It is a spread for sandwiches toast crumpets and cracker biscuits as well as a filling for pastries Vegetable India Many types of vegetables are used to prepare vegetable sandwiches Wurstbrot sausage bread Germany Simple common German sandwich prepared with thin slices of lunch meat or sausage sometimes buttered Yakisoba-pan Japan Hot dog bun stuffed with fried noodles frequently topped with pickles such as beni sh ga with mayonnaise Zapiekanka Poland Halved baguette other bread usually topped with mushrooms cheese ham other meats vegetables Zsiroskenyer Hungary Lard on white bread usually topped with white red onion
