condiments Chutneys Fish pastes Fish sauces Indian condiments Japanese condiments Mustard brands Hot sauces Pakistani condiments Philippine condiments Pickled foods Carolina style Condiment Cruet-stand Mustard oil Sachet Salt pepper shakers Category The examples perspective in this article may not represent a worldwide view of the subject You may improve this article discuss the issue on the talk page or create a new article as appropriate March 2013 Learn how when to remove this template message Bitterballen Netherlands A round shaped beef- ragout version of croquette typically containing a mixture of beef veal minced chopped beef broth butter flour for thickening parsley salt pepper resulting in a thick ragout Most recipes include nutmeg and there are also variations utilizing curry powder or that add in finely chopped vegetables such as carrot Bonda South India Various sweet spicy versions of exist different regions The process of making a spicy bonda involves deep-frying potato or other vegetables filling dipped in gram flour batter Cereal 1 A food made from processed grains that is often eaten cold usually mixed with milk e g cow s milk soy milk rice milk almond milk juice water yogurt sugar sometimes fruit but may be eaten dry Cokodok Malaysia A traditional Malaysian fritter snack that is made with flour and banana is fried It is usually round in shape tends to vary in size Cracker nuts A snack food produced with peanuts that are coated in a wheat flour dough then fried deep-fried 2 Crepe Brittany France A type of very thin pancake usually made from wheat flour crepes de Froment buckwheat flour galettes The word is of French origin deriving from the Latin crispa meaning curled Croquette France A French invention with worldwide popularity a croquette is a small breadcrumbed fried food roll containing usually as main ingredients mashed potatoes and or ground meat veal beef chicken turkey shellfish fish cheese vegetables and mixed with bechamel or brown sauce 3 and soaked white bread egg onion spices herbs wine milk beer or any of the combination thereof sometimes with a filling e g sauteed onions mushrooms boiled eggs Scotch eggs Doughnut 4 A fried dough snack popular in most parts of the world Gulha A popular snack in Maldives 5 Khanom buang Thailand A snack sold by street vendors in Thailand Pakora India A fried snack fritter found across South Asia Pancakes Flat soda-leavened semi-sweet cake made with egg flour In the United States pancakes are typically eaten at breakfast with syrup fruit yogurt Parippu Vada Kerala Traditional dal fritters Pazham Pori Kerala Traditional banana fritters Pizza 6 Disputed Sources state that Ancient Greece and Italy are likely 7 8 9 Flat bread with meat vegetable and or cheese toppings Pizza is often eaten as pizza by the slice mini pizza pizza baguette 10 is often sold by the slice by weight Poffertjes Netherlands A traditional Dutch batter treat Pretzel soft German Italian-American A traditional baked treat Tele-bhaja chop Indian subcontinent specially Bengal region Bengali fritters a famous deep-fried snack made with vegetables and besan Uzhunnu Vada Indian subcontinent Popular in South Indian states like Kerala Tamilnadu Karnataka Waffle Belgium A batter -based or dough -based cake cooked in a waffle iron patterned to give a characteristic size shape surface impression There are many variations based on the type of iron recipe used with over a dozen regional varieties in Belgium alone 11 Brittle A type of confection consisting of flat broken pieces of hard sugar candy embedded with nuts such as pecans almonds or peanuts Pictured is peanut brittle cracked on a serving dish Bubblegum United States A type of chewing gum designed to be inflated out of the mouth as a bubble As with chewing gum the product is made from chicle and is available in various flavors Candy Also known as lollies many diverse candies exist which include but is not limited to candy cane candy corn gumdrop gummi bear gummi candy jawbreaker jelly baby jelly bean licorice also spelled liquorice lollipop rock candy and taffy Chocolate 6 Chocolate has been used as a drink for nearly all of its history has become one of the most popular food types flavors in the world Sweet chocolate such as milk chocolate and dark chocolate are typically eaten as a snack food as opposed to unsweetened chocolate which contains primarily cocoa solids cocoa butter in varying proportions Chocolate bar 12 A confection in bar form comprising some all of the following components cocoa solids cocoa butter sugar milk The relative presence absence of these components form the subclasses of dark chocolate milk chocolate and white chocolate Chocolate rugelach Jewish Prepared with a cream cheese dough a filling consisting of chocolate jam or jelly cinnamon 13 The addition of raisins and nuts raisins is also common 13 Chocolate truffle France A type of chocolate confectionery traditionally made with a chocolate ganache centre coated in chocolate icing sugar cocoa powder chopped toasted nuts typically hazelnuts almonds or coconut usually in a spherical conical curved shape Other fillings may replace the ganache Fudge United States Typically sweet rich it s prepared by mixing sugar butter and milk heating it to the soft-ball stage at 240 F 116 C then beating the mixture while it cools so that it acquires a smooth creamy consistency Many variations exist with other flavorings added such as chocolate Geplak Indonesia Made from equal parts coarsely grated coconut and sugar in equal amounts often colored brightly Other variations exist Grass jelly China A jelly-like dessert prepared by boiling the aged slightly oxidized stalks leaves of Mesona chinensis 14 15 member of the mint family with potassium carbonate for several hours with a little starch then cooling the liquid to a jelly-like consistency 14 16 Marshmallow In its modern form typically consists of sugar and or corn syrup water and gelatin whipped to a spongy consistency coated with corn starch Marshmallow probably came first into being as a medicinal substance since the mucilaginous extracts comes from the root of the marshmallow plant Althaea officinalis which were used as a remedy for sore throats Concoctions of other parts of the marshmallow plant had medical purposes as well 17 Marzipan Consisting primarily of sugar or honey and almond meal sometimes augmented with almond oil extract Pictured is marzipan made into the shapes of fruits Nougat A variety of similar traditional confectioneries made with sugar and or honey roasted nuts almonds walnuts pistachios hazelnuts recently macadamia nuts are common whipped egg whites sometimes chopped candied fruit Panforte Italy A traditional Italian dessert containing fruits nuts resembles fruitcake or Lebkuchen It may date back to 13th century Siena in Italy s Tuscany region Its preparation includes baking a mixture of sugar dissolved in honey various nuts fruits spices flour The finished cake is dusted with icing sugar Pudding 6 Most often refers to a dessert but can also be a savory dish Depending on its ingredients such a pudding may be served as a part of the main course as a dessert Rice Krispie treats United States A sweet dessert snack made from Rice Krispies melted butter or margarine melted marshmallows 18 Sometimes marshmallows and or cereal that is seasonal is used to make these treats holiday-specific S mores United States A traditional nighttime campfire treat popular in the United States and Canada consisting of a roasted marshmallow a layer of chocolate sandwiched between two pieces of graham cracker 19 Toffee Made by caramelizing sugar or molasses creating inverted sugar along with butter occasionally flour Toffee is sometimes prepared with nuts raisins Turkish delight Turkey A family of confections based on a gel of starch and sugar Premium varieties consist largely of chopped dates pistachios and hazelnuts or walnuts bound by the gel the cheapest are mostly gel generally flavored with rosewater mastic bergamot orange or lemon Arrowroot Arrowroot used to be very popular in British cuisine and Napoleon supposedly said the reason for the British love of arrowroot was to support the commerce of their colonies 20 It can be consumed in the form of biscuits puddings jellies cakes hot sauces also with beef tea milk veal broth and noodles in Korean Vietnamese cuisine Chebakia Morocco 21 A sesame cookie that is fried covered with honey 21 They re typically shaped as a flower 21 Chocolate chip cookie A drop cookie that originated in the United States and features chocolate chips as its distinguishing ingredient Cookie 22 In the United States Canada and Australia a cookie is a small flat baked treat usually containing fat flour eggs and sugar In Scotland a cookie is a plain bun 23 In most English-speaking countries outside North America including the United Kingdom the most common word for a small flat baked treat usually containing fat flour eggs and sugar is biscuit however in many regions both terms are used such as the American-inspired Maryland Cookies while in others the two words have different meanings Pictured are butter cookies Ginger snaps A globally popular biscuit based snack food flavored with ginger Graham crackers Invented in Bound Brook New Jersey by Sylvester Graham The original graham cracker was made with graham flour a combination of finely-ground unbleached -wheat flour with the wheat bran and germ coarsely-ground added back in providing nutrition flavor Oatmeal cookie Cookies prepared with oatmeal Raisins other ingredients such as chocolate chips are also sometimes used Peanut butter cookie United States A type of cookie that is distinguished by having peanut butter as a principal ingredient The cookie generally originated in the United States its development dating back to the 1910s 24 Gansito Mexico A Mexican snack cake that is filled with both strawberry jelly a creamy filling They are covered in chocolate have a chocolate sprinkle topping It was created in 1957 by Marinela the pastries division of the breadmaking Bimbo brand Jaffa Cakes Scotland Introduced by McVitie Price in 1927 named after Jaffa oranges now manufactured by numerous companies including McVities Cadbury and other biscuit manufacturers Tesco and other supermarket chains Snack cake A baked dessert confectionery made with cake and icing Churros Sometimes referred to as a Spanish doughnut it s a fried-dough pastry predominantly choux based snack Churros are popular in Spain Italy France the Philippines Portugal Central America South America and the United States Pictured are churros drizzled with chocolate Fairy bread Fruit bun Pastry 4 Pictured is a profiterole also known as a cream puff Scones Snack pie 12 Toaster pastry 6 Amazake Japan A traditional sweet low- non-alcohol depending on recipes Japanese drink made from fermented rice Amazake dates from the Kofun period it is mentioned in the Nihon Shoki the second oldest book of classical Japanese history Atole Coffee Ethiopia southern Arabia A beverage prepared from the dried seeds known as coffee beans of Coffea species It contains caffeine a mild stimulant It is often consumed with sugar milk mixed in Colada morada Energy drinks Red Bull Monster Flavored milk Such Flavors include not limited to Chocolate Strawberry And even Flavors like Rose Banana Horchata Juice A beverage prepared from the forced extraction of liquids from fruit vegetables Kefir Malted milk Milkshake Root beer Root beer float Sikhye Soft drinks Smoothie 25 Sports drinks Gatorade Powerade Tamagozake Japan Consists of heated sake sugar a raw egg Tea Usually consumed warm It contains hot water a teabag for flavour sometimes milk sugar is added Tejuino Jalisco Mexico A cold beverage made from fermented corn It is often served with a scoop of shaved ice Frozen custard Coney Island New York A cold dessert similar to ice cream but made with eggs in addition to cream and sugar It was invented in Coney Island New York in 1919 when ice cream vendors Archie Elton Kohr found that adding egg yolks to ice cream created a smoother texture helped the ice cream stay cold longer In their first weekend on the boardwalk the Kohr brothers sold 18 460 cones 26 Ice cream 22 China A frozen dessert usually made from dairy products such as milk cream often combined with fruits other ingredients flavours Most varieties contain sugar although some are made with other sweeteners The meaning of the phrase ice cream varies from one country to another Phrases such as frozen custard frozen yogurt sorbet gelato others are used to distinguish different varieties styles In some countries such as the United States the phrase ice cream applies only to a specific variety most governments regulate the commercial use of the various terms according to the relative quantities of the main ingredients 27 In other countries such as Italy and Argentina one word is used for all variants Ice pop San Francisco A water-based frozen snack that is made by freezing flavored liquid such as fruit juice around a stick The first recorded ice pop was created in 1905 by 11-year-old Frank Epperson of San Francisco who left a glass of soda water powder water outside in his back porch with a wooden mixing stick in it In the United States Canada frozen ice on a stick is generically referred to as a popsicle due to the early popularity of the Popsicle brand In Ireland the product is also referred to as a freeze pop In the United Kingdom the term ice lolly is used Ice block is used in parts of Australia 28 29 and New Zealand as well as icy pole after a brand of the same name 30 Milkshake A sweet cold beverage which is usually made from milk ice cream or iced milk flavorings sweeteners such as fruit syrup or chocolate sauce Outside the United States the drink is sometimes called a thickshake a thick milkshake in New England a frappe When the term milkshake was first used in print in 1885 milkshakes were an alcoholic whiskey drink that has been described as a sturdy healthful eggnog type of drink with eggs whiskey etc served as a tonic as well as a treat 31 However by 1900 the term referred to wholesome drinks made with chocolate strawberry or vanilla syrups By the early 1900s people were asking for the new treat often with ice cream 31 Achappam A traditional rice rosette popular in Kerala Ada Kerala A traditional 35 Keralan delicacy consisting of rice parcels encased in a dough made of rice flour with sweet fillings steamed in banana leaf and served as an evening snack as part of breakfast Grated coconut and rice flour are the two main ingredients Dolma Balkans Middle East Caucases A traditional dish of Armenian cuisine - minced meat wrapped in grape leaves French fries Hummus Pictured is hummus with pine nuts olive oil Instant soup 12 Khandvi 36 Gujarat A collective term used for a type of snacks in Gujarati cuisine from the Indian state of Gujarat Kuzhalappam A traditional rice based tea time snack popular in Kerala Meze Nian gao Oblo ene chlebi ky Czech Republic Slovakia Onion rings 6 Piattos Sesame sticks Sev mamra India A mixture of spicy dry ingredients such as puffed rice savory noodles peanuts Spring roll 10 Tahini Tapas Pictured are tapas in Barcelona Spain Tempura Unniyappam Kuzhiyappam Kerala A traditional rice flour based deep-fried fritters in round shape It is popular in Kerala Yogurt 6 Energy bar 10 Food bars containing cereals and other high energy foods The first energy bar in the American marketplace was Space Food Sticks which Pillsbury Company created in the late 1960s to capitalize on the popularity of the U S space program Flapjack A sweet tray-baked oat bar made from rolled oats butter brown sugar and golden syrup The item is known as a flapjack in the United Kingdom and Ireland and as a cereal bar in Australia and New Zealand In other countries such products are referred to as granola bars Granola bar 37 Granola bars were invented by Stanley Mason 38 39 and have become popular as a snack similar to the traditional flapjack oat bar muesli bar familiar in the Commonwealth countries Bagel 6 Poland A bread product traditionally shaped by hand into the form of a ring from yeasted wheat dough roughly hand-sized which is first boiled for a short time in water then baked 40 Bread 6 Egypt Europe Buterbrod Russia Ukraine An open sandwich Butterbrot Germany An open sandwich Croissant 10 Croutons 41 Fried bake Caribbean A type of bread usually eaten with saltfish Gua-bao Taiwan Consists of a slice of stewed meat other condiments sandwiched between flat steamed bread Houska 41 Czech Republic Literally knitted bread Lavash Armenia Traditional staple food of Armenian cuisine - soft thin bread In 2014 lavash the preparation meaning appearance of traditional bread as an expression of culture in Armenia was inscribed in the UNESCO Representative List of the Intangible Cultural Heritage of Humanity 42 Open sandwich 41 One slice of bread with a topping toppings Pasta Pictured is cavatappi with pesto Sandwich 43 A snack typically consisting of two more slices of bread with one more fillings between them Sm rrebr d Denmark Norway An open sandwich Tea sandwich United Kingdom A tea-time snack with the crust removed Tortilla A flatbread made from corn wheat Totopo Oaxaca A flatbread made from corn American cheese United States A processed cheese from the U S American cheese was originally only white but is now sometimes modified to be yellow-colored Today it is typically manufactured from a set of ingredients 44 such as milk whey milkfat milk protein whey protein salt Cheese 10 A generic term for a diverse group of milk-based food products Pictured is a plate of assorted cheeses Cream cheese Korba iky Orava region of Slovakia A type of string cheese Oaxaca cheese Mexico A semi-hard string cheese Obatzda Bavaria A cheese delicacy Parmesan cheese Processed cheese Also called cheese food a food product made from normal cheese sometimes other unfermented dairy ingredients plus emulsifiers extra salt food colorings whey String cheese United States Snack-sized servings of low-moisture mozzarella Banana chip in Los Angeles California United States Animal cracker A small cracker or cookie baked in the shape of an animal usually an animal one might see at a zoo The most common variety is light-colored slightly sweet but darker chocolate-flavored colorful frosted varieties are also manufactured Arare Small Japanese rice crackers Bagel chips Crackers 51 Pictured are water biscuits with toppings Corn dog Dried cuttlefish Dried fish 54 Dried squid 55 Fish such as fried fish 55 Hot dogs Jerky 56 Kibbeh nayyeh Omelet Oysters canned 55 Pickled herring 55 Soused herring Bombay mix Bombay mix is the name used in the United Kingdom and Ireland for a traditional Indian snack known as chiwda chevdo bhuso if made without potato chevda or chivdo in India or Chan chura in Odisha and chanachur in Bengal It consists of a variable mixture of spicy dried ingredients which may include fried lentils peanuts chickpea flour noodles corn vegetable oil chickpeas flaked rice fried onion and curry leaves Cup Noodles A well-known brand of instant ramen noodle snack manufactured by Nissin packaged in a foam food container hard plastic paper cup Other brand names are used in specific countries such as Cup Noodle in Japan Instant noodles 22 Invented by Momofuku Ando of Nissin Foods Japan 57 dried precooked noodles and are often sold with packets of flavoring including seasoning oil Dried noodles are usually eaten after being cooked soaked in boiling water while precooked noodles can be reheated eaten straight from the packet Ramen A Japanese noodle dish that consists of Chinese-style wheat noodles served in a meat- occasionally fish-based broth often flavored with soy sauce or miso uses toppings such as sliced pork ch sh dried seaweed nori kamaboko green onions occasionally corn Portals it is a hearty stew made from beef pork chicken vegetables a variety of starchy roots and tubers classified as viandas 2 Acquacotta Italy Tuscany Chunky Originally a peasant food 3 historically its Russia Cold chilled Kvass -based vegetable ham soup Oxtail soup Chunky Oxtail soup is made with beef tails The use of the word ox in this context is a legacy of nomenclature no specialized stock of beef animals are used At least five popular unrelated versions of oxtail soup exist a traditional Korean dish a Chinese dish which is more like a stew a fried barbecued oxtail combined with soup variation which is a popular dish in Indonesia where it is called as sop buntut An ethnic dish of the American South which traces its lineage back to the pre-revolutionary war era a thick rich gravy -like soup popular in the United Kingdom since the 18th century Creole oxtail soup is made from a tomato base with oxtails potatoes green beans corn mirepoix garlic herbs spices In Germany there are lots of varieties of oxtail soup called Ochsenschwanzsuppe or Ochsenschleppsuppe usually containing oxtail various root vegetables herbs also Sherry Madeira Palm nut soup Palm kernel Panada Europe Hungary Cold chilled Hungarian megyleves Sour cherries sour cream Sour rye soup white borscht ur Poland Belarus Made of soured rye flour akin to sourdough meat usually boiled pork sausage or pieces of smoked sausage bacon ham Sour soup fish soup Vietnam Fish Rice fish various vegetables in some cases pineapple The term also refers to various soups in a number of national cuisines Spinach soup Broth- cream-based Prepared using spinach as a main ingredient Split pea Ancient Chunky Dried peas such as the split pea It is with variations a part of the cuisine of many cultures It is greyish-green yellow in color depending on the regional variety of peas used all are cultivars of Pisum sativum Squash bisque France Bisque Stone soup Portugal Chunky Pork meat products such as black chourico common chourico and bacon red beans and coriander Sup Kambing Indonesia and Malaysia Chunky Goat meat tomato celery spring onion ginger candlenut lime leaf its broth is yellowish in color Stracciatella Italy Broth with chunks Made by drizzling a preparation based on beaten eggs into boiling meat broth while stirring Swedish fruit soup Sweden Dessert soup Typically prepared using dried fruits typically served as a dessert dish It may be served hot cold 29 Taco soup Chunky Similar ingredients to those used inside a taco ground beef tomatoes chopped green chilis olives onions corn beans a packet of taco seasoning 30 Vegetarian versions combine beans with the other ingredients except for the ground beef 31 T ng F n China Noodle Rice noodles in broth usually beef chicken custom Dean Ornish Richard H Schwartz Semi-vegetarianism Macrobiotic diet Pescetarianism Vegetarian vegan dog diet Vegetarian vegan symbolism Alicot France Stew made with poultry giblets and possibly the head feet wing tips Andrajos Spain Jaen Stew of tomatoes onions garlic red pepper and rabbit thickened with cake flour Asam pedas Indonesia Malaysia Sour spicy stew dish made of seafood cooked in tamarind fruit juice chili and other spices Beef bourguignon France Burgundy Stew made of beef braised in red wine traditionally red Burgundy 1 and beef broth generally flavoured with garlic onions a bouquet garni with pearl onions and mushrooms Bicol Express Philippines Stew made from long chillies coconut milk shrimp paste or stockfish onions pork and garlic Bigos Poland Ukraine Lithuania Stew that features white cabbage sauerkraut various cuts of meat sausages often whole pureed tomatoes honey and mushrooms as ingredients Birnen Bohnen und Speck Germany Typical dish in which pears beans and bacon are cooked together Birria Mexico Spicy meat stew made of pork goat lamb mutton that is traditionally served on holidays such as Christmas Blanquette de veau France Bright veal ragout with mirepoix Booyah United States Upper Midwestern Thick stew popular in the Upper Midwestern United States with meat vegetables Often prepared communally in large kettles with several different meats Bosnian Pot Bosnia Herzegovina Typical Bosnian dish with ingredients beef lamb cabbage potatoes tomatoes carrots parsley garlic and peppercorns whole not ground Bouillabaisse France Marseille Bony fish seafood stew with vegetables and Provencal herbs spices The name refers to a simmering boil the temperature of cooking the stew Brudet Croatia Fish stew that is usually eaten with polenta Brunswick stew United States Southern Tomato -based stew containing various types of lima beans or butter beans corn okra other vegetables one more types of meat Most recipes claiming authenticity call for squirrel or rabbit meat but chicken pork beef are also common ingredients Buddha Jumps Over the Wall China Cantonese variation on shark fin soup Bu u kebab Turkey Turkish lamb vegetable stew with a kebab name Burgoo United States Midwestern and Southern Traditionally made with wild game this spicy thick stew is similar to Irish or Mulligan stew often served with cornbread or corn muffins Often prepared communally with several different meats Cabbage stew Prepared using cabbage as a main ingredient Pictured is kapuska Cacciucco Italy Fish stew with several different types of fish and shellfish cooked in wine tomatoes and chili pepper Cachupa Cape Verde Slow cooked stew of corn hominy beans fish meat sausage beef goat or chicken Caldeirada Portugal Stew consisting of a large variety of fish sometimes shellfish with potatoes tomatoes and onions Caldereta de cordero Spain Lamb mutton stew Caldo gallego Spain Stew made with fatty pork white beans greens cabbage spring greens Literally means Galician stew Callaloo Caribbean West Africa Caribbean dish made of leaf vegetables amaranth capsicum and taro Caparrones Spain La Rioja Stew made of caparron a variety of red kidney beans a spicy chorizo sausage Carbonade flamande Belgium Traditional Belgian sweet-sour beef onion stew made with beer seasoned with thyme and bay leaf Carne mechada Argentina Chile Venezuela 2 Latin American beef stew Cassoulet France Languedoc French dish that consists of slow-cooked meat typically pork sausages pork goose duck sometimes mutton with white haricot beans Cawl Wales Lamb stew beef hock in Pembrokeshire which includes vegetables such as leeks and potatoes as well as carrots celery onion parsnip swede and turnip Chairo Bolivia Meat vegetable stew with potato starch chunos onions carrots potatoes white corn beef wheat kernels Chakapuli Georgia Popular stew with lamb chops or veal onions tarragon leaves cherry plums or tkemali cherry plum sauce dry white wine mixed fresh herbs parsley mint dill coriander garlic salt Chapea Dominican Republic Traditional dish from the countryside that consists of cooked red beans with longaniza Dominican sausage rice ripe plantain and mashed squash which is used as a thickener Chicken mull United States Southern Traditional dish from North Carolina and Georgia It is a type of stew consisting of parboiled whole chicken in a cream milk based broth with butter seasoned with salt pepper other ingredients Traditionally the stew is served in the late fall winter months Often prepared communally Chili con carne United States Texas Spicy normally tomato-based stew that features chopped ground beef peppers other ingredients Cholent Jewish Slowly simmered Jewish stew that cooks overnight is traditionally served on Shabbat Main ingredients are meat potatoes beans and barley some recipes Sephardi include rice substitute chicken for beef Chupe Andino Andes Refers to various stews soups that are prepared in Andes Mountains region of South America Ciambotta Italy Based on vegetables but may have other ingredients such as meat fish The vegetable choices are usually potatoes eggplant tomatoes sweet peppers chili onion herbs Cincinnati chili United States Ohio Mediterranean-spiced meat sauce used as a topping for spaghetti hot dogs Cioppino United States San Francisco Italian-American fish stew that is traditionally made from the catch of the day which in the dish s place of origin is typically a combination of Dungeness crab clams shrimp scallops squid mussels fish The seafood is then combined with fresh tomatoes in a wine sauce served with toasted bread either sourdough baguette Cocido lebaniego Spain Cantabria Stew whose essential ingredients include chickpeas potatoes and collard greens The rest of the elements are compangu meat from the pig slaughter such as bacon tocino black pudding morcilla chorizo and ham Other additional ingredients are beef especially cecina and bones a stuffing made of bread flour egg and parsley Cocido madrileno Spain Madrid Stew whose main ingredient is the chickpea or garbanzo bean preferably of its larger variety also known as kabuli Vegetables are added potatoes mainly but also cabbage carrots and turnips In some cases green beans mangold or cardoon are also added Cocido montanes Spain Cantabria Highlander stew is made with two vegetal ingredients dried large white beans and collard greens berza The rest of the elements of this recipe are known as compangu meat ingredients from the pig slaughter bacon tocino pork ribs costilla black pudding morcilla with rice and chorizo Compote Game stew made for example from rabbit partridge or pigeon Corn stew A stew prepared with corn maize as a primary ingredient Coq au vin France French braise of chicken cooked with wine lardons mushrooms optionally garlic Cotriade France Brittany Breton-style stew made with potatoes many kinds of fish but without shellfish Cozido Cocido Portugal Spain Stew made with different meats vegetables numerous regional variations exist throughout Portugal Spain Daube France Provence Classic Provencal stew made with inexpensive beef braised in wine vegetables garlic and herbes de Provence traditionally cooked in a daubiere a braising pan Dimlama Uzbekistan Stew made with various combinations of meat potatoes onions vegetables sometimes fruits Dinuguan Philippines Filipino savory stew of meat and or offal typically lungs kidneys intestines ears heart snout simmered in a rich spicy dark gravy of pig blood garlic chili most often siling mahaba and vinegar Drokpa Katsa Tibet Stewed tripe with curry fennel monosodium glutamate salt Escudella i carn d olla Spain Catalonia Stew that contains a pilota a very big meatball spiced with garlic and parsley it also contains vegetables such as celery cabbage carrots etc depending on the season Additionally bones sausages called botifarras other types of meat can be used Etouffee United States Louisiana Seafood dish of the Creole cuisine of Louisiana that is usually served with shellfish over rice Literally means smothered in French Fabada Asturiana Spain Asturias Fabada is made with dried large white beans fabes de la Granja soaked overnight before use shoulder of pork Lacon Gallego or bacon tocino black pudding morcilla chorizo often saffron azafran Some recipes also call for longaniza Fabes con almejas Spain Asturias Clam stew that calls for small clams fava beans onions garlic salt saffron bay leaves olive oil parsley bread crumbs sometimes sweet paprika Fahsa Yemen Stew made of lamb cutlets with lamb broth Spices and holba fenugreek are added after cooking F rik l Norway Traditional dish consisting of pieces of mutton with bone cabbage whole black pepper a little wheat flour cooked for several hours in a casserole traditionally served with potatoes boiled in their skins Literally means mutton in cabbage Fasole cu carna i Romania Dish consisting of baked beans sausages and or smoked ham Feijoada Brazil Portugal Stew of beans with beef pork may include other vegetables Fesenj n Iran Thick tart stew made from pomegranate juice ground walnuts traditionally made with poultry but variants using balls of ground meat ghormeh cut lamb fish no meat at all are not unusual Flaki Poland Meat stew with common ingredients including beef tripe beef bay leaf parsley carrots beef broth spices to taste including salt black pepper nutmeg sweet paprika and marjoram F zelek Hungary Very thick vegetable soup so it may be considered a stew Sometimes served with meatballs and often eaten as a side dish Fricot Canada Acadia Consists of potatoes onions whatever meat was available cooked in a stew topped with dumplings The common meats used are chicken fricot au poulet clams fricot aux coques rabbit fricot au lapin des bois beef pork Gaisburger Marsch Germany Swabia Swabian dish made from meat with cooked potatoes and sp tzle Galinhada Brazil Stew of rice chicken Garbure France Gascony Stew of ham with cabbage other vegetables usually with cheese and stale bread added Ghapama Armenia Sweet pumpkin stew traditionally cooked in the pumpkin shell does not contain meat Ghormeh sabzi Iran Dish that consists of a mixture of sauteed herbs consisting mainly of parsley leek a smaller amount of fenugreek leaves where this is usually the dry herb of the mix Goat water Montserrat A national dish of Montserrat prepared with goat meat vegetables Goulash Hungary Soup stew of meat noodles vegetables especially potato seasoned with paprika and other spices Guatitas Chile Ecuador Stew whose main ingredient is pieces of tripe Gumbo United States Louisiana Stew soup that consists primarily of a strongly-flavored stock with meat shellfish a thickener the vegetable holy trinity of celery bell peppers onions Guvec Turkey Vegetable meat stew made with mutton veal common to Balkan countries Guyana Pepperpot Guyana Stewed meat dish strongly flavored with cinnamon hot chili peppers and cassareep a special sauce made from the cassava root Beef pork mutton are the most popular meats used though chicken is also used Hachee Netherlands Traditional Dutch stew based on diced meat fish poultry vegetables Hasenpfeffer Germany Traditional German stew made from marinated rabbit or hare cut into stewing-meat sized pieces braised with onions wine in a marinade thickened with the animal s blood Hoosh United States Thick stew made from pemmican a mix of dried meat fat cereal other meat thickener such as ground biscuits water Used on expeditions to frozen polar regions Hot pot China Mongolia Stew made with a variety of raw meats seafood vegetables noodles dumplings etc all cooked at the table in a simmering hot pot of broth Irish stew Ireland Traditional stew made from lamb mutton as well as potatoes carrots onions and parsley Islim patl can kebab Turkey Traditional stew made from veal mutton eggplants also having tomatoes green peppers Istrian stew Croatia Stew whose main ingredients are beans sauerkraut potatoes bacon and spare ribs the main seasoning is garlic Jambalaya United States Louisiana Dish of the Creole cuisine of Louisiana that consists of three parts meat rice vegetables Many variations that include seafood do exist Kadhi India Pakistan Spicy stew whose thick gravy is based on chickpea flour called besan in Hindi contains vegetable fritters called pakoras to which sour yoghurt is added to give it a little sour taste Kaldereta Philippines Dish whose common ingredients are goat shoulders with tomato paste and liver spread Kapuska Turkey Cabbage and veal stew Kare-kare Philippines Popular stew made from a peanut -based sauce with a variety of vegetables stewed oxtail beef occasionally offal or tripe Meat variants may include goat meat or rarely chicken Karelian hot pot Finland Stew that features a combination of pork beef but lamb can also be used The hot pot is usually seasoned with black peppercorns and salt Other seasonings such as allspice and bay leaf may be used too Common vegetables such as carrot onion and root vegetables are acceptable additions to the stew Kig ha farz France Brittany Stew consisting of various meats hock beef lamb simmered in a broth with carrots potatoes cabbage a large buckwheat flour based dumpling Literally means meat stuffing in Breton Known mainly in Finisterre Kuru fasulye Image of version without meat Turkey Stew consisting of dry beans generally with meat veal or mutton and past rma or sucuk in its broth with tomato paste Lancashire hotpot United Kingdom England Dish made traditionally from lamb mutton onion topped with sliced potatoes left to bake in the oven all day in a heavy pot on a low heat L skisoosi Finland Pork chops grilled in butter with onions and flour stirred in water with salt pepper Lecso Hungary Czech Republic Thick vegetable stew which features peppers tomato onion lard salt sugar ground paprika as a base recipe Lobster stew Spain Menorca Stew made from lobster which is added to a sofrito with onion tomato garlic and parsley then boiled is eaten with thin slices of bread Locro Peru Ecuador Bolivia Argentina Hearty thick stew whose main ingredients are corn some form of meat usually beef but sometimes beef jerky or chorizo vegetables Other ingredients vary widely typically include onion beans squash or pumpkin Lunggoi Katsa Tibet Dish consisting of stewed sheep s head with curry fennel monosodium glutamate salt Maafe West Africa Stew that is made from lamb beef chicken cooked with a sauce based on tomatoes groundnuts peanuts Maconochie United Kingdom England Stew of sliced turnips and carrots in a thin soup that was especially made by the Maconochie Company for soldiers during World War I Mechado Philippines Stew of Spanish origin traditionally made with larded beef but now also made with leaner cuts Marinating in soy sauce and calamansi juice give it a Filipino flavor Mjave lobio Georgia Dish of stewed beans tomatoes onion Moambe Central Africa Dish prepared with a sauce usually made from the pericarp not the seeds of palm nuts the fruit of the African oil palm Mocoto Brazil Portugal Dish made from cow s feet stewed with beans vegetables Molagoottal India South Indian stew with coconut and lentils as a base Mulligan stew United States Dish similar to Irish stew Brunswick stew or burgoo as improvised by American hobos from available scavenged ingredients such as squirrel or opossum Navarin France French ragout stew of lamb mutton Often vegetables are added Ndole Cameroon National dish of Cameroon a stew of nuts ndoleh bitter leaves indigenous to West Africa fish ground beef Nikujaga Japan Japanese dish of meat potatoes onion stewed in sweetened soy sauce sometimes with ito konnyaku and vegetables Olla podrida Spain Spanish stew made from pork beans an inconsistent wide variety of other meats vegetables often including chickpeas depending on the recipe used Ollada Spain Valencia Stew based on boiling vegetables meat in a casserole Ostropel Romania Stew that is primarily made from chicken mixed with a thick tomato sauce Oyster stew United States Stew made from oysters with milk cream Paila marina Chile Typical stew that is usually made of a shellfish stock containing different kinds of cooked shellfish fish These are complemented with a variety of herbs spices such as garlic cilantro onion Palaver sauce West Africa Stew popular in Western Africa that has many regional varieties may contain beef fish shrimp pepitas cassava taro cocoyam leaves and palm oil It is served with boiled rice potatoes garri fufu or yams Paomo China Stew of chopped-up baked unleavened bread cooked in lamb broth served with lamb meat It is often eaten with pickled garlic and chilli sauce Pasulj also known as Grah Serbia Montenegro Bosnia Croatia Slovenia A bean soup made of usually white cranberry pinto beans It is normally prepared with meat particularly smoked meat such as smoked bacon sausage ham hock is a typical winter dish Philadelphia Pepper Pot United States Pennsylvania Thick stew of beef tripe vegetables other seasonings originates in the cuisine of the Pennsylvania Dutch Pichelsteiner Germany German stew that consists of several types of meats vegetables Common ingredients are beef pork mutton as well as potatoes carrots and leek Pinangat Philippines Filipino stew made of taro leaves chilli meat and coconut milk wrapped in gabi leaves tied securely with coconut leaf Piperade Spain Basque country Typical Basque dish prepared with onion green peppers tomatoes sauteed flavored with red Espelette pepper 3 Pisto Spain Murcia Stew made of tomatoes onions eggplant or courgettes green red peppers and olive oil P rk lt Hungary Hungarian stew that consists of meat paprika sometimes vegetables but no potatoes It should not be confused with goulash which does always contain potatoes is more like a soup Pot-au-feu France French beef stew Other ingredients may differ from region to region but commonly various kinds of vegetables are included such as carrots turnips leeks celery onions Potjiekos South Africa South African stew that is usually prepared outdoors The recipe commonly contains meat vegetables starches like rice potatoes all slow-cooked with Dutch-Malay spices the distinctive spicing of South Africa s early culinary melting pot Other common ingredients include fruits flour-based products like pasta Pottage United Kingdom Thick soup stew made by boiling vegetables grains and if available meat fish Pottage commonly consisted of various ingredients easily available to serfs and peasants could be kept over the fire for a period of days during which time some of it was eaten more ingredients added The result was a dish that was slowly but constantly evolving a perpetual stew Pozole Mexico Mexican stew with ritual significance made from maize with meat usually pork chicken turkey or pork rinds with chili peppers other seasonings garnishes Vegetarian vegan versions also exist Puchero South America Spain Stew whose ingredients may vary greatly according to region Its equivalent may be the Spanish cocido Qoiri Tibet Stew of mutton chops made with flour shredded wheat chilli dry curd cheese water salt Rabbit stew A stew prepared using rabbit or hare as a main ingredient Ragout France Refers to a main-dish stew Ragouts may be prepared with without meat a wide variety of vegetables may be incorporated they may be more less heavily spiced seasoned Pictured is ragout with lentils Ratatouille France Provence Vegetable stew from the Provence that consists mainly of tomatoes with garlic onions courgettes zucchini aubergine eggplant poivron bell peppers marjoram and basil or bay leaf and thyme a mix of green herbs such as herbes de Provence Red cooked pork China Braised stew made with soy sauce Chinese rice wine caramelized sugar spices Usually made with pork but other meats such as beef chicken are also cooked in this style R ssypottu Finland Stew made using potatoes pottu peruna some pork the main ingredient so-called r ssy i e blood pudding made of blood beer rye flour some spices Rogan Josh India An aromatic lamb stew of Persian origin which is one of the signature recipes of Kashmiri cuisine Rogan josh consists of braised lamb chunks cooked with a gravy based on browned onions shallots yogurt garlic ginger aromatic spices cloves bay leaves cardamom cinnamon Rubaboo North America Basic stew porridge consumed by coureurs des bois and voyageurs fur traders as well as Metis people from North America traditionally made of peas corn or both with grease bear or pork a thickening agent bread flour Sagamite North America Native-American stew made from hominy or Indian corn Additional ingredients may include vegetables wild rice brown sugar animal fat beans smoked fish animal brains Saksang Indonesia Spicy stew made from minced pork or dog meat or more rarely water buffalo meat stewed in blood coconut milk spices Saltah Yemen Considered the national dish of Yemen the base is a brown meat stew called maraq with fenugreek froth and sahawiq or sahowqa a mixture of chillies tomatoes garlic and herbs ground into a salsa Common additions are rice potatoes scrambled eggs and vegetables Scouse United Kingdom England Variation of labskaus a type of meat beef stew Seco Ecuador Stewed meat Sekba Indonesia Chinese Indonesian pork offals stewed in mild soy sauce -based soup The stew tastes mildly sweet salty made from soy sauce garlic Chinese herbs Semur Indonesia Type of meat stew that is processed in thick brown gravy The main material used in semur gravy is shallots onions garlic kecap manis sweet soy sauce nutmeg and cloves Shiro Eritrea Homogenous stew whose primary ingredient is powdered chickpeas or broad bean meal Sinigang Philippines Filipino soup stew characterized by its sour flavor most often associated with tamarind sampalok Skirts kidneys Ireland Irish stew made from pork pork kidneys Sonofabitch stew United States Western Cowboy dish consisting of whatever is on hand Most recipes call for meat and offal from a calf Sulu k fte Turkey Soup-like stew with k fte meatballs in the dish Tajine North Africa Berber dish from North Africa that is named after the special earthenware pot in which it is cooked It includes different ingredients according to region but commonly several kinds of vegetables meats spices Tas kebap Turkey Veal or mutton stew with potatoes Tatws Pum Munud Wales Traditional Welsh stew made with smoked bacon stock potatoes other vegetables Tharid Arab world Dish made from pieces of bread in a vegetable meat broth Pictured is lamb tharid Tocan Romania Prepared with tomato garlic sweet paprika it is traditionally consumed with a cornmeal mush called m m lig Tomato bredie South Africa South African stew with Dutch origin that usually features mutton which is cooked for a very long time includes cinnamon cardamom ginger cloves and chili as seasonings Tombet Spain Mallorca Traditional vegetable stew that contains layers of sliced potatoes aubergines and red bell peppers previously fried in olive oil The aubergines red peppers should not be peeled The whole is topped with tomato fried with garlic and parsley presented in a way that it looks like a pie without a crust Tuna pot Spain Basque country Fish stew that was eaten on tuna fishing boats in the Cantabrian Sea a beautiful simple dish with potatoes onions pimientos tomatoes Wat food Ethiopia Eritrea Stew curry which may be prepared with meat such as chicken beef lamb a variety of vegetables with spice mixtures such as berbere and niter kibbeh a seasoned clarified butter Waterblommetjiebredie South Africa Meat typically lamb stewed together with waterblommetjies Aponogeton distachyos flowers commonly known as Cape pondweed Cape hawthorn Cape asparagus Literally means small water flower stew in Afrikaans Waterzooi Belgium Flanders Stew made of fish chicken vegetables carrots leeks potatoes herbs eggs cream and butter Zoervleis Limburg region Belgium and the Netherlands Traditional dish similar to German sauerbraten which features meat normally horse meat that was marinated in vinegar apple cider Contrary to what one would expect it is sweet as it is served with gingerbread African non-gmo Natural foods Ecological farming Organic The Non-GMO Project Acaraje Brazil Peeled beans formed into a ball then deep-fried in dende palm oil 4 Aloo chaat India Northern and Pakistan Prepared by frying potatoes in oil adding spices and chutney Aloo tikki 5 India Northern 6 A snack made out of boiled potatoes onions various spices Anticucho South America Small pieces of meat traditionally beef heart that are marinated in vinegar spices grilled served on a stick Anticucho originated in Peru is now common throughout South America 7 It is sold in food stalls named anticucheras 7 Arancini Italy Sicily Stuffed rice balls coated with bread crumbs then deep fried they are usually filled with ragu meat tomato sauce mozzarella peas 8 Arepa 9 Colombia Venezuela A flat round unleavened patty of soaked ground kernels of maize or maize meal flour that can be grilled baked fried boiled steamed 10 Asinan Indonesia A vegetable fruit dish that is pickled with brine or vinegar Bagel Poland Jewish communities originally then New York City and other locations A ring-shaped bread roll made with dough that is boiled in water for a short time then baked the result is a dense chewy interior with a browned sometimes crisp exterior 11 12 Bakso 13 Indonesia A soup with meatballs noodles other ingredients the meatballs are commonly made from finely ground beef with a small quantity of tapioca flour salt however bakso can also be made from other ingredients such as chicken pork fish shrimp 14 Banana cue Philippines Deep-fried bananas coated in caramelized brown sugar after cooking they are served on skewers 15 16 Banh canh 17 Vietnam A thick noodle that can be made from tapioca flour a mixture of rice and tapioca flour a b it is used in several dishes Banh h i Vietnam A dish consisting of rice vermicelli woven into intricate bundles often topped with chopped scallions or garlic chives sauteed in oil served with a complementary meat dish Banh m 20 Vietnam A type of meat-filled sandwich on banh m bread the bread is similar to a baguette but airier with a thinner crust various fillings are used most commonly some kind of pork chicken 21 22 Banh xeo Vietnam A savory fried pancake made of rice flour water turmeric powder stuffed with slivers of fatty pork shrimp diced green onion bean sprouts 23 24 Batagor Indonesia Fried fish dumplings usually served with peanut sauce Batagor is an abbreviation of ba kso ta hu gor eng which literally means fried tofu meatballs it s a variant of siomay in which the dumpling is deep-fried instead of steamed Batata vada India Maharashtra A mashed potato patty coated with chickpea flour then deep-fried served hot with chutney a thick sphere around two three inches in diameter 25 Belgian waffle 26 Belgium United States In North America the Belgian waffle is a variety of waffle with a lighter batter larger squares deeper pockets than ordinary American waffles In Belgium itself there are several kinds of waffle including the Brussels waffle and the Liege waffle none of them called Belgian Beondegi South Korea Steamed boiled silkworm pupae which are seasoned and eaten as a snack c Bhelpuri 28 29 India A savoury snack bhelpuri is a type of chaat made from puffed rice vegetables a tangy tamarind sauce 30 31 Boureka Israel by way of the Balkans Baked puff pastry dough or filo dough with any of various fillings such as cheese spinach potatoes 32 33 Bramborak Czech Republic Czech potato pancake is called bramborak from brambor potato it is made of grated potatoes with egg breadcrumbs flour seasoning salt pepper most importantly garlic marjoram sometimes ground cracked whole caraway seeds is served as it is Bratwurst 34 Germany A sausage typically made with pork and veal usually seasoned with ginger nutmeg coriander caraway recipes for the sausage vary by region 35 Bread pakora India A fried snack made with bread slices gram flour spices sometimes it is stuffed with mashed potatoes Breakfast burrito United States Southwestern Breakfast items such as scrambled eggs fried potatoes cheese wrapped inside a flour tortilla 36 invented in Santa Fe New Mexico 37 Brochette 38 France and elsewhere Various meats vegetables cooked sometimes served on brochettes or skewers Bublik or baranka Ukraine Russia Belarus A ring-shaped bread roll similar to a bagel but somewhat larger denser sweeter 39 Bubur ayam 40 Indonesia A porridge of rice shredded chicken served with soy sauce spices fried shallots cakwee fried dough krupuk a type of cracker and sambal a hot sauce often eaten for breakfast 41 Bun cha Vietnam Grilled fatty pork ch over a plate of white rice noodles bun herbs with a side dish of dipping sauce 42 Bun kebab Pakistan Karachi and elsewhere A fried patty of ground lentils chicken beef egg batter spices served on a bun with chutney on the side 43 44 Bunny chow South Africa 45 A hollowed-out loaf of bread filled with curry 46 47 Burrito 48 Mexico United States Consists of a wheat flour tortilla wrapped folded into a cylindrical shape to completely enclose various fillings that are used Calzone 49 Italy United States A turnover of pizza dough stuffed with pizza ingredients such as mozzarella ricotta cheeses tomato sauce sausage 50 Camote cue 51 Philippines Slices of sweet potato deep fried with a coating of caramelized brown sugar sometimes served on a bamboo skewer 52 Carrozza Italy Campania A type of fried cheese sandwich that is prepared by frying mozzarella cheese between slices of bread 53 Ceviche 54 Latin America Ceviche is a street food in Peru where it is considered to be a national dish 55 Chaat 56 India Northern Pakistan elsewhere in South Asia A type of savory snack a mixture of ingredients it often includes fried dough potatoes chickpeas chutney tangy spices 57 58 Chiburekki Caucasus Central Asia Russia Ukraine Turkey A deep-fried turnover with a filling of ground minced beef mutton with onions spices 59 Chicharron 60 61 Latin America Fried pork rinds 62 Chiko Roll 63 Australia Brand name for a deep-fried food similar to an egg roll with a thick chewy dough wrapper stuffed with mutton barley cabbage carrots celery rice seasonings 64 Chimi de pierna Dominican Republic A sandwich of pulled pork leg sliced cabbage other ingredients usually chopped on a griddle with custom seasoning A cheaper variation using processed meat is also common usually called chimi burger just chimi Chimichanga 65 United States Southwestern A deep-fried burrito 66 Chinese bhel India Mumbai A dish of Indian Chinese cuisine made with fried noodles sauteed vegetables onions spices 67 Chivito Uruguay 45 A large sandwich of churrasco grilled thinly-sliced filet mignon on a roll with mozzarella lettuce tomatoes mayonnaise other ingredients such as bacon ham eggs 68 Choripan Argentina 69 A sausage of beef pork grilled split lengthwise served on a roll with various condiments the name is a combination of the words chorizo sausage and pan bread 70 Chuan China Small pieces of meat on skewers roasted over charcoal deep frying in oil Chuan was traditionally made from lamb but chicken pork beef various types of seafood can also be used Grilled corn 23 71 Southeast Asia Corn on the cob grilled with coconut milk sugar and pandan leaf 72 73 Corn dog 74 United States A hot dog on a stick coated with cornmeal batter deep fried 75 76 Covrigi Romania A covrig is a baked twisted piece of dough similar to a pretzel it is usually topped with sesame seeds poppy seeds and or salt 77 Coxinha Brazil Chopped shredded chicken meat covered in dough molded into a shape resembling a chicken leg battered fried 78 Crepe 26 France A type of very thin pancake Crepes are a very common street food in Paris France 79 Currywurst d 80 81 Germany A fried pork sausage topped with curry ketchup and curry powder served either whole cut up sometimes with French fries on the side 82 Dahi puri India Maharashtra A type of chaat made with puri an unleavened deep-fried bread chickpeas potatoes chili powder chutney 83 Dak-kkochi South Korea Grilled chicken skewers The meat is first cooked cut into narrow slices then it is coated with barbecue-flavor spices Mayonnaise mustard may also be used as toppings 84 85 Danger dog Mexico A hot dog wrapped in bacon either deep-fried grilled often sold by unlicensed vendors 86 87 Dim sum 88 China Small bite-sized portions of food served in small steamer baskets on small plates Doner kebab e 89 Turkey Germany elsewhere Meat often veal mixed with lamb cooked on a vertical rotisserie usually served wrapped in a flatbread with salad condiments 90 Doubles Trinidad Tobago Caribbean with Indian influence It is a sandwich made with two baras flat fried bread filled with curry channa curried chick peas Topped with either mango aam shadon beni bandaniya cucumber kheera coconut naariyal tomato damadol or tamarind imalee chutney extra pepper sauce This delicacy is the most popular fast food in Trinidad Tobago Doubles are eaten for breakfast sometimes for lunch often at night but can be a late night snack too 91 Doughnut e United States elsewhere A ring-shaped pastry made with deep-fried flour dough with frosting glazing a sweet filling 93 94 Douhua China A soft pudding made from tofu depending on what is added to it douhua can be either savory sweet 95 Durum 96 Turkey Europe A wrap that is usually filled with typical d ner kebab ingredients 97 or other types of Turkish kebab Egg waffle 98 Hong Kong A fluffy waffle made with eggy leavened batter cooked between two plates of semi-spherical cells usually served plain 99 Elote Mexico Corn on the cob grilled then coated with condiments such as butter mayonnaise salt chili powder anejo cheese lime juice sometimes served on a stick 100 Empanada 34 South America A turnover made with pastry dough any of various savory fillings usually including some kind of ground chopped meat most often it is baked but sometimes it is fried 101 Enchilada 102 Mexico A corn tortilla rolled around a filling covered with a chili pepper sauce Enchiladas can be filled with a variety of ingredients Espetinhos Brazil 103 Small pieces of beef chicken other meat grilled on skewers usually served with hot sauce on the side 104 Esquites Mexico Fresh grains of corn are first boiled in salted water then sauteed in butter with onions chile peppers spices the result is served hot in small cups topped with lime juice chile powder hot sauce salt mayonnaise 105 106 Falafel 107 Middle East Deep-fried balls of ground chickpeas or sometimes fava beans often served with salad and tahini sauce in pita or a wrap 32 108 Farinata 109 Italy France A thin unleavened pancake crepe of chickpea flour originating in Genoa and later a typical food of the Ligurian Sea coast from Nice to Elba island Fish chips e 110 United Kingdom and Ireland Large fillets of batter-fried whitefish served with square-cut chunky chips i e French fries 111 112 Fish balls 113 China Southern Southeast Asia Small round dumplings made from fish paste fish that has been made into a paste either by fermentation by physical pounding 114 115 Fish taco Mexico Baja California and elsewhere 116 A taco filled with batter-fried whitefish other ingredients such as guacamole salsa 117 Focaccia Italy 118 A flatbread similar in style composition texture to pizza dough topped with cheese herbs other ingredients 119 French fries 120 Europe the United States Sliced potatoes that are typically deep fried The dish can also be baked 121 122 Fried chicken 123 Thailand Chicken pieces that are deep-fried with coriander garlic fish sauce pepper other spices 124 125 Frybread United States Southwestern A flat dough fried deep-fried in oil shortening or lard and generally leavened with baking powder 34 126 Funnel cake d United States A sweet snack made by pouring batter through a funnel into hot cooking oil in a circular pattern letting it deep-fry then sprinkling it with powdered sugar 127 Galette-saucisse France Brittany A pork sausage wrapped in a buckwheat pancake 128 129 Ginanggang Philippines Pieces of saba banana on a stick brushed with margarine sprinkled with sugar grilled over charcoal 130 131 G i cu n Vietnam Pork prawns vegetables bun thin rice noodles other ingredients wrapped in banh trang a thin wrapper made from rice flour similar to spring rolls g i cu n are sometimes called summer rolls 132 Gorengan 133 Indonesia A gorengan is a type of fritter Many varieties are sold on traveling carts by street vendors Various kinds of ingredients are battered deep fried such as pisang goreng banana fritter tempeh tahu goreng fried tofu oncom sweet potato cassava chunk cassava flour and breadfruit these are often eaten accompanied by fresh bird s eye chili Grilled cheese sandwich 134 135 United States A sandwich of melted cheese on toasted bread many variations exist but originally it was made by heating buttered bread slices of American cheese in a skillet 136 Gukhwappang South Korea Small pastries that are shaped like chrysanthemum flowers filled with red bean paste 137 Gyeranppang 138 South Korea A fluffy bread roll with an egg in it 139 140 Gyro 34 Greece Meat generally lamb pork and or beef cooked on a vertical rotisserie usually served wrapped in a flatbread such as pita with cucumber tomato onion and tzatziki sauce 141 142 Haleem 143 Middle East Central Asia Pakistan India A stew made with wheat barley lentils lamb other meat 144 Halo-halo Philippines 145 A cold dessert that is a mixture of shaved ice evaporated milk various other ingredients for example caramelized plantains jackfruit tapioca sugar palm fruit coconut sweet potato boiled kidney beans flan 146 Hamburger e United States elsewhere A cooked patty of ground beef served on a bun roll often with toppings such as lettuce tomatoes onions ketchup a hamburger with cheese is known as a cheeseburger 147 148 Hokkien mee Singapore 149 Malaysia Penang 150 Rice noodles egg noodles with prawns pork chicken egg bean sprouts other ingredients served with soy sauce sambal chili pepper sauce 151 Hot dog e 152 153 United States A sausage usually made with beef and or pork grilled steamed served in a sliced bun with mustard other condiments 154 Ice cream e Europe North America elsewhere Frozen sweetened milk and or cream often combined with fruits other ingredients flavors 155 Ice cream cone 54 156 United States elsewhere Ice cream served on an edible cone-shaped pastry that is somewhat similar to a thin crispy waffle this allows the ice cream to be eaten without a dish utensils 157 Imqaret Malta A sweet made with pastry a filling of dates usually infused with the flavours of aniseed and bay leaf that is then deep fried 158 Isaw 159 Philippines Chicken intestines that are cleaned boiled put on a skewer grilled over charcoal they are served with a dipping sauce of either spiced vinegar barbecue sauce 160 Jerk chicken Jamaica 161 Chicken is first soaked in a spicy marinade that commonly includes allspice berries Scotch bonnet peppers thyme scallions fresh ginger then it is smoked over charcoal at a high temperature resting on top of green logs of allspice wood under a metal cover 162 163 Jerusalem mixed grill 32 Israel Jerusalem Chicken livers gizzards hearts that are braised with various spices then grilled served either on a plate as a sandwich in pita bread 164 Jiaozi 165 China Dumplings with a ground meat and or vegetable filling wrapped in a thin piece of dough they are often steamed but they can also be fried boiled 166 Kaassouffle 167 Netherlands Melted cheese inside a thin dough-based wrap which has been breaded then deep-fried 168 Kai yang Laos and Thailand A chicken that is marinated then grilled over charcoal the marinade typically includes fish sauce garlic turmeric coriander root and white pepper 169 170 Kapsalon Netherlands Russia French fries topped with d ner or shawarma meat grilled with a layer of Gouda cheese until melted then covered with a layer of dressed salad greens often served with garlic sauce and sambal hot sauce 171 172 Kati roll India Kolkata A skewer-roasted kebab or other meat wrapped in a paratha or other bread 173 Kebab 56 Middle East elsewhere Small pieces of meat that have been grilled often on a skewer over charcoal Kerak telor Indonesia Betawi Spicy coconut omelette made from glutinous rice cooked with egg served with serundeng fried shredded coconut fried shallots dried shrimp as topping Popular street food in Jakarta Indonesia Ketoprak 133 Indonesia Betawi A vegetarian dish from Jakarta Indonesia consists of tofu vegetables rice cake rice vermicelli served in peanut sauce Khachapuri Georgia Bread stuffed with flavorful cheese an egg 174 175 Khanom Tokyo Thailand A thin flat pancake filled with sweet custard cream sometimes with a savory filling like pork sausage then rolled into a cylinder 176 Knish United States New York City before that Belarus Ukraine Lithuania Poland and Jewish communities from former Pale of Settlement A baked turnover of dough with any of various fillings such as potatoes ground beef 177 178 179 Korean taco 180 Canada United States A Korean-Mexican fusion dish consisting of Korean -style fillings such as bulgogi and kimchi placed on top of small traditional Mexican corn tortillas Kofta Middle East North Africa elsewhere Balls small patties of minced ground meat usually beef chicken lamb pork mixed with spices onions 181 Kottu Sri Lanka Godamba roti a type of flatbread is chopped up mixed with chicken beef eggs spices the mixture is grilled garnished with onion chili peppers other spices 182 Kyinkyinga Ghana and elsewhere in West Africa A beef kebab prepared with steak meat liver crusted with peanut flour 183 It is common in West Africa 183 Laksa 184 Southeast Asia Peranakan cuisine A spicy soup with rice noodles usually either fish prawns chicken many different variations exist with most based either on rich spicy curry coconut milk on slightly sour tamarind 185 186 Langos Hungary A deep-fried flatbread served with various toppings such as sour cream grated cheese 187 188 Lok-lok Malaysia A wide variety of different food items are served on skewers The customer selects the skewers they want which are then cooked in boiling oil water A variety of dipping sauces are also provided At the end the customer pays based on the number of color-coded skewers 150 189 190 191 Malakoff Switzerland Fried cheese balls sticks Malatang 192 China Various foods cooked in a hot pot of spicy soup the ingredients are on skewers that are selected by the customer 193 194 Maruya Philippines Saba bananas cut into thin slices coated with batter deep-fried then sprinkled with sugar 195 Masala puri India A type of chaat made with crushed puri a type of fried bread mixed with peas masala various spices 196 Meat patty 197 Jamaica A pastry that contains various fillings and spices baked inside a flaky shell Meat pie 198 Australia New Zealand A hand-sized meat pie containing largely diced or minced meat and gravy sometimes with onion mushrooms cheese often consumed as a takeaway food snack Medu vada India Southern Sri Lanka A fritter made from deep fried urad dal black lentil batter it is usually made in a doughnut shape with a crispy exterior soft interior 199 Mie ayam 200 self-published source Indonesia Chinese Indonesian Chicken noodles of seasoned yellow wheat noodles topped with seasoned diced chicken meat ayam It is a popular street food in Indonesia sold by travelling food cart Mohinga Myanmar A hot sour soup made with catfish and rice noodles often eaten for breakfast 201 It is considered to be a national dish of Myanmar 202 Murtabak 203 Middle East Southern to Southeastern Asia A stuffed pancake pan-fried bread made from minced meat beef chicken sometimes mutton along with garlic egg onion is eaten with curry gravy Obwarzanek krakowski Poland A braided ring-shaped bread that is boiled sprinkled with salt poppy seeds sesame seeds etc before being baked Pad Thai 204 205 Thailand Rice noodles which are stir-fried with eggs chopped tofu flavored with tamarind pulp fish sauce nampla dried shrimp garlic shallots red chili pepper palm sugar served with lime wedges often chopped roast peanuts Panelle Italy Sicily A panelle is a chickpea fritter a patty made with gram flour is deep-fried usually served as a sandwich sometimes with a side of crocche mashed potatoes egg covered in bread crumbs fried 206 Pani ca meusa Italy Sicily Chopped veal spleen lungs boiled then fried in lard served on a soft bread called vastedda 207 208 209 Panini 26 Italy France A sandwich of various ingredients on a bread roll heated on a press contact grill Panipuri 210 India A round hollow puri a type of bread fried crisp filled with a mixture of flavored water pani tamarind chutney chili chaat masala potato onion chickpeas 211 Panucho Mexico Yucatan 212 A corn tortilla that is filled with black bean paste refried then topped with turkey chicken lettuce avocado pickles 213 Panzerotti 49 214 Italy An fried turnover filled with mozzarella cheese tomato sauce other pizza ingredients 215 Papri chaat 216 India North Bangladesh and Pakistan Traditionally prepared using crisp fried dough wafers known as papri along with boiled chick peas boiled potatoes yogurt and tamarind chutney 217 218 and topped with chaat masala and sev 217 219 Pasty 220 United Kingdom Meat vegetables baked inside shortcrust pastry dough pasties are particularly associated with Cornwall in England 221 Pav Bhaji 222 India Maharashtra A thick vegetable curry bhaji served with a soft bread roll pav 223 Pecel Lele 133 Indonesia Javanese Deep-fried catfish served with traditional sambal chili paste often served with fried tempeh steamed rice Usually sold in street-side humble tent warung Pempek 224 Indonesia Palembang A savoury fishcake delicacy from Palembang Indonesia made of the mixture of fish tapioca dough Pempek is served with yellow noodles a dark rich sweet sour sauce called kuah cuka lit vinegar sauce Pepito f Venezuela A sandwich similar to a torta with beef sometimes chicken on a bun baguette condiments sauces of the buyer s choice 226 227 Peremech Russia Tatarstan Bashkortostan A deep-fried pastry with meat filling known in Russia as a belyash 228 Pho Vietnam A noodle soup of broth rice noodles herbs meat 23 229 Picarones 230 Peru Its principal ingredients are squash and sweet potato it is served in a doughnut form covered with syrup made from chancaca solidified molasses It is traditional to serve picarones when people prepare anticuchos another traditional Peruvian dish Pilaf 71 Central Asia Middle East South Asia Rice cooked in a seasoned broth various additional ingredients are sometimes used Mussels filled with rice is a common street food in Istanbul Turkey 231 Pirozhki Russia Ukraine Individual-sized baked fried buns stuffed with a variety of fillings Pizza 232 Italy elsewhere in Europe North America A thinly rolled bread dough crust topped with tomato sauce cheese other ingredients such as small pieces of meat vegetables baked in an oven 233 Pizza al taglio 234 235 Italy Pizza baked in large rectangular trays cut into rectangular slices which are sold by weight 236 Pizzetta 49 Italy A small pizza 237 that can range in size as a finger food at around three inches in diameter 238 239 to that of a small personal-sized pizza 240 241 Pl cint Romania and Moldova A traditional pastry resembling a thin small round square-shaped cake usually filled with a soft cheese such as Urd or apples Poisson cru French Polynesia 242 Raw tuna other fish marinated in lime lemon juice mixed with vegetables such as cucumber tomato scallion with coconut milk poured over it poisson cru means raw fish the dish is also known as ota ika 243 Poutine Canada Quebec 244 French fries and cheese curds topped with a light brown gravy 245 246 Pretzel d 80 247 Europe A type of baked bread product made from dough most commonly shaped into a twisted knot Proben Philippines The proventriculus part of the digestive system of a chicken breaded with corn starch and deep fried served either in a small bagful of vinegar skewered on bamboo sticks to be dipped in the vinegar just before it is eaten sometimes served with puso rice dumplings 248 Punugulu India Coastal Andhra A deep fried snack made with rice urad dal other spices 249 Pupusa El Salvador Thick corn tortillas that are stuffed with various fillings such as pork chicken refried beans and or cheese often served with curtido a lightly fermented cabbage relish 250 251 Quail eggs 252 Asia Europe North America The eggs of a quail are prepared many different ways in various regions in some countries they are sold as street food for example in the Philippines kwek kwek are hard-boiled quail eggs that are covered with an orange-colored batter deep-fried 253 Quesadilla 254 Mexico A tortilla that is filled with cheese and sometimes other ingredients grilled 255 Ra nji i 256 Serbia Pieces of marinated pork other meat grilled on skewers 257 Rellenitos de Platano 258 Guatemala Egg-shaped balls of cooked mashed plantains stuffed with a mixture of refried black beans chocolate cinnamon deep-fried served with powdered sugar honey on top 259 260 Roasted cockles Cambodia Cockles that are roasted then served with olive oil seasonings 261 Rojak Malaysia Indonesia A salad made with a mixture of fruits vegetables savory spices 262 Roti 34 South Asia elsewhere An unleavened flatbread made with atta a finely-ground whole wheat flour when making roti sometimes known as chapati the dough is heated on a flat griddle 263 264 Roujiamo 265 China A sandwich of chopped meat traditionally braised pork that has been stewed in a soup containing many spices served on a bun sometimes written as rou jia mo it originated in Shaanxi Province 266 Rustico Italy Mozzarella cheese chopped tomatoes and bechamel sauce placed between two round pieces of puff pastry baked rustico originated in the Salento region of Italy 267 Sabich Israel Pita stuffed with fried eggplant and hard-boiled eggs with salad sauces such as tahini hummus mango chutney 268 Sabudana vada 269 India Maharashtra A deep-fried fritter made from sabudana small balls of tapioca potatoes flavored with peanuts coriander chili powder 270 Samosa 34 56 India A deep-fried triangular turnover filled with vegetables especially potatoes meat 271 Sardenara Italy Liguria 272 Dough covered with tomato sauce topped with anchovies black olives onions garlic baked in an oven sardenara is similar to focaccia or pizza 273 Satay 133 Indonesia Thailand A dish of seasoned skewered grilled meat usually served in peanut sauce A popular street food throughout Southeast Asia from Indonesia Malaysia Singapore Thailand Pork satay is popular in Thailand 274 Sausage roll 275 United Kingdom Pork sausage meat wrapped in glazed puff pastry baked 276 Scaccia Italy Sicily A type of tomato cheese pie very thin pizza dough is covered with tomato sauce grated cheese folded over a number of times baked 277 Scallion pancake China Pancakes made with soft dough and scallions green onions they are cooked by being fried in oil 278 Seblak Indonesia Sundanese A savoury spicy dish made of wet krupuk traditional Indonesian crackers cooked with protein sources egg chicken seafood beef in spicy sauce Sev puri 279 India A type of chaat a savory snack made with puri an unleavened deep-fried bread potatoes onions several types of chutney and sev small pieces of crunchy noodles made from chickpea flour 280 Sfenj 281 Morocco and elsewhere in the Maghreb A sfenj is a deep-fried food similar to a doughnut It is made with sticky unsweetened dough usually sprinkled with powdered sugar Traditionally it is eaten for breakfast at tea time 282 Sfincione Italy Sicily A type of pizza with a thick soft crust topped with tomato sauce onions caciocavallo cheese anchovies 283 284 Shaokao 285 China Heavily spiced barbecued foods on skewers 286 Shashlik 287 Eastern Central Europe Central Western Asia Pieces of marinated lamb other meat grilled on skewers Shawarma Middle East Meat usually lamb and or veal chicken cooked on a vertical rotisserie served in pita a similar bread wrap on a plate often with tahini sauce other condiments 288 289 Siomay 133 Indonesia Chinese Indonesian A steamed fish dumpling with vegetables served in peanut sauce It is derived from Chinese Shumai considered a light meal that is similar to the Chinese dim sum A popular street food sold by cart bicycle food vendors Sma en s r Czech Republic A slice of cheese which is usually Edam but may also be Hermelin about 1 5 cm thick is first breaded with flour egg bread crumbs then fried either in a pan deep-fat fryer It is often served accompanied by a side salad potatoes fries boiled potatoes and typically tartar sauce The dish may also be prepared with a thin slice of ham inserted between two slices of cheese in Czech fast food outlets it is often served in the form of a sandwich in something similar to a hamburger bun Soto 133 Indonesia A spicy soup of meat vegetables many variations exist 290 Souvlaki 34 Greece Small pieces of meat usually pork grilled on a skewer served either in a pita wrap on a plate 291 Stigghiola Italy Sicily The intestines of a sheep goat placed on a skewer flavored with parsley onions cooked on an open grill 292 It is one of the most common street foods in Palermo Sicily 293 Suppl Italy 294 Italian snacks consisting of a ball of rice generally risotto with tomato sauce raw egg typical of Roman cuisine 295 296 Taco 297 Mexico A corn flour tortilla with any of various fillings 298 299 Tacos al pastor Mexico Mexico City 300 Al pastor is a dish developed in Central Mexico likely as a result of the adoption of the shawarma spit-grilled meat brought by the Lebanese immigrants to Mexico 301 Being derived from shawarma it is also similar to the Turkish d ner kebab and the Greek gyros Tahri India Awadhi cuisine Basmati rice potatoes flavored with turmeric and other spices a type of vegetarian biryani 302 303 Tahu gejrot Indonesia A spicy tofu dish food from Cirebon a port town in West Java Indonesia Tahu gejrot consists of tahu pong a type of hollow tahu goreng fried tofu cut into small pieces It is served with a thin watery dressing that is made by blending palm sugar vinegar sweet soy sauce Tahu sumedang Indonesia A deep-fried tofu from Sumedang West Java Tajine North Africa 304 A slow-cooked savory stew made with meat poultry fish together with vegetables fruit and or nuts it is cooked in a large clay pot 305 Takoyaki 306 Japan A ball-shaped snack made of a wheat flour-based batter cooked in a special moulded pan It is typically filled with minced diced octopus tako tempura scraps tenkasu pickled ginger green onion Tamale 307 Mesoamerica Masa a corn-based dough made from hominy combined with various savory ingredients spices steamed in a corn husk the wrapping is discarded before eating 308 Tangbao 309 China A large dumpling filled with chicken broth pork 310 Taquito 311 Mexico A corn tortilla wrapped around various fillings then fried taquito means little taco 312 Tauge goreng Indonesia A savoury vegetarian dish made of stir fried tauge bean sprouts with slices of tofu ketupat or lontong rice cake yellow noodle served in spicy oncom -based sauce Tlayuda Mexico Oaxaca A very large dense corn tortilla with refried beans asiento rendered lard and Oaxaca cheese some kind of meat such as pork chicken various toppings often including salsa guacamole served either flat of folded in half 313 Tokneneng 314 Philippines Hard-boiled chicken eggs covered with an orange-colored batter deep-fried 315 Torta Mexico A large sandwich with any of various meat fillings other flavorful ingredients served on a telera or similar bread often eaten at lunch time 316 It is a common street food in Mexico City Mexico 317 Trdelnik Czech Republic and Slovakia 318 A pastry made by wrapping dough around a stick roasting it over an open flame then sprinkling it with sugar cinnamon sometimes it is served with additional toppings 319 Ttongppang South Korea A pastry that is formed in the shape of human feces it is filled with red bean paste with walnut kernel 320 Turon 321 Philippines A type of banana fritter sliced saba bananas sometimes other fruit slices are put into in a spring roll wrapper rolled in sugar deep-fried 322 Vada pav India A vegetarian sandwich of a deep-fried potato patty on a bun garnished with coriander and other spices 323 324 Yakisoba Japan Wheat noodles grilled with various ingredients such as vegetables chicken pork coated with a slightly sweet savory sauce It is often served on a plate in a bowl Alternatively it is sometimes called yakisoba-pan served in a bun similar to a hot dog bun 325 Yakitori 34 Japan Skewers of charcoal grilled chicken seasoned with tare sauce Zapiekanka Poland An open-face sandwich made of half a baguette other long roll topped with sauteed white mushrooms cheese sometimes other ingredients toasted until the cheese melts served with ketchup 326 327 Acaraje Aloo chaat Aloo tikki Anticucho Apam balik Arancini Arepa Asinan Bagel
